question_src: Je! Kwa nini tuliamua kuwa maneno fulani yalikuwa "mbaya" na hayapaswi kutumiwa katika mipangilio ya kijamii?
report_src: Tulikubaliana kwamba maneno fulani ni “mbaya” kwa sababu yamekuwa zana za kuwanyima watu ubinadamu na hivyo kuendeleza ubaguzi; kwa mfano, ape na monkey yalitumika tangu miaka ya 1800 kuwalinganisha Waafrika-Waamerika na sokwe, jambo lililodhaniwa kisayansi wakati huo lakini lililolenga kuwathibitisha kuwa si binadamu kamili [2]. Vivyo hivyo, neno savage lilianza kutumiwa katika karne ya 1400 kuelezea watu wa asili waliotawaliwa na wakoloni, likiwapa sifa za “mkali na asiye na ustaarabu” na hivyo kuhalalisha unyanyasaji dhidi yao [3]. Kwa kuwa matumizi haya yalizaa madhara ya kijamii—kama vile ubaguzi wa kisheria, ubaguzi mahali pa kazi na msongo wa kisaikolojia—mahakama na jamii zimeweka kanuni zinazozuia hotuba ya aina hiyo ili kulinda heshima na ustawi wa walengwa, hata kama ushahidi wa kisayansi kuhusu madhara ya moja kwa moja ya neno bado ni mdogo [1]. Hivyo, neno linapopoteza maudhui yake ya jumla na kuwa ishara ya unyanyasaji, jamii huliorodhesha kama lisilofaa katika mazungumzo ya hadhara.

Document ID: 2
Title: All Of These Words Are Offensive (But Only Sometimes) (www.dictionary.com)
Content: So, where’s the problem?Ape and monkey are considered offensive terms when they’re used to describe a person of color. It’s what is known as dehumanizing language, “language that deprives a person of human qualities or attributes.”


Exactly when the words became slurs is unknown, but offensive comparisons of black people to apes date back hundreds of centuries. As recently as the late 1800s, for example, when scientists Josiah C. Nott and George R. Gliddon created the 1854 Types of Mankind (then the leading scientific text on race), they compared black people not to other (white) people but to chimpanzees, gorillas, and orangutans.


When used in these contexts, monkey and ape are considered extremely derogatory slang.

Document ID: 3
Title: All Of These Words Are Offensive (But Only Sometimes) (www.dictionary.com)
Content: The word savage has taken a circuitous path through the lexicon over the years, first showing up in English in the 1200s from Middle English. As an adjective, it’s typically meant “fierce, ferocious, or cruel; uncivilized; barbarous.” When referring to a savage lion ripping an antelope apart on the African Sahara, that’s all well and good.


But, the use of savage as a noun to describe human beings dates back to approximately the 1400s. At a time when Christopher Columbus was enslaving Native Americans and claiming their lands and work for his own, the word became a slur used by white Europeans to describe Native American people. The usage stuck around for hundreds of years, and it’s still a word that many indigenous peoples around the world find offensive.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: The Science of Swearing (www.psychologicalscience.org)
Content: Courts presume harm from speech in cases involving discrimination or sexual harassment. The original justification for our obscenity laws was predicated on an unfounded assumption that speech can deprave or corrupt children, but there is little (if any) social-science data demonstrating that a word in and of itself causes harm. A closely related problem is the manner in which harm has been defined — harm is most commonly framed in terms of standards and sensibilities such as religious values or sexual mores. Rarely are there attempts to quantify harm in terms of objectively measurable symptoms (e.g., sleep disorder, anxiety).

question_src: Kwa nini mtoto wa tar kutoka kwa "Wimbo wa Kusini" ni ubaguzi wa rangi?  Kwa nini, haswa, sinema kwa ujumla inachukuliwa kuwa ya ubaguzi wa rangi?
report_src: “Mtoto wa lami” ni ubaguzi kwa sababu neno “tar-baby” limetumika kama tusi la rangi dhidi ya Wamarekani Weusi, lakini katuni ya Splash Mountain inalitumia kana kwamba ni kisa kisicho na athari, hivyo kuendeleza kejeli hiyo ya kikabila [1]; hadithi ya “tar-baby” yenyewe, iliyoandikwa 1881 kama sehemu ya simulizi za Mjomba Remus, inatoka katika muktadha wa hadithi za watumwa ambazo zilifululizwa na waandishi Weupe na kuonesha Watu Weusi kama viumbe wajanja lakini waliokwama, jambo linalotukuza mitazamo ya kikoloni [2]. Filamu nzima ya “Wimbo wa Kusini” inadhaniwa kipindi cha Ujenzi Upya (miaka ya 1860–1870) ambapo mtoto Mzungu Johnny anashirikiana na mtumwa wa zamani Mjomba Remus “anayefanya kazi kwenye shamba” bila malalamiko, hivyo kupaka rangi ya upole na maridhiano miaka ya utumwa na ukandamizaji [3]. Taswira hii hufikia kilele kupitia trope ya “mtu mweusi mwenye nguvu, anayefurahi” kuishi na kutumikia waliokuwa wamiliki wake, jambo linalodhibitiwa na wakosoaji kuwa ni udhalilishaji unaofuta mateso halisi ya utumwa na kumfanya Mjomba Remus kuwa kielelezo cha “happy slave” [4]. Kwa jumla, matumizi la tusi la kivyombo, uwasilishaji wa hadithi za watumwa bila muktadha wa ukatili, na uromantisishaji wa mahusiano ya mabwana na watumwa ndizo sababu kuu filamu na “mtoto wa lami” wake hutajwa kuwa za kibaguzi.

claim: Dre sifa nyingi kwa sababu Dre ndiye aliyemgundua, kumsaini mwaka 1998, na kutayarisha nyimbo kadhaa kwenye albamu yake ya kwanza kubwa, The Slim Shady LP (1999), hatua iliyomtoa kutoka msanii asiyejulikana hadi nyota wa kimataifa
question_src: - Je! Kwa nini Eminem hutoa sifa nyingi kwa Dk Dre? Anazungumza juu yake kama baba katika muziki wake.
report_src: Eminem humpa Dk. Dre sifa nyingi kwa sababu Dre ndiye aliyemgundua, kumsaini mwaka 1998, na kutayarisha nyimbo kadhaa kwenye albamu yake ya kwanza kubwa, The Slim Shady LP (1999), hatua iliyomtoa kutoka msanii asiyejulikana hadi nyota wa kimataifa [3]. Baada ya hapo, Dre “alimchukua chini ya mrengo wake” na akaendelea kushirikiana naye katika Albamu zilizovunja rekodi kama The Marshall Mathers LP na The Eminem Show, pamoja na kumpa jukwaa la pamoja kwenye kibao “Forget About Dre,” jambo lililoimarisha hadhi ya Eminem na kuonyesha uhusiano wao wa karibu wa kifamili zaidi ya kibiashara [1]. Zaidi ya hayo, siku ya kwanza tu walipokutana, Dre aliingia naye studioni na kurekodi “My Name Is,” wimbo uliompa Eminem umaarufu wa haraka, na kitendo hicho cha kuamini vipaji vyake mara moja ndicho anachokieleza kama upendo wa “baba” aliyemlea kisanii [2].
all_claims: Eminem humpa Dk.

Dre sifa nyingi kwa sababu Dre ndiye aliyemgundua, kumsaini mwaka 1998, na kutayarisha nyimbo kadhaa kwenye albamu yake ya kwanza kubwa, The Slim Shady LP (1999), hatua iliyomtoa kutoka msanii asiyejulikana hadi nyota wa kimataifa [3].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Ukweli juu ya uhusiano wa Dk Dre na Eminem (www.nickiswift.com)
Content: Wakati rapper Dk. Dre alikuwa tayari ameanzishwa kama hadithi ya hip-hop muda mrefu kabla ya mentee wake, Eminem, aliachilia EP yake ya kutengeneza nyota Slim Shady mnamo 1997, ilikuwa ushauri wake wa baadaye wa mwigizaji wa wakati huo na anayekuja ambaye, kwa sehemu, alisisitiza sifa yake sio tu kama msanii, lakini kama mtayarishaji wa Kingmaking. Dre alichukua rapper mdogo chini ya mrengo wake, akishirikiana na picha yake kwenye Albamu zinazouzwa vizuri kama vile Marshall Mathers LP na Eminem Show, na vile vile 2001 iligonga moja "Kusahau Kuhusu Dre." Na wakati ulimwengu wa hip-hop unajulikana kwa hali nyingi, uhusiano kati ya Eminem na Dre umeonekana kuwa mtihani wa wakati.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Maelezo unahitaji kujua juu ya uhusiano wa Dk. Dre na Eminem (www.grunge.com)
Content: Eminem aliripotiwa kuwa na nyota wakati alipokutana na Dk. Dre kwa mara ya kwanza. "Ninamtazama Dre kama, 'Dude, nakuona kwenye Runinga wakati wote - wewe ni mmoja wa mvuto wangu mkubwa kabisa maishani," alisema, kulingana na Billboard. Na haikuchukua muda mrefu kupata kazi. Vitu vilibaini kuwa Eminem aliingia moja kwa moja kwenye ndoano ambayo ingemfanya kuwa maarufu kwenye single yake ya kwanza "Jina Langu Is," na Dk Dre aliamini. Mara moja waliingia kwenye studio na kuweka wimbo huo na "dhamiri ya hatia" mwisho wa siku.

Document ID: 3
Title: Dr. Dre (en.wikipedia.org)
Content: The turning point for Aftermath came in 1998, when Jimmy Iovine, the head of Aftermath's parent label Interscope, suggested that Dr. Dre sign Eminem, a white rapper from Detroit. Dre produced three songs and provided vocals for two on Eminem's successful and controversial debut album The Slim Shady LP, released in 1999.[28] The Dr. Dre-produced lead single from that album, "My Name Is", brought Eminem to public attention for the first time, and the success of The Slim Shady LP – it reached number two on the Billboard 200 and received general acclaim from critics – revived the label's commercial ambitions and viability.[28][29][30]

Jinsi?


Wakati wa uandishi huu, mapato ya wastani ya kaya ya Amerika ni ~ $ 59,000. Kupunguza kaya zilizo na deni duni au usimamizi wa matumizi, hii inamaanisha kuondoa 4% (aka "kiwango salama cha kujiondoa") kila mwaka kwa uwekezaji wa mseto wa $ 1,475,000 (mfuko wa index) kawaida unapaswa kutoa kaya zilizo na $ 59,000 ya mapato ambayo tayari wamepokea. Hii ndio pesa ngapi kaya ya wastani ingehitaji kuwekeza kwa kiwango cha kawaida cha kurudi (kawaida hupewa kama 10%) ili (1) kutoa gharama za kaya, (2) kuweza kuteseka miaka michache ya masoko mabaya, na (3) kuwa kwa usawa na mfumko. Yote haya bila kuwa na mabadiliko ya maisha yao.

report_src: Baadhi ya watu huhisi raha wakitumia ncha ya Q kwa kuwa huamsha vagus nerve inayopita sikioni, neva inayoweza kutoa hisia za kustarehe mwilini [5]. Unaposukuma ncha ya Q ndani, mara nyingi unasukuma nta ndani zaidi, ukizuia uondoaji wake wa asili na kusababisha mkusanyiko unaoweza kuleta maumivu, hisia ya kujazwa au kusikia kwa mushi [3]. Inaweza pia kukwaruza ngozi au hata kuharibu ngoma ya sikio, na hivyo kusababisha kutokwa na damu au maambukizi [4]. Kwa hiyo, ingawa ncha ya Q inaweza kutoa nta kidogo na kukupa hisia nzuri kwa muda, hatari ya kuumia na kuongezeka kwa mkusanyiko wa nta huzidi faida zake; wataalamu wanashauri usafishe tu sehemu ya nje ya sikio kwa upole [1].

Content: Using a cotton swab to try to clear earwax from your ear can actually push the earwax deeper in. This can prevent earwax from naturally clearing and cause it to build up inside your ear.

* pain
* a feeling of fullness in the ear
* muffled hearing

question_src: Je! Lensi za mawasiliano zinakaaje kwenye iris yako? Ni nini huwazuia kusonga mbele kwa jicho lako?
report_src: Lensi za mawasiliano hazikai moja kwa moja kwenye iris yako bali “huogelea” juu ya filamu nyembamba ya machozi inayofunika kornea, na uimara wa safu hii ya machozi hutengeneza nguvu ya kunata (capillary attraction) inayozishikilia lenzi katikati ya jicho [2]. Ulinganifu sahihi kati ya curve ya ndani ya lenzi (base-curve) na umbo la mbele la jicho hutengeneza upatanifu unaopunguza nafasi ya hewa kati ya lenzi na kornea, hivyo kuzuia lenzi kuteleza au kuzunguka; ikiwa curve hiyo ni gorofa sana lenzi hutembea kwa urahisi zaidi juu ya filamu ya machozi [2]. Filamu hiyo hiyo ya machozi pia hutunza unyevunyevu wa lenzi, kuifanya ijisikie vizuri na kubaki mahali pake muda wote wa matumizi [1]. Pamoja na kunata kwa machozi, shinikizo dogo la kope linalokandamiza lenzi taratibu dhidi ya kornea na mvuto mdogo wa maji kati ya nyuso mbili husaidia kuzuia lenzi kusonga mbele hadi itoke. Muunganiko wa vipengele hivi vitatu—kunata kwa machozi, mlingano wa curve, na usaidizi wa kope—ndio unaofanya lenzi kaa salama katikati ya iris yako huku ikisonga tu inapohitajika wakati wa mruko wa macho.

question_src: Hadithi hizi zote kuhusu "theluji bandia" iliyopitishwa karibu ndani ya wiki iliyopita au hivyo ... ni nini kinachoendelea hapa?
report_src: Katika siku chache zilizopita video kutoka Texas zimeenea zikionyesha watu wakifungia theluji kwenye kiberiti na kudai haiyeyuki na hivyo “ni bandia” kwa sababu inaacha doa nyeusi [1]. Kitaalamu, theluji inapopashwa moto huelekea kuyeyuka, lakini maji yanayozalika hunyonya ndani ya muundo wake wenye matundu mengi, hivyo hayashuki kama matone yanayoonekana, kama alivyoeleza mwanafizikia Phil Plait [1]. Mwanga wa kiberiti au taa hutumia butane, hidrokarboni ambayo hutoa chembe za kaboni zisizoweza kuyeyuka; soot hii hukaa juu ya theluji na kuifanya ionekane “imeungua” [2]. Sehemu ya barafu pia inaweza kusublimu, yaani kubadilika moja kwa moja kutoka hali thabiti kwenda gesi bila kupitia kioevu, mchakato wa kawaida katika mzunguko wa maji [4]. Wataalamu wanasema hii si nadharia ya njama bali ni maelezo rahisi ya kisayansi yanayoweza kumchanganya asiyezoea mienendo ya barafu baridi kali [3]. Hivyo, hakuna ushahidi wowote kuwa theluji hiyo imetengenezwa na binadamu; kinachoonekana ni fizikia na kemia ya kawaida katika mazingira yasiyo ya kawaida kwa Texas.

claim: ACTA ni makubaliano ya kimataifa yanayoweka wajibu kwa Marekani kudumisha viwango fulani vya ulinzi wa hakimiliki, hivyo “hufunga mikono ya Congress” kwa kiasi fulani ikiwa taifa linataka kutimiza “majukumu yetu ya kimataifa” [4]; hata hivyo, makubaliano hayo hayaondoi mamlaka ya kikatiba ya Bunge kubadilisha au kukataa sheria mpya, kwa sababu “ahadi za makubaliano ya Merika hazipunguzi nguvu za kikatiba za Congress”
question_src: Swali kubwa: Kwa sababu ya mambo ya kimataifa ya ACTA, je! Nchi yetu inalazimika kupitisha bili kama SOPA na PIPA? (x/chapisho kutoka r/siasa kujaribu kupata jibu)
report_src: ACTA ni makubaliano ya kimataifa yanayoweka wajibu kwa Marekani kudumisha viwango fulani vya ulinzi wa hakimiliki, hivyo “hufunga mikono ya Congress” kwa kiasi fulani ikiwa taifa linataka kutimiza “majukumu yetu ya kimataifa” [4]; hata hivyo, makubaliano hayo hayaondoi mamlaka ya kikatiba ya Bunge kubadilisha au kukataa sheria mpya, kwa sababu “ahadi za makubaliano ya Merika hazipunguzi nguvu za kikatiba za Congress” [5]. Aidha, sheria ya kimataifa inatambua kuwa Marekani inaweza kusimamisha, kusitisha au hata kujiondoa kwenye mkataba, hatua ambayo ingeondoa wajibu wowote uliowekwa na ACTA [6]. Kwa msingi huo, kisheria Marekani hailazimiki kupitisha miswada kama SOPA au PIPA ili kutekeleza ACTA; Congress inaweza kuchagua kurekebisha sheria zilizopo, kutumia mbinu nyingine za utekelezaji, au kutoshiriki kabisa katika mkataba huo, kulingana na tathmini ya kisera na kisiasa.

question_src: Fafanua: Kuanguka kwa Ustaarabu wa Mayan
report_src: Kuanguka kwa Ustaarabu wa Mayan kunahusishwa sana na ukame mkubwa uliosababisha upungufu wa mvua kwa wastani wa 25–40 % kwa mwaka, huku uchambuzi mwingine ukionyesha huenda ulifika 20–65 % [4]. Ushahidi wa kijiolojia unaonyesha ukame huu ulikuwa wa kipekee na uliambatana moja kwa moja na kipindi cha kutoweka kwao [3]. Content: "The Maya are often depicted as people who lived in complete harmony with their environment,' says PhD student Robert Griffin. "But like many other cultures before and after them, they ended up deforesting and destroying their landscape in efforts to eke out a living in hard times."


A major drought occurred about the time the Maya began to disappear. And at the time of their collapse, the Maya had cut down most of the trees across large swaths of the land to clear fields for growing corn to feed their burgeoning population. They also cut trees for firewood and for making building materials.

Title: Why can't bones grow back? (www.sciencefocus.com)
Content: Bones do repair themselves to some extent. But they can’t regenerate or replace themselves fully for the same reason that we can’t grow ourselves a new lung or an extra eye.


Although the DNA to build a complete copy of the entire body is present in every cell with a nucleus, not all of that DNA is active. Most of our cells become specialised during embryonic development so that they only divide to produce cells appropriate to their location in the body.


This is an essential mechanism that keeps us all looking roughly the right shape, despite the fact that our cells are continually dividing and dying off. There seems to be an inverse relationship between how complex an organism is and how well it is able to regenerate after an injury.

report_src: Mifupa hupona kwa kujaza pengo la jeraha lakini hayawezi “kukua nyuma” na kuunda kiungo au sehemu kamili, kwa sababu seli zilizopo kwenye mfupa tayari zimeshasitawi (differentiated) na haziwezi kurudi kwenye hali ya kiinitete ili kuzalisha aina zote za seli zinazohitajika kwa muundo mpya kamili [1]. Ingawa kila seli ina DNA inayoweza kujenga mwili wote, ni sehemu ndogo tu ya msimbo huu inayoendelea kufanya kazi baada ya kuzaliwa, hivyo maagizo ya kukua tena viungo hayajawashwa tena [1]. Baada ya utoto, mifupa huendesha mchakato wa “remodelling” unaobadilisha tishu zilizochakaa na mpya badala ya kutengeneza fuvu au mkono mzima, na kwa wastani mifupa yako yote ni “mipya” kila baada ya takribani miaka 10, siyo kwamba imemea upya bali imebadilishwa sehemu kwa sehemu [2]. Zaidi ya hayo, kadiri kiumbe kinavyokuwa changamani, ndivyo uwezo wa kuzaliwa upya unavyopungua, jambo linalozuia binadamu kutengeneza upya mifupa kamili kama wanavyoweza viumbe rahisi zaidi kama mijusi [1].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Why can't bones grow back? (www.sciencefocus.com)
Content: Bones do repair themselves to some extent. But they can’t regenerate or replace themselves fully for the same reason that we can’t grow ourselves a new lung or an extra eye.


Although the DNA to build a complete copy of the entire body is present in every cell with a nucleus, not all of that DNA is active. Most of our cells become specialised during embryonic development so that they only divide to produce cells appropriate to their location in the body.


This is an essential mechanism that keeps us all looking roughly the right shape, despite the fact that our cells are continually dividing and dying off. There seems to be an inverse relationship between how complex an organism is and how well it is able to regenerate after an injury.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Je! Mifupa yako inabadilikaje kwa wakati? (Health.ClevelandClinic.org)
Content: Mfupa ni tishu hai ambayo hujipanga upya kila wakati. "Mifupa yako ni mpya kabisa kila miaka 10," anasema Dk. Deal.


Katika utoto na ujana, ujenzi wa mfupa hutoka kwa kuondoa mfupa, au upotezaji.


Katika miaka yako ya mapema, wiani wa madini katika kilele cha mifupa yako. Misa yako ya mfupa inaweza kuleta utulivu au kuanza kupungua polepole kwani upotezaji wa mfupa unazidi ujenzi wa mfupa.

Document ID: 2
Title: How Do Your Bones Change Over Time? (health.clevelandclinic.org)
Content: Bone is a living tissue that constantly renews itself. “Your skeleton is completely new every 10 years,” says Dr. Deal.


In childhood and adolescence, bone buildup outpaces bone removal, or loss.


In your early 20s, the density of minerals in your bones peaks. Your bone mass may stabilize or start slowly declining as bone loss overtakes bone buildup.

claim: Ufunguzi wa vidole kwenye simu hufanyika kupitia skana ya uwezo (capacitive) iliyo nyembamba – kwa Apple Touch ID ni takriban microns 170 tu – lakini yenye uwezo wa kunasa maelezo ya alama ya vidole kwa mwonekano wa 550 ppi, hivyo kutoa uchambuzi wa hali ya juu
question_src: Je! Ufunguzi wa vidole hufanyaje kazi kwenye simu?
report_src: Ufunguzi wa vidole kwenye simu hufanyika kupitia skana ya uwezo (capacitive) iliyo nyembamba – kwa Apple Touch ID ni takriban microns 170 tu – lakini yenye uwezo wa kunasa maelezo ya alama ya vidole kwa mwonekano wa 550 ppi, hivyo kutoa uchambuzi wa hali ya juu [1]. Chini ya sehemu ya kioo kuna safu ya mamia hadi maelfu ya capacitors ndogo zinazofanya kazi kama “sensori” zinazohifadhi chaji ya umeme; matuta ya alama ya vidole yanapogusa eneo hili hubadilisha chaji kwenye capacitor iliyo chini yake, ilhali mabonde (nafasi za hewa) hayaibadilishi, na mzunguko wa OP-AMP hufuatilia tofauti hizo kabla ya kubadilishwa kuwa data ya kidijiti kupitia ADC [2]. Data hiyo huchambuliwa ili kubaini vipengele vya kipekee na kuhifadhiwa kama kiolezo cha siri; unapoweka kidole tena, simu inaleta upya data hiyo na kulinganisha na kiolezo, na ikifanana, huondoa kizuizi cha skrini papo hapo [3]. Kwa kuwa skana husoma ngozi hai iliyo chini ya uso badala ya ngozi iliyokufa, na hutegemea ishara za kielektroniki zisizo rahisi kunakiliwa, ni vigumu kudanganywa na picha, vidole bandia au mbinu za filamu za kijasusi [1].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: How Touch ID works: Making sense of Apple's fingerprint identity sensor (www.imore.com)
Content: The Touch ID sensor is wafer thin, measuring only 170 microns. However, it can take 550ppi scans, which allows for a good level of detail analysis. It's also capacitive and reads the fingerprint at a sub-dermal level. That means it's not reading the dead skin on the top of your finger, but the new, living skin beneath the surface. That makes it less likely to be fooled by fake fingerprints, severed fingers, and other sci-fi spy movie tropes
---

Document ID: 2
Title: How fingerprint scanners work — Optical, capacitive, and other variants (www.androidauthority.com)
Content: nstead of creating a traditional image of a fingerprint, capacitive fingerprint scanners use arrays of tiny capacitor circuits to collect data. As capacitors store electrical charge, connecting them up to conductive plates on the surface of the scanner allows them to be used to track the details of a fingerprint. The stored charge will be changed slightly when a finger’s ridge is placed over the conductive plates. Conversely, an air gap will leave the charge at the capacitor relatively unchanged. An op-amp integrator circuit is used to track these changes, which can then be recorded by an analog-to-digital converter

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: How Touch ID works: Making sense of Apple's fingerprint identity sensor (www.imore.com)
Content: The Touch ID sensor is wafer thin, measuring only 170 microns. However, it can take 550ppi scans, which allows for a good level of detail analysis. It's also capacitive and reads the fingerprint at a sub-dermal level. That means it's not reading the dead skin on the top of your finger, but the new, living skin beneath the surface. That makes it less likely to be fooled by fake fingerprints, severed fingers, and other sci-fi spy movie tropes

Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Can we sense invisible magnetic fields? (www.bbc.com)
Content: While the Manchester Experiments didn't conclusively prove that humans could sense magnetic fields, they were certainly provocative, and they set off dozens of replication attempts around the globe. But the initial findings may have been too good to be true.


Biologists James L Gould and Kenneth P Able, for example, found that they were unable, in eight different attempts, to replicate the effect. "We believe that our consistent failures indicate that the phenomenon is neither as simple nor as robust as we had been inclined to hope," they wrote in Science.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Why Does Time Seem to Pass at Different Speeds? (www.psychologytoday.com)
Content: The speed of time seems to be largely determined by how much information our minds absorb and process — the more information there is, the slower time goes. This connection was verified by the psychologist Robert Ornstein in the 1960s. In a series of experiments, Ornstein played tapes to volunteers with various kinds of sound information on them, such as simple clicking sounds and household noises. At the end, he asked them to estimate how long they had listened to the tape. He found that when there was more information on the tape, such as double the number of clicking noises, the volunteers estimated the time period to be longer.

Title: Bench-clearing brawl (en.wikipedia.org)
Content: A bench-clearing brawl is a form of ritualistic fighting that occurs in sports, most notably baseball and ice hockey, in which every player on both teams leaves their dugouts, bullpens, or benches, and charges the playing area in order to fight one another or try to break up a fight. Penalties for leaving the bench can range from nothing to severe.

question_src: Je! Kwa nini naweza kula ukungu kwenye jibini, lakini sio kwenye vyakula vingine?
report_src: Sababu kuu unaruhusiwa kula ukungu fulani kwenye jibini ni kwamba aina hizo za ukungu huchaguliwa na kufugwa kwa makusudi, hazitoi sumu (mycotoxins) na ndizo zinazoipa jibini laini kama Brie na Camembert ladha na muundo wake, hivyo kwa watu wazima wenye afya ni salama kuzila [1]. Ukungu unaojitokeza bila kudhibitiwa kwenye mkate, matunda au mabaki ya chakula ni wa porini; nyuzi zake hupenya ndani ya chakula na unaweza kutoa mycotoxins kama aflatoxin, ambayo inaweza kusababisha matatizo ya upumuaji, mzio na hata saratani, ndipo unatakiwa kukitupa chakula hicho badala ya kukiondoa sehemu iliyoathirika [2]. Tofauti nyingine ni unyevu: vyakula laini na vyenye unyevunyevu huruhusu ukungu kusambaa haraka, ilhali kwenye jibini gumu kama Cheddar au Parmesan ukungu haupenyi kwa urahisi, hivyo unaweza kukata takribani inchi 1 (≈2.5 cm) kuzunguka eneo lililoathirika na kula sehemu iliyobaki [2]. Hivyo, ni suala la aina ya ukungu, mazingira ya utengenezaji na uwezo wa kuingia ndani ya chakula; ukungu uliodhibitiwa kwenye jibini ni rafiki, lakini ule wa bahati mbaya kwenye vyakula vingine unaweza kuwa adui hatari.

Title: Should you eat that moldy cheese? (www.mayoclinic.org)
Content: Of course, not all molds pose a risk. Some types of mold are used to make cheeses, such as Brie and Camembert. These molds are safe for healthy adults to eat. However, these cheeses, as well as other soft cheeses and cheeses made with unpasteurized milk, are best avoided by people with weakened immune systems, older adults, pregnant women, infants and young children.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Uliuliza: Je! Ninaweza kuvua chakula na kula? (time.com)
Content: Wakati ukungu unaoonekana upo, mahema yake-inayoitwa "nyuzi"-ina uwezekano wa kupenya ndani ya chakula chako, ikichafua hata sehemu hizo ambazo zinaonekana kuwa hazina ukungu.


Hatari za kiafya za mfiduo wa ukungu ni nyingi. "Mold inaweza kutoa vitu vyenye sumu, inayoitwa mycotoxins," anasema Katie George, mtaalam wa kliniki katika Chuo Kikuu cha Hospitali ya Kansas. Sumu hizi zinaweza kusababisha shida za kupumua, athari za mzio na ugonjwa. George anasema aflatoxin, aina maalum ya mycotoxin inayopatikana katika karanga na nafaka, inaweza kusababisha saratani.


Mold kawaida ni rahisi kuona. Mara nyingi huonekana kama rangi ya bluu au kijani kibichi, ambayo inaweza kukuza kanzu yenye nywele ikiwa imeachwa kwa muda mrefu, Kirkpatrick anasema. Ikiwa unachunguza vyakula kwenye mitungi - vitu kama mchuzi wa pasta au salsa - ni bora kuangalia chini ya kifuniko na mdomo wa chombo kwa ukuaji wa tuhuma.


Usivue vyakula vyako, Kirkpatrick anaonya, ambayo inaweza kusababisha wewe kuvuta pumzi za ukungu. Ikiwa una wasiwasi juu ya ukungu lakini hauoni ukuaji wowote, tumia akili ya kawaida. "Ikiwa chakula haionekani kama kawaida, na haswa ikiwa inaonekana kuwa na unyevu, itupe," Kirkpatrick anasema.


Isipokuwa: jibini ngumu kama Parmesan, Cheddar au Uswizi. "Pamoja na hizo, ukungu kwa ujumla hautaingia ndani ya bidhaa," Kirkpatrick anasema. Lakini usianze kubonyeza, ambayo inaweza kutolewa spores ya ukungu angani au kuiruhusu kuenea kwa vifaa vyako au vyakula vingine. Njia salama tu ya kuondoa ukungu huo ni kukata inchi ya jibini njia yote karibu na mahali hapo, anasema. "Labda utakata sehemu salama, lakini hiyo ni sheria nzuri ya kidole."
---

Hivyo, ni suala la aina ya ukungu, mazingira ya utengenezaji na uwezo wa kuingia ndani ya chakula; ukungu uliodhibitiwa kwenye jibini ni rafiki, lakini ule wa bahati mbaya kwenye vyakula vingine unaweza kuwa adui hatari.

Document ID: 2
Title: You Asked: Can I Scrape Mold Off of Food and Eat It? (time.com)
Content: when visible mold is present, its tentacles—called “threads”—have likely penetrated deep into your food, contaminating even those parts that appear to be mold-free.


The health risks of mold exposure are many. “Mold can produce toxic substances, called mycotoxins,” says Katie George, a clinical dietitian at the University of Kansas Hospital. These toxins can cause respiratory problems, allergic reactions and illness. George says aflatoxin, a specific type mycotoxin found in nuts and grains, can even be cancer-causing.


Mold is usually easy to spot. It often appears as a blue or green discoloration, which can grow a hairy coat if left long enough, Kirkpatrick says. If you’re examining foods in jars—things like pasta sauce or salsa—it’s best to check the underside of the lid and rim of the container for suspicious growths.


Just don’t sniff your foods, Kirkpatrick warns, which could lead to you inhaling mold spores. If you’re worried about mold but don’t see any growths, use common sense. “If the food doesn’t look the way it normally would, and especially if it seems moisture-soaked, toss it,” Kirkpatrick says.


The exceptions: Hard block cheeses like parmesan, cheddar or Swiss. “With those, the mold generally won’t penetrate deep into the product,” Kirkpatrick says. But don’t start scraping, which can release mold spores into the air or allow them to spread to your countertops or other foods. The only safe way to remove that mold is to cut away an inch of cheese all the way around the spot, she says. “You’ll probably cut away some safe parts, but that’s a good rule of thumb.”

Title: Hii ndio sababu lebo za pombe hazionyeshi habari za lishe (www.huffpost.com)
Content: Hapa kuna jibu fupi: pombe haijadhibitiwa na FDA, kwa hivyo haiko chini ya sheria sawa na chakula na vinywaji vingine (kama vile lebo za lishe).


Pombe inadhibitiwa na Pombe na Ushuru wa Tumbaku na Ofisi ya Biashara (TTB) na itakuwa kwa shirika hili kuhitaji kampuni za pombe kufichua habari za lishe.


Baada ya kukataliwa kufutwa kazi mnamo 1932, Congress ilipitisha Sheria ya Utawala wa Pombe mnamo 1935 ambayo baadaye itakuwa TTB kuhakikisha kuwa mapato ya ushuru yanatolewa kutoka kwa pombe mpya ya kisheria. Na kwa hivyo katika miaka ya 90, wakati FDA ilihitaji lebo za lishe kwenye bidhaa zingine, pombe haikuathiriwa. (Isipokuwa vinywaji vya pombe na pombe ya asilimia saba au chini ambayo haina shayiri mbaya, kwa sababu hizo zimedhibitiwa na FDA.)

Cerebellum, ambayo hufuatilia na kutabiri harakati zetu, huzima mwitikio wa “kuhisika vibaya” (tickle) pindi tu inapotambua kuwa msukumo umetoka kwetu wenyewe, kwa kuwa unautafsiri kama taarifa iliyotarajiwa na isiyo na hatari [2]. Punyeto, kinyume chake, hutegemea kuchochea sehemu za siri ili kuamsha mfumo wa malipo wa ubongo na homoni za raha kama dopamini, na raha hiyo haitegemei mshangao bali msisimko unaoongezeka hatua kwa hatua, unaodhibitiwa makusudi na mhusika [3]. prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Kwa nini haiwezekani kujisumbua (www.healthdigest.com)
Content: Sehemu ya ubongo wetu inayohusika na majibu ya Tickle ni cerebellum (kupitia Sayansi ya Amerika). Cerebellum hufanya kazi anuwai, kama udhibiti wa wakati na harakati za gari (kupitia afya ya UT). Kwa sababu ya hii, akili zetu zina uwezo wa kutarajia hoja yetu inayofuata kabla ya kuifanya. Utafiti uliofanywa na watafiti katika Chuo Kikuu cha Malkia uligundua kuwa msukumo wa mwili uliojisimamia haukuonekana sana na ubongo kuliko kuchochea kwa washiriki kutoka chanzo cha nje (kupitia Sayansi ya kila siku). Tukio hili linajulikana kama uvumbuzi wa hisia na husababisha ubongo wetu kuzima majibu yetu ya tickle.


Jaribu kadri tuwezavyo, haiwezekani kutoa akili zetu wenyewe. Tickling hutumikia kusudi maalum la mwili linapokuja suala la kugundua hatari, lakini pia ina jukumu katika hisia zetu pia. Utafiti umegundua kuwa sehemu ile ile ya ubongo wetu inachochewa wakati tunapotapeliwa kama wakati tunasikia utani wa kuchekesha. Kwa hivyo, kugonga kunaweza kutumika kwa madhumuni kadhaa - mradi tu hatuoni.

Document ID: 2
Title: Why can't you tickle yourself? (science.howstuffworks.com)
Content: We aren't aware of a lot of the sensations generated by our movements. For example, you probably don't pay much attention to your vocal cords when you speak. For the same reason, we can't tickle ourselves. If we grab our sides in an attempt to tickle ourselves, our brain anticipates this contact from the hands and prepares itself for it. By taking away the feeling of unease and panic, the body no longer responds the same as it would if someone else were to tickle us.


Brain scientists at the University College London have pinpointed the cerebellum as the part of the brain that prevents us from self-tickling. The cerebellum is the region located at the base of the brain that monitors our movements. It can distinguish expected sensations from unexpected sensations. An expected sensation would be the amount of pressure your fingers apply to your keyboard while typing. An unexpected sensation would be someone sneaking up behind you and tapping you on the shoulder. While the brain discards the sensation of typing, it pays a lot of attention to someone tapping on your shoulder. The difference in reactions from expected to unexpected is a built-in response that probably developed in early human history to detect predators.

Document ID: 2
Title: How do government regulations impact the oil and gas drilling sector? (www.investopedia.com)
Content: The oil and gas sector faces heavy scrutiny regarding environmental issues, such as air and water quality and offshore regulation.
* The Clean Air Act impacts the drilling industry with the overall aim of the act to reduce harmful emissions of greenhouse gases.
* OSHA regulates worker safety by establishing rules and standards for working conditions, including specific guidelines for drilling.


## How Regulations Impact the Oil and Gas Sector


There is no national oil and gas company in the United States. Instead, there are numerous private businesses operating in the sector, including large international corporations. The activities of these companies are regulated on the state and federal level. To begin exploration for oil and gas drilling, the business must obtain a development permit, a drilling permit, and an operating permit. The requirements for gaining these permits are stipulated at the state level. There must also be a public review period, which is often contentious. All permits must be obtained prior to beginning exploration, or the applicant may face delays and financial and legal penalties. In addition to permits, there are various standards and rules that companies must comply with when operating in the oil and gas industry.

Title: Serikali na Sekta ya Kibinafsi - Maadili ya Biashara (OpentextBC.ca)
Content: Kwa karne mbili, biashara zimefaidika kutokana na kutumia na kuuza rasilimali asili ya taifa. Biashara katika mfumo wa uchumi wa bure lakini uliodhibitiwa kama vile huko Merika ni kuruhusu uchimbaji unaoendelea wa rasilimali asili lakini kuhitaji kujitolea kwa ulinzi wa mazingira kwa malipo. Biashara hii inakuza uendelevu wa muda mrefu kwa kusawazisha masilahi ya mazingira, serikali na serikali za mitaa, na watumiaji wa rasilimali asili. Walakini, ushirikiano huu wa umma na wa kibinafsi sio bila ubishi.


Bomba la Keystone XL


Kesi ya Bomba la Keystone XL ni mfano wa hali ya kihemko ya mizozo mingi ya mazingira, kwani taifa letu linajaribu kupata masuala ya uendelevu. Wapinzani wa ndani na wa kitaifa wa bomba la Keystone XL, ambalo lingebeba mafuta yasiyosafishwa kutoka Canada hadi Pwani ya Ghuba ya Texas, wameandamana kwa miaka kukomesha ujenzi wake ((takwimu)). Jaribio hili liliharakisha baada ya Rais Trump kupitisha bomba hilo mnamo Machi 2017, na kurudisha uamuzi wa Rais Obama kuikataa kwa misingi ya mazingira. Inatokea kwamba bomba linaweza kukamilika, inasubiri hatua za kisheria ambazo bado hazijasuluhishwa huko Nebraska.

Document ID: 2
Title: Je! Kanuni za serikali zinaathirije sekta ya kuchimba mafuta na gesi? (www.investopedia.com)
Content: Sekta ya mafuta na gesi inakabiliwa na uchunguzi mzito kuhusu maswala ya mazingira, kama vile ubora wa hewa na maji na kanuni za pwani.
* Sheria ya Hewa safi inathiri tasnia ya kuchimba visima kwa kusudi la jumla la ACT kupunguza uzalishaji mbaya wa gesi chafu.
* OSHA inasimamia usalama wa wafanyikazi kwa kuanzisha sheria na viwango vya hali ya kufanya kazi, pamoja na miongozo maalum ya kuchimba visima.


## Jinsi kanuni zinavyoathiri sekta ya mafuta na gesi


Hakuna kampuni ya kitaifa ya mafuta na gesi huko Merika. Badala yake, kuna biashara kadhaa za kibinafsi zinazofanya kazi katika sekta hiyo, pamoja na mashirika makubwa ya kimataifa. Shughuli za kampuni hizi zinadhibitiwa kwa kiwango cha serikali na shirikisho. Kuanza uchunguzi wa kuchimba mafuta na gesi, biashara lazima ipate idhini ya maendeleo, idhini ya kuchimba visima, na idhini ya kufanya kazi. Mahitaji ya kupata vibali hivi yameorodheshwa katika kiwango cha serikali. Lazima pia kuwe na kipindi cha ukaguzi wa umma, ambacho mara nyingi huwa na ubishani. Ruhusa zote lazima zipatikane kabla ya kuanza uchunguzi, au mwombaji anaweza kukabiliwa na ucheleweshaji na adhabu ya kifedha na kisheria. Mbali na vibali, kuna viwango na sheria mbali mbali ambazo kampuni lazima zizingatie wakati wa kufanya kazi katika tasnia ya mafuta na gesi.

Document ID: 3
Title: Government and the Private Sector – Business Ethics (opentextbc.ca)
Content: For two centuries, businesses have profited from using and selling the nation’s natural resources. The tradeoff in a free but regulated economic system such as that in the United States is to allow the continued extraction of natural resources but to require a commitment to protection of the environment in return. This bargain promotes long-term sustainability by balancing the interests of the environment, state and local governments, and users of natural resources. However, this public-private collaboration is not without controversy.


The Keystone XL Pipeline


The case of the Keystone XL pipeline is an example of the emotional aspect of many environmental disputes, as our nation tries to come to grips with sustainability issues. Local and national opponents of the Keystone XL pipeline, which would carry crude oil from Canada to the Texas Gulf Coast, have protested for years to stop its construction ((Figure)). These efforts accelerated after President Trump approved the pipeline in March 2017, reversing President Obama’s decision to reject it on environmental grounds. It appears that the pipeline is likely to be completed, pending legal action still unresolved in Nebraska.

claim: Pombe ikishafika ubongoni husisimua neva katika eneo la tegmental (VTA) kuachilia dopamini, kemikali ya “zawadi”, na hisia hii huwafanya walaji waendelee kunywa hata pale madhara yakianza kuonekana
question_src: Kwa nini pombe ndio watu wa kunywa tu wanaumwa?
report_src: Pombe ni dutu ya kileo ambayo, inapomezwa kwa wingi kwa muda mfupi, husababisha madhara ya haraka mwilini na huchukuliwa kama “kunywa pombe kupita kiasi” (binge drinking) [1]. Wale wasiokunywa hawapati madhara hayo kwa sababu pombe haijaingia mwilini mwao; sumu na athari zake hutegemea uwepo wake katika damu na ubongo. Pombe ikishafika ubongoni husisimua neva katika eneo la tegmental (VTA) kuachilia dopamini, kemikali ya “zawadi”, na hisia hii huwafanya walaji waendelee kunywa hata pale madhara yakianza kuonekana [2]. Nchini Marekani karibu 40% ya wanafunzi wa vyuo vikuu huripoti tabia hii ya kunywa kupita kiasi [1]. Kundi hili pia lina tabia ya kuzingatia tu thawabu za haraka na “hadithi nzuri”, wakisahau madhara ya muda mrefu, jambo linalochochea maumivu na athari mbaya kwa wanaokunywa [3]. Kwa kifupi, ni wale wanaomeza pombe pekee wanaoumia kwa sababu ndiyo wanaoingiza kemikali hatarishi mwilini, inayobadilisha kazi za ubongo na kusababisha sumu, wakati wasiotumia hawana mfiduo huo.

Document ID: 2
Title: Prone to binge drinking? This might be why (www.medicalnewstoday.com)
Content: Dopamine helps the brain learn new things, but it may also lead us down the path of addiction.

Dopamine earned its nickname because it is a feel-good chemical that is released as a reward for the brain when we learn new things or during pleasurable activities such as sex. It is also the substance that “tells” us to prolong the pleasure and continue to “chase the high.”

In the case of alcohol dependence, when alcohol reaches the brain, it causes the neurons in a region called the ventral tegmental area (VTA) to release dopamine.

Title: Kile Wazazi Wanahitaji Kujua Kuhusu Kunywa Kunywa kwa Chuo (Dawa za Kulevya)
Content: Kwanza, tunajua kuwa akili za vijana na vijana "hutolewa" kwa tabia ya kuchukua hatari na uchunguzi-wengine zaidi ya wengine. Lakini kwa ujumla, wanafunzi wa vyuo vikuu wanaweza kuzingatia thawabu za haraka na uzoefu ambao unaweza kufanya "hadithi nzuri" baadaye badala ya kufikiria juu ya athari zinazowezekana za tabia zao. Kwa bahati mbaya, matokeo ya tabia ya aina hii yanaweza kubadilisha hali ya maisha haraka sana.

Nguvu ya pili ya kuendesha nyuma ya tabia ya kunywa kupita kiasi ni maoni kwamba ni ya kawaida na inakubaliwa - wazo kwamba "kila mtu anafanya" - wakati kwa kweli ni wachache wa wanafunzi. Shule nyingi hujaribu kutuma ujumbe juu ya rarity ya unywaji mkubwa wa pombe ili kurekebisha maoni haya potofu na wanafunzi.

Tatu, kuna sababu nyingi za kiwango cha mtu binafsi ambazo zinaongeza hatari ya mtu kwa kunywa, kama kuwa na msukumo, au kuwa na tabia ya kuvunja sheria. Mwishowe, kupatikana kwa pombe ni muhimu. Kwa mfano, ambapo kuna ufikiaji ulioenea na bei ya chini, kutakuwa na uwezekano mkubwa kwamba wanafunzi watajihusisha na unywaji mzito ikilinganishwa na maeneo ambayo ufikiaji ni zaidi

Title: What Parents Need to Know About College Binge Drinking (drugfree.org)
Content: First, we know that adolescent and young adult brains are “primed” for risk-taking and exploratory behavior — some more than others. But in general, college students are likely to focus on immediate rewards and an experience that might make a “good story” later rather than think about the possible consequences of their behavior. Unfortunately, the consequences of this sort of behavior can change a life trajectory very quickly.

A second driving force behind excessive drinking behavior is the perception that it is normative and accepted — the idea that “everyone is doing it” — when in fact it’s a minority of students. Many schools try to send messages about the relative rarity of very heavy consumption of alcohol to correct these misperceptions by students.

Third, there are many individual-level factors that heighten one’s risk for binge drinking, like being impulsive, or having a tendency to break rules. Lastly, the availability of alcohol is key. For example, where there is widespread access and low prices, there will be a greater likelihood that students will engage in heavy drinking as compared with places where access is more lim

Title: Understanding the Maths Behind Betting Odds (Explained) - (caanberry.com)
Content: Bookmakers don’t predict the winner to make their money, and if you understand why you’ll quickly understand how betting odds work. The structure is always the same.

“Betting odds work by reflecting the implied chance of an outcome in monetary terms inclusive of the operator’s margin.”

Let’s think about that. It doesn’t matter what sport or event you’re betting on. Betting odds come down to two things:

 * Probability * Bookmaker margin, or overround

Take a football game for example. We have three outcomes and they are all even. They all have a 33.3% chance of winning or 2/1 in betting odds terms. But the bookmaker won’t offer 2/1 on all the outcomes because they want to make a profit. They do this by taking a margin and increasing the overround.

Title: The Math Behind Betting Odds & Gambling (www.investopedia.com)
Content: The odds on display never reflect the true probability or chance of an event occurring (or not occurring). There is always a profit margin added by the bookmaker in these odds, which means that the payout to the successful punter is always less than what they should have received if the odds had reflected the true chances.

The bookmaker needs to estimate the true probability or chance of an outcome correctly in order to set the odds on display in such a way that it profits the bookmaker regardless of an event outcome.

Title: Why Are Reef Fish so Colorful? The Science Behind the Beauty | Scuba Diving News, Gear, Education | Dive Training Magazine (dtmag.com)
Content: “There isn’t going to be just one explanation, that’s the bottom line,” Losey says. “There are going to be a lot of contributing factors.”


#### Why Are They So Pretty?


There are, however, two big-picture theories within the scientific community explaining why fish are so colorful.


One was first considered by Alfred Russel Wallace, a less-known but equally significant contemporary of Charles Darwin in the 19th century. Wallace suggested that the bright colors worn by reef fish may actually help them hide in an equally colorful environment. While fish are pink and green and purple and blue, so are the corals, sponges and other parts of the visually complex background behind them. “He said, well, these colors might actually have a protective function — they might actually function like camouflage in a sense against these heterogeneous backgrounds,” Rosenthal says.

#####Kwanini ni wazuri sana?


Kuna, hata hivyo, nadharia mbili za picha kubwa ndani ya jamii ya kisayansi inayoelezea ni kwanini samaki ni wa kupendeza sana.


Moja ilizingatiwa kwanza na Alfred Russel Wallace, mtu asiyejulikana lakini muhimu sana wa Charles Darwin katika karne ya 19. Document ID: 2
Title: Why Are Reef Fish so Colorful? The Science Behind the Beauty | Scuba Diving News, Gear, Education | Dive Training Magazine (dtmag.com)
Content: The other idea is one developed by biologist Konrad Lorenz in the mid-20th century. He suggested that fish are conspicuously colored to help them identify their own species in the crowded reef environment, where there is direct competition between not only other species, but also members of their own.


Consequently, colors may allow for individual recognition. Even with some reef fish’s intricate color pattern, no two are exactly alike. In his research on cleaner fish in the Indo-Pacific region, Lorenz studied striped cleaner wrasse (Labroides dimidiatus). While he couldn’t tag the little fish, he could photograph them and tell the difference between individuals by their markings in photographs. “If we can, you can bet they can,” he says.


By having “iconically different” color patterns, Rosenthal says, fish are able to minimize the costs of aggression — in other words, if you’re different from everyone you’re not competing with, you’re not going to have a lot of inter-species conflict that would sap your energy.

Content: One of the ways they’ve done it is to use light conditions to communicate signals — mating, camouflage and territory — in a context that matches the clarity of the water.

report_src: Sehemu nyeupe iliyo katikati ya kizuizi cha barafu hutokana na mkusanyiko wa viputo vidogo vya hewa na uchafu uliokuwa umeyeyushwa ndani ya maji kabla ya kuganda [1]. Maji yanapoganda huanza kufungia kutoka nje kuelekea ndani; fuwele safi za barafu hujitengeneza kwanza na kusukuma gesi (kama oksijeni) na madini kuyaelekeza kwenye kioevu kilichobaki, hivyo vitu hivi hukwama katikati sehemu hiyo inapoganda mwisho [2]. Viputo hivyo pamoja na chembechembe za madini hufanya eneo hilo litawanyishe mwanga badala ya kuupitisha moja kwa moja, na ndiyo sababu linaonekana jeupe au “lenye mawingu” tofauti na kingo za mchemraba zilizo wazi [4]. Uchafu unaohusishwa mara nyingi ni kalsiamu, magnesiamu, fluoride, nitrati na vitu vingine vya kikaboni ambavyo uchujaji wa kawaida hauondoi, hivyo kuwezesha athari hii kuonekana hasa kwenye maji ya bomba [3].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: What Makes The Center Of Ice Cubes White? (www.forbes.com)
Content: The white stuff in your ice cubes is actually very very tiny air bubbles. Virtually all natural water you deal with is oxygenated to some extent.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Ni nini hufanya katikati ya barafu ya barafu kuwa nyeupe? (www.forbes.com)
Content: Wakati maji yanaganda, inataka kuunda muundo wa kawaida wa fuwele (barafu). Hiyo inamaanisha uchafu kama oksijeni na glasi zingine zilizofutwa husukuma mbali na fuwele mbele ndani ya kioevu kilichobaki. Hii inamaanisha kuwa sehemu za mwisho za mchemraba wa barafu ili kumalizika huishia na uchafu mwingi. Ikiwa utaangalia nyumba yako iliyotengenezwa na barafu, utagundua kuwa sehemu za mchemraba wa barafu ambao ulikuwa chini ya tray ni vipande vya rangi ya milky. Hiyo ni kwa sababu hizo zilikuwa sehemu za mwisho kufungia. Cubes za barafu kwenye tray yako hua kutoka juu kwenda juu, ambayo ilisukuma hewa yenye uchafu chini hadi ilinaswa chini na hakuna mahali pa kwenda.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Je! Kwa nini barafu za barafu huwa na mawingu wakati zingine ziko wazi? »Sayansi ABC (www.scienceabc.com)
Content: Uchafu wa kawaida unaopatikana katika maji ya bomba ni pamoja na chokaa (pia inajulikana kama limescale), kalsiamu, fluoride, nitrati, magnesiamu na vitu vingine vya kikaboni ambavyo haiwezekani kuondoa na njia za kawaida za kuchuja. Kwa hivyo, wakati maji yanapofungia, uchafu ambao ulisambazwa sawasawa ndani ya maji, huwa unakusanyika karibu na katikati, na kufanya barafu za barafu kuwa nyeupe katikati yao.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: Ni nini hufanya Cubes za barafu ziwe na mawingu? (www.livescience.com)
Content: Sababu kuu ni kwamba (kwa matumaini) maji safi ya kioo unayoimimina ndani ya trays za barafu sio safi kama inavyoonekana, yenye viwango vidogo vya (kwa matumaini) madini yasiyokuwa na madhara na sediment.


Kwa sababu vitu vyote hufungia kutoka nje ndani, kituo cha mchemraba ni cha mwisho kuimarisha. Maji ya bure ya madini na uchafu hufungia kwanza, kusukuma sehemu zenye mawingu zilizo na sediment (na vifurushi vidogo vya hewa) kuelekea katikati. Matokeo yake ni madhara (lakini sio picha ya mchemraba) ya mchemraba.
---

Document ID: 2
Title: What Makes The Center Of Ice Cubes White? (www.forbes.com)
Content: As the water freezes, it wants to form a regular crystalline structure (ice). That means impurities like oxygen and other dissolved gasses are pushed away from the crystallization front into the remaining liquid. This means that the last parts of the ice cube to crystallize end up with most of the impurities. If you’ll take a look at your home made ice cubes, you’ll note that the parts of the ice cube that were at the bottom of the tray are the milky colored bits. That’s because those were the last parts to freeze. The ice cubes in your tray froze from the top downward, which pushed the contaminant air downward until it was trapped at the bottom and had nowhere else to go.

Document ID: 4
Title: What Makes Ice Cubes Cloudy? (www.livescience.com)
Content: The main reason is that the (hopefully) crystal-clear water you pour into the ice trays is not as pure as it seems, containing small amounts of (hopefully) harmless suspended minerals and sediment.


Because all objects freeze from the outside in, the center of the cube is the last to solidify. Water free of minerals and impurities freezes first, pushing the cloudy parts containing the sediment (and tiny trapped air bubbles) toward the center. The result is a harmless (but not particularly photogenic) ice cube clouding.

Hiyo inamaanisha uchafu kama oksijeni na glasi zingine zilizofutwa husukuma mbali na fuwele mbele ndani ya kioevu kilichobaki. Hii inamaanisha kuwa sehemu za mwisho za mchemraba wa barafu ili kumalizika huishia na uchafu mwingi. Ikiwa utaangalia nyumba yako iliyotengenezwa na barafu, utagundua kuwa sehemu za mchemraba wa barafu ambao ulikuwa chini ya tray ni vipande vya rangi ya milky. Hiyo ni kwa sababu hizo zilikuwa sehemu za mwisho kufungia. Cubes za barafu kwenye tray yako hua kutoka juu kwenda juu, ambayo ilisukuma hewa yenye uchafu chini hadi ilinaswa chini na hakuna mahali pa kwenda.

Title: Why Are Some Ice Cubes Cloudy While Others Are Clear? » Science ABC (www.scienceabc.com)
Content: The most common impurities found in tap water include lime (also known as limescale), calcium, fluoride, nitrates, magnesium and certain other organic elements that are practically impossible to remove with regular filtration methods. Title: Je! Umeona karibu au umeona macho? | Mtihani wa maono kutoka nyumbani | Eyeque (www.eyeque.com)
Content: Diopter ni sehemu ya kipimo ya kipimo juu ya maagizo ya glasi ya glasi. Nambari hasi ya diopter inabainisha kuona karibu. Nambari chanya inaonyesha kuona mbele. Diopter inataja jinsi lensi inahitajika ili kuzingatia vizuri mwanga juu ya retina ya mtu. Watu wengi wana astigmatism kwa kuongeza myopia au hyperopia. Katika astigmatism, cornea ina udhaifu wa curvature, au lensi hupotoshwa, na kusababisha vitu vya karibu na mbali vinaonekana kuwa wazi.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Reading Glasses Strength Chart & Magnification Guide | ReadingGlasses.com (www.readingglasses.com)
Content: Reading lenses are rated in diopters, a formula opticians use. Manufacturers of reading glasses often contribute to consumer confusion by referring to magnification power and diopter strength interchangeably. They are not the same thing. But it’s easier for people to understand magnification than the science of lenses.

A slightly more technical explanation. With every power option, or “diopter”, there is a sweet spot range where close vision is brought into sharp focus. This changes from person to person. If the diopter is too weak for your individual needs, you will need to move the material farther away from your face to see it clearly. If the diopter is too strong, that range of sweet spot will be closer than you prefer. The average person reads material between 14 - 18 inches away from their face. If you would like to restore a comfortable reading range that is within that, find a diopter that sharpens focus in this range. In contrast, if you are working at your desk and your computer monitor is 24 inches away, you will need a weaker power than you would for reading.

question_src: Je! Ni tofauti gani kubwa kati ya kalenda ya Julian na Gregorian ambayo ilifanya ulimwengu ubadilike?
report_src: Kalenda ya Julian, iliyobuniwa 46 KK, iliongeza mwaka kuwa na urefu uliozidi uhalisia kwa takriban dakika 11, hivyo ilikwama siku moja kila baada ya miaka 128 [2]. Kufikia 1582 hitilafu hiyo ilikuwa imefikia siku 10 ukilinganisha na majira ya jua, jambo lililosababisha sikukuu na misimu kutolingana na tarehe rasmi [2]. Ili kusahihisha tatizo hilo Papa Gregory XIII alianzisha kalenda ya Gregorian na kuagiza siku 10 (Oktoba 5–14, 1582) zifutwe mara moja ili kurudisha ulinganifu kati ya tarehe na majira [4]. Kalenda mpya ilitengenezwa kuwa sahihi zaidi kuliko ya Julian, hivyo kupunguza kasi ya kukusanya makosa na kudumisha ulinganifu wa tarehe na misimu kwa muda mrefu [3]. Tofauti hii ya kimsingi katika usahihi ndiyo iliyosababisha, kati ya 1582 na 1927, karibu kila nchi kuacha kalenda ya Julian na kuhamia kalenda ya Gregorian [6].

Kufikia 1582 hitilafu hiyo ilikuwa imefikia siku 10 ukilinganisha na majira ya jua, jambo lililosababisha sikukuu na misimu kutolingana na tarehe rasmi [2]. Kalenda mpya ilitengenezwa kuwa sahihi zaidi kuliko ya Julian, hivyo kupunguza kasi ya kukusanya makosa na kudumisha ulinganifu wa tarehe na misimu kwa muda mrefu [3]. Tofauti hii ya kimsingi katika usahihi ndiyo iliyosababisha, kati ya 1582 na 1927, karibu kila nchi kuacha kalenda ya Julian na kuhamia kalenda ya Gregorian [6].

question_src: Je! Kwa nini duka la bei ni rahisi zaidi kuliko maduka makubwa?
report_src: Maduka ya kiwanda huuza bidhaa kwa bei nafuu kuliko maduka makubwa kwa sababu bidhaa nyingi ni hisa zilizobaki ambazo hazikuuzika baada ya chapa kuzindua toleo jipya, hivyo mtengenezaji hulenga tu kurejesha gharama badala ya kutengeneza faida kubwa [2]. Bidhaa nyingine zina dosari ndogo kama makosa ya lebo, maagizo ya kuosha au mtindo ambayo mara nyingi hayatazamwi na mnunuzi, hivyo huondolewa kwenye maduka ya rejareja na kupelekwa kiwandani ili kulinda taswira ya chapa na kuuzwa kwa punguzo kubwa [3]. Wakati mwingine kuna tofauti kidogo katika uzi, vivuli vya rangi, vifungo au zipu ambazo hazistahili bei ya duka la maonyesho, hivyo bidhaa hupelekwa kwenye duka la kiwanda kwa bei ya chini ambayo mnunuzi yuko tayari kulipia [4]. Pia, kama safu fulani imepokea malalamiko ya ubora, chapa huchagua kuuza mizigo hiyo kwa bei pungufu katika duka la kiwanda badala ya kuiweka wazi kwenye duka kuu, ili kuepusha athari hasi kwa chapa [5]. Kwa hivyo, tofauti hizi za chanzo cha bidhaa na mkakati wa kudhibiti picha hufanya bei katika maduka ya kiwanda kuwa chini zaidi ikilinganishwa na maduka makubwa.

Content: Clearance of stock


Let us start with one of the biggest reasons for such price differences. If a line of products of a brand has not sold as expected, then the safest way to get done with their sale is selling them at factory outlets. This mostly happens when a new/ latest version of the same stuff is launched in the market. If there is stock left from the previous version which will now be considered as outdated, manufacturers would at least want to recover the costs, if not make profit. So, this stock is then sold in factory outlets at a lower price.

Content: Kibali cha hisa


Wacha tuanze na moja ya sababu kubwa za tofauti za bei kama hizo. Ikiwa mstari wa bidhaa za chapa haujauza kama inavyotarajiwa, basi njia salama kabisa ya kufanywa na uuzaji wao ni kuziuza katika maduka ya kiwanda. prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Why is the Steering Wheel not in the Middle? (carssimplified.com)
Content: There are actually quite a few reasons why the steering wheel isn't located in the center of the dashboard.


## Seating for Adults


A car would have to be much wider to comfortably seat three adults in the front seating row. Two adults in the front seat would cause the driver to sit slightly to the left or right. Widening the car would make it more difficult to park, and increase wind resistance.


## Steering Column


The steering column needs room to connect to the other steering components under the hood, and in most cars (the ones with their engine in the front, specifically), the engine would be in the way, and routing the steering linkage around the engine would make the steering heavy.


## Visibility


While sitting in the middle would mean both sides of the car are equally distant from the driver, it would also make having a center mirror impractical, and it would move the driver further from the center of the road, making it hard to see around some corners, such as those at intersections/crossroads.


## Enter/Exit Ease


A seat in the middle of the vehicle would take more effort to get in and out of easily, which is why many race cars still have left or right side seating.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Kwa nini usukani wa gari lako upande wa kushoto? Laiti Teamsters (www.gearpatrol.com)
Content: Kuna uvumi mwingi na ripoti zinazopingana huko juu juu ya asili ya nafasi za kuendesha, lakini sababu inayowezekana inaweza kukushangaza. Sababu ya kuendesha kulia na gurudumu lako liko kushoto? Teamsters.


Hapana, sio umoja wa madereva wa lori ambao ulimfanya Jimmy Hoffa kuwa maarufu. Watu ambao waliwapa jina lao: wale ambao kwa kweli waliendesha timu za farasi kuvuta gari karibu katika siku za mapinduzi ya viwanda. Kama bora utafiti wetu unavyoweza kuchimba, gari nyingi hazikuwa na mahali pa kukaa, kwa hivyo Teamster ambaye alikuwa akiendesha farasi angekaa mahali pazuri zaidi kuona barabara na barabara zote: juu ya farasi mmoja akiinua nyuma. Kama watu wengi wana mkono wa kulia, wachezaji wengi wangehitaji mjeledi katika mkono wao wa kulia-kwa hivyo ilifanya akili zaidi kukaa juu ya farasi wa kushoto.


Na kwa madereva wengi wameketi upande wa kushoto wa wapanda farasi wao, ilifanya akili kupanga trafiki ili magari yapanda upande wa kulia wa barabara. Hii, kama sisi sote tunajua kutoka kwa kuendesha leo, inawawezesha madereva kukaa karibu na mstari wa kituo - na kwa hivyo karibu na trafiki inayokuja, ili waweze kupima vyema jinsi walikuwa karibu na magari hayo yanayozunguka.
---

Title: It's Summer, and That Means Fall Migration is Already Underway (www.audubon.org)
Content: Every northern summer, millions of seabirds that breed in the Southern Hemisphere are on the move. Chasing an endless summer as trans-equatorial migrants, these masters of migration cross into northern oceans in search of food and warmer weather. Perhaps no other species are as famous for this as the Pacific Ocean populations of Sooty and Short-tailed Shearwaters. These salty seabirds breed around Australia and New Zealand generally arriving at their breeding colonies in October, laying eggs in November, and fledging chicks by late April. Departing the oceans of these areas in the southern fall, they arrive in Japan, Alaska, and California by May and June.

Document ID: 2
Title: Why are Shaver Sockets in the Bathroom Safe? (www.thenakedscientists.com)
Content: They use a so-called isolating transformer. Your body is connected to 'earth', through your feet. If you touch the live wire of a normal electrical supply you get the full mains voltage (230V relative to earth) across you and if you touch the neutral wire you only have a few volts (about zero relative to earth). With an isolating transformer, the wires are 'floating'. There is still the full mains voltage between them but they are both 'isolated' from earth. Whichever one you touch, only a tiny current will flow through you and its voltage, relative to earth, will be nearly zero - you will get no shock. The other wire will be at full mains voltage but, as you aren't touching it, you don't get a shock.
---

Title: What Is a Bathroom Shaver Socket? (www.wise-geek.com)
Content: The bathroom shaver socket is mounted in an isolation transformer that cuts it off from the rest of the electrical system. This limits the risk of electrical shock, a concern in the bathroom where lots of water can be present. In addition, the current is very low. It will power a shaver or electric toothbrush, but not an item like a heater or a hair dryer. The circuit will shut down if it gets too hot, thus keeping the user as safe as possible.


Often a bathroom shaver socket is mounted up high and may be behind a hidden panel. There may be a small plaque indicating that it should only be used with bathroom shavers.
---

Document ID: 2
Title: Do Dark Themes and Black Wallpapers Save Battery? - DroidViews (www.droidviews.com)
Content: LCD (Liquid Crystal Displays) displays have a single source of light which lights up the display. This element is called backlight and it’s positioned behind the pixels, which simply determine the color of the output. Instead, OLED (Organic Light Emitting Diodes) panels are made of independent LEDs. While the result is the same, each of these pixels produces its own light, thus getting rid of the backlight.

[Image: Dark Theme OnePlus 6T Display]

Title: condensation (www.nationalgeographic.org)
Content: Condensation is the process where water vapor becomes liquid. It is the reverse of evaporation, where liquid water becomes a vapor.


Condensation happens one of two ways: Either the air is cooled to its dew point or it becomes so saturate d with water vapor that it cannot hold any more water.


Dew Point


Dew point is the temperature at which condensation happens. (Dew is simply condensed water in the atmosphere.) Air temperatures can reach or fall below the dew point naturally, as they often do at night. Thats why lawns, cars, and houses are often coated with water droplets in the morning.


Condensation can also produce water droplets on the outside of soda cans or glasses of cold water. When warm air hits the cold surface, it reaches its dew point and condenses. This leaves droplets of water on the glass or can.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Kwa nini maziwa huunda ngozi wakati inawaka? (na picha) (www.delightcooking.com)
Content: Maziwa huunda ngozi juu wakati moto kwa sababu ya athari ya kemikali ambayo huathiri jinsi protini na molekuli za mafuta zinaingiliana. Wakati maziwa yanapokanzwa haraka, maji mengine ndani yake huvukiza kutoka kwa uso. Hii inafichua protini na molekuli za mafuta, ambazo hufunga na kukausha wakati joto linaendelea. Ngozi za kawaida wakati maziwa yanapokanzwa juu ya jiko, kwani majiko kwa ujumla yana uwezo wa kufikia joto la juu haraka sana, ingawa inaweza kutokea kwenye microwave pia. Filamu haina madhara, lakini ni mbaya kwa wengi na inaweza kuzuiwa kwa kuchochea mara kwa mara na jicho la karibu juu ya joto.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Kwa nini maziwa huunda ngozi wakati inawaka? (na picha) (www.delightcooking.com)
Content: Mara nyingi inashangaza kuona filamu au ngozi kwenye maziwa ya nonfat au "skim", kwani itaonekana kuwa, bila mafuta, protini hazingekuwa na chochote cha kumfunga. Kwa kweli, ni nadra kukutana na maziwa ambayo hayana mafuta kweli. Maziwa mengi ya skim ambayo yanauzwa kibiashara ina mafuta ya chini sana, lakini mara chache huwa haina mafuta. Hata kuwaeleza kiasi cha mafuta kwenye uso kunaweza kuchangia malezi ya ngozi.


Jambo kama hilo hufanyika na maziwa ya soya, ambayo kwa ujumla inauzwa kama mafuta bure. Mafuta ya asili bado hufanyika kwa kiwango cha kuwaeleza, na inaweza kuvutwa kwa uso wakati wazi kwa joto la juu sana. Filamu ya soya inaweza kutupwa, lakini pia inachukuliwa kuwa ladha katika tamaduni nyingi za Asia. Inapoondolewa na kukaushwa, inajulikana kama Yuba, au soya ya soya, ambayo hutumiwa katika mapishi anuwai.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Milk skin (en.wikipedia.org)
Content: Milk skin or lactoderm refers to a sticky film of protein that forms on top of dairy milk and foods containing dairy milk (such as hot chocolate and some soups). Milk film can be produced both through conventional boiling and by microwaving the liquid, and as such can often be observed when heating milk for use in drinks such as drinking chocolate. It is caused by the denaturation of proteins such as beta-lactoglobulin (whey protein). The thickness of the skin varies dependent on a number of factors, including the temperature of the milk, the shape of the container, and the amount of milk in the container.


When milk is boiled, soluble milk proteins are denatured and then coagulate with milk's fat and form a sticky film across the top of the liquid, which then dries by evaporation. The layer does not need to be discarded and can be consumed, as protein's nutritional value is unaffected by the denaturation process. Milk film is often considered to be desirable and is used in several recipes for various foods.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Why does Milk Form a Skin When It is Heated? (with pictures) (www.delightedcooking.com)
Content: Milk forms a skin on top when heated because of a chemical reaction that affects how protein and fat molecules interact with each other. When milk is heated rapidly, some of the water in it evaporates from the surface. This exposes proteins and fat molecules, which bind and dry out as warming continues. Skin most commonly forms when milk is heated over a stove top, as stoves are generally capable of reaching very high temperatures quite quickly, though it can happen in the microwave as well. The film is not harmful, but is distasteful to many and can be prevented with constant stirring and a close eye on temperature.

Document ID: 3
Title: Ngozi ya maziwa (en.wikipedia.org)
Content: Ngozi ya maziwa au lactoderm inahusu filamu nata ya protini ambayo hutengeneza juu ya maziwa ya maziwa na vyakula vyenye maziwa ya maziwa (kama chokoleti ya moto na supu kadhaa). Filamu ya maziwa inaweza kuzalishwa kwa njia ya kuchemsha kawaida na kwa kusafisha kioevu, na kwa hivyo mara nyingi inaweza kuzingatiwa wakati wa kupokanzwa maziwa kwa matumizi ya vinywaji kama vile kunywa chokoleti. Inasababishwa na kuharibika kwa protini kama vile beta-lactoglobulin (protini ya Whey). Unene wa ngozi hutofautiana kulingana na sababu kadhaa, pamoja na joto la maziwa, sura ya chombo, na kiasi cha maziwa kwenye chombo.


Wakati maziwa yamechemshwa, protini za maziwa mumunyifu hutolewa na kisha hua na mafuta ya maziwa na huunda filamu yenye nata juu ya kioevu, ambacho kisha hukauka kwa kuyeyuka. Safu haiitaji kutupwa na inaweza kuliwa, kwani thamani ya lishe ya protini haikuathiriwa na mchakato wa kuharibika. Filamu ya maziwa mara nyingi hufikiriwa kuwa ya kuhitajika na hutumiwa katika mapishi kadhaa kwa vyakula anuwai.
---

Document ID: 2
Title: Why does Milk Form a Skin When It is Heated? (with pictures) (www.delightedcooking.com)
Content: It is often surprising to see a film or skin on nonfat or “skim” milk, since it would seem that, without fat, the proteins would have nothing to bind to. In truth, it is rare to encounter milk that is truly fat free. Most of the skim milk that is sold commercially has very low fat content, but is rarely ever truly fat-free. Even trace amounts of fat on the surface can contribute to skin formation.


A similar phenomenon happens with soy milk, which is generally marketed as fat free. Natural fats still occur in trace amounts, and can be drawn to the surface when exposed to very high temperatures. Soy film can be discarded, but is also considered a delicacy in many Asian cultures. When removed and dried, it is referred to as yuba, or soybean curd, which is used in a variety of recipes.

question_src: Je! Kwa nini vinywaji vya kahawa vya iced vina kafeini zaidi kuliko zile za moto?
report_src: Kinyume na imani inayojitokeza mara kwa mara, vinywaji vingi vya kahawa vilivyopozwa (iced coffee) havina kafeini nyingi kuliko kahawa moto kwa sababu mchakato wa kuzitengeneza katika maji baridi hutoa kafeini katika kiwango cha chini; takwimu zinaonyesha brew baridi ina takribani 40 mg ya kafeini kwa kila 100 g ilhali kahawa moto hupata karibu 60 mg kwa kiasi hicho hicho [2]. Hata kama kahawa ya iced itatengenezwa kwa risasi moja ya espresso, bado huwa na kafeini kidogo kuliko kikombe cha kawaida cha kahawa moto, na kiwango pekee kinachoweza kufikia sawa ni endapo utatumia risasi mbili za espresso [3]. Hivyo, dhana kwamba iced coffee ina kafeini zaidi hutokana na vipimo vikubwa au ongezeko la risasi za espresso, si kwao wenyewe; kiuhalisia, kiasi ama hutoka chini au sawa na kile cha kahawa moto, ingawa kafeini hiyo huingia kwenye damu hatua kwa hatua na kutoa athari kwa muda mrefu zaidi [4].

question_src: Je! Watu wanawezaje kulala salama? Je! Kwanini watu hufanya maamuzi wanayofanya wakati wanalala?
report_src: Ili mtu anayetembea usingizini abaki salama, ziba au ondoa vitu vikali, funga milango na madirisha, kisha ukimkuta akitembea mgeuze kwa upole na umpeleke kitandani; ikiwa anakataa, kaa karibu naye na umkinge dhidi ya hatari badala ya kumtikisa au kumwamsha ghafla, na ukilazimika kumwamsha tumia kelele kubwa, si mguso mkali [3]. Njia hizi hupunguza hatari ya kujeruhiwa kwani somnambulisti huanza kutembea katika usingizi mzito wa NREM, mara nyingi ndani ya saa 1–2 baada ya kulala, wakati macho yao yanaweza kuwa wazi lakini bado hawajitambui [2]. Hali hii hutokea kwa sababu sehemu za ubongo zinazodhibiti harakati zimeamka kidogo ilhali maeneo ya ufahamu na mantiki bado yamelala, hivyo “maamuzi” wanayofanya—kama kukaa juu au kufungua mlango—ni vitendo vya kiotomatiki visivyochujwa na ufahamu wa hatari au nia halisi [2]. Content: Kulala, kujulikana rasmi kama somnambulism, ni shida ya tabia ambayo hutoka wakati wa kulala sana na husababisha kutembea au kutekeleza tabia zingine ngumu wakati bado umelala. Ni kawaida sana kwa watoto kuliko watu wazima na ina uwezekano mkubwa wa kutokea ikiwa mtu ana historia ya familia ya hali hiyo, amelala usingizi, au anakabiliwa na kuamka mara kwa mara kwa usiku.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Kwa nini watu hulala? Sababu, dalili, hatari, zaidi (www.healthline.com)
Content: Kulala kwa kulala ni usumbufu wa kulala ambao hufanyika katika sehemu ya ndani kabisa ya kulala kwako bila macho (NREM). Mara nyingi hufanyika ndani ya masaa 1 hadi 2 ya kulala.


Wakati wa sehemu ya kulala, unaweza kukaa juu, kutembea karibu, na hata kufanya shughuli za kawaida - wakati wote wa kulala. Macho yako yamefunguliwa, lakini bado uko katika hali ya kulala.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: 5 Steps for Stopping a Sleepwalker (www.webmd.com)
Content: Waking someone who is sleepwalking can be dangerous, but allowing a sleepwalker to roam about a room filled with sharp objects or to jump into the driver's seat of a vehicle is what's really hazardous.


The lesson: Stop sleepwalkers and get them back to bed. How? Gently turn them around and make sure they return to the bedroom safely. If they resist, stay with them and help them avoid perilous objects and situations. If you must awaken them, do so with loud noises rather than by shaking or touching them roughly.

Title: Why Do People Sleepwalk? Causes, Symptoms, Dangers, More (www.healthline.com)
Content: Sleepwalking is a sleeping disturbance that occurs in the deepest part of your nonrapid eye movement (NREM) sleep. It most often occurs within 1 to 2 hours of falling asleep.


During an episode of sleepwalking, you may sit up, walk around, and even perform ordinary activities — all while sleeping. Your eyes are open, but you’re actually still in a deep state of sleep.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Why Some People Always Remember Their Dreams and Others Forget (www.healthline.com)
Content: Basically, this theory suggests that dreams occur when our brain is processing information, eliminating the unnecessary stuff and moving important short-term memories into our long-term memory. So people who recall dreams may have a difference in their ability to memorize things in general.


Beyond that, a person’s brain may actually block out a dream so we don’t remember it the following day. “The dream activity can be so real and intense that our brains actually hide, or mask away the dream, so [it doesn’t] get lost between our waking experience, and our dream lives. Thus it is normal to forget dreams, most of the time.” Dimitriu says.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Kwa nini watu wengine wanakumbuka ndoto zao kila wakati na wengine wanasahau (www.healthline.com)
Content: Utafiti uliochapishwa katika jarida la Neuropsychopharmacology na kuripotiwa na Biashara ya Kimataifa Times ilionyesha kwamba watu hao ambao waliripoti kumbukumbu kubwa ya ndoto walikuwa na shughuli zaidi katika makutano ya temporoparietal kuliko wale ambao hawakukumbuka ndoto zao mara nyingi.


Lambert anaambia Healthline kwamba ikiwa mtu hana usingizi wa kutosha, kiwango cha kulala cha REM wanachopata kitashuka, na kuifanya iwe ngumu kwao kukumbuka ndoto zao siku iliyofuata.


Hata sifa za utu zinaweza kuwa kiashiria cha ikiwa mtu ataweza kukumbuka ndoto zao.


Lambert anaendelea: "Watafiti pia waliangalia tabia za kawaida ambazo zinawasilishwa kwa watu ambao wanaweza kukumbuka ndoto zao. Kwa ujumla, watu kama hao wanakabiliwa na mawazo ya mchana, mawazo ya ubunifu, na utambuzi. Wakati huo huo, wale ambao ni wa vitendo zaidi na wanaozingatia kile kilicho nje huwa na ugumu wa kukumbuka ndoto zao."


Hii inaweza kumaanisha kuwa watu wengine wana uwezekano mkubwa wa kukumbuka ndoto zao kuliko wengine, licha ya ubora wao wa kulala.


Sababu zingine, kama mafadhaiko au uzoefu wa kiwewe, pia zinaweza kusababisha watu kuwa na ndoto wazi au ndoto ambazo zina uwezekano mkubwa wa kukumbuka siku inayofuata. Kwa mfano, mtu ambaye anapambana na huzuni baada ya kupoteza mpendwa anaweza kuota juu ya kifo hicho kwa undani. Kukumbuka ndoto siku inayofuata inaweza kuathiri mhemko na kusababisha mafadhaiko zaidi au wasiwasi.

Title: Je! Ndoto za mara kwa mara na uwezo wa kukumbuka zinaonyesha unyogovu? - Sauti ya Uhuru wa Guardian (Guardianlv.com)
Content: Watu ambao wana uwezo wa kukumbuka ndoto zao asubuhi tano kwa wiki, kwa wastani, wana shughuli za hiari zinazotokea katika sehemu fulani za akili zao kuliko zingine. Sehemu za ubongo ambazo zinasimamia viwango hivi vya shughuli huitwa makutano ya temporo-parietal, ambayo ni kitovu cha usindikaji wa habari, na kortini ya mapema, ambayo inawajibika kwa usemi wa utu na upangaji wa tabia ngumu za utambuzi. Na, cha kufurahisha, kuongezeka kwa hali ya juu ni juu wakati wa kuamka na kulala, kwa hivyo inasema utafiti wa watu 41 uliochapishwa hivi karibuni mkondoni Februari 19 katika jarida la Neuropsychopharmacology. Shughuli katika akili za watu katika utafiti huu zilipimwa na tomografia ya chafu ya positron wakati walikuwa macho na kulala. Je! Matokeo haya yanatuambia nini?


Pamoja na utafiti wa zamani kutoka kwa mmoja wa waandishi wa utafiti, Perrine Ruby, matokeo yanatuambia kwa nini watu wengine wanakumbuka ndoto zao na wengine hawafanyi. Utafiti unaohusiana na Ruby ambao ulichapishwa mwaka jana katika jarida la Cerebral Cortex, ambayo ilionyesha kuwa watu ambao wana uwezo wa kukumbuka mara kwa mara ndoto zao pia ni tendaji zaidi kwa sauti wakati wote wamelala na macho. Ruby alitoa maoni kadhaa katika taarifa ya hivi karibuni ambayo ilibadilisha matokeo ya masomo haya yote mawili. Ruby alisema kuwa ubongo unahitaji kuamka kutoka kwa usingizi ili kukariri habari mpya. Hii, alisema Ruby, inaweza kuelezea sababu kwamba wale ambao wanaitikia zaidi kwa kuchochea mazingira wanaweza kukumbuka ndoto zao bora; Wao huamshwa mara nyingi zaidi na kwa hivyo wanaweza kujiingiza kwenye kumbukumbu ndoto zao kuliko wengine ambao hawatekelezi sauti. Kwa kuongezea, watafiti walisema kwamba watu ambao hukumbuka ndoto zao mara nyingi wanaweza pia kuwa na ndoto zaidi kuliko waotaji wa "kumbukumbu ya chini".

Document ID: 2
Title: Why Some People Always Remember Their Dreams and Others Forget (www.healthline.com)
Content: A study published in the journal Neuropsychopharmacology and reported by International Business Times suggested that those people who reported high dream recall had more activity in the temporoparietal junction than those who didn’t recall their dreams often.


Lambert tells Healthline that if someone consistently doesn’t get enough sleep, the amount of REM sleep they experience will drop, making it harder for them to remember their dreams the following day.


Even personality traits can be an indicator of whether someone will be able to remember their dreams.


Lambert continues: “Researchers also looked at the most common personality traits that are presented in people who can recall their dreams. Overall, such people are prone to daydreaming, creative thinking, and introspection. At the same time, those who are more practical and focused on what is outside themselves tend to have difficulty remembering their dreams.”


This may mean that some people are naturally more likely to recall their dreams than others, despite their quality of sleep.


Other factors, like stress or experiencing a trauma, can also cause people to have vivid dreams or nightmares that they’re more likely to recall the next day. For example, a person who’s coping with grief after losing a loved one may dream about the death in elaborate detail. Remembering the dream the next day may affect mood and cause even more stress or anxiety.
