Document ID: 3
Title: Do Frequent Dreams and the Ability to Recall Them Indicate Depression? - Guardian Liberty Voice (guardianlv.com)
Content: People who have the ability to recall their dreams five mornings per week, on average, have more spontaneous activity occurring in certain parts of their brains than others. The parts of the brain that host these increased levels of activity are called the temporo-parietal junction, which is an information-processing hub, and the prefrontal cortex, which is responsible for the expression of personality as well as the planning of complex cognitive behaviors. And, interestingly, this escalation in liveliness is higher during both wakefulness and sleep, so says a study of 41 people recently published online February 19 in the journal Neuropsychopharmacology. The activity in the brains of the people in this study were measured by Positron Emission Tomography while they were awake and sleeping. What do these findings tell us?


In combination with previous research from one of the study’s authors, Perrine Ruby, the findings tell us why some people remember their dreams and some do not. Ruby co-authored related research that was published last year in the journal Cerebral Cortex, which showed that people who have the ability to regularly recall their dreams are also more reactive to sounds when they are both asleep and awake. Ruby made some comments in a recent statement that synthesized the findings for both of these studies. Ruby stated that the brain needs to awaken from sleep in order to memorize new information. This, said Ruby, may explain the reason that those who react more to environmental stimuli can remember their dreams better; they simply are awakened more often and can therefore better encode into memory their dreams than others who are less reactive to sounds. In addition, the researchers said that people who often recall their dreams may also have more dreams than “low-recall” dreamers.

claims_retained: Watu wanaoota kwa undani na kuwaza ndoto zao hushawishiwa na mchanganyiko wa kibiolojia, kisaikolojia na kitabia: Kwanza, nadharia ya uchakataji kumbukumbu inaeleza kuwa ndoto hutokea wakati ubongo unapanga taarifa, hivyo watu wenye uwezo bora wa kukariri mambo kwa jumla hukumbuka ndoto kwa urahisi zaidi [1].

Pili, tafiti za picha-finyu za ubongo zinaonyesha shughuli kubwa katika makutano ya temporoparietal kwa “waotaji” wanaokumbuka ndoto nyingi, eneo linalohusishwa na uangalifu na usindikaji taarifa [2].

Document ID: 2
Title: Why Some People Always Remember Their Dreams and Others Forget (www.healthline.com)
Content: A study published in the journal Neuropsychopharmacology and reported by International Business Times suggested that those people who reported high dream recall had more activity in the temporoparietal junction than those who didn’t recall their dreams often.


Lambert tells Healthline that if someone consistently doesn’t get enough sleep, the amount of REM sleep they experience will drop, making it harder for them to remember their dreams the following day.


Even personality traits can be an indicator of whether someone will be able to remember their dreams.


Lambert continues: “Researchers also looked at the most common personality traits that are presented in people who can recall their dreams. Overall, such people are prone to daydreaming, creative thinking, and introspection. At the same time, those who are more practical and focused on what is outside themselves tend to have difficulty remembering their dreams.”


This may mean that some people are naturally more likely to recall their dreams than others, despite their quality of sleep.


Other factors, like stress or experiencing a trauma, can also cause people to have vivid dreams or nightmares that they’re more likely to recall the next day. For example, a person who’s coping with grief after losing a loved one may dream about the death in elaborate detail. Remembering the dream the next day may affect mood and cause even more stress or anxiety.

Document ID: 3
Title: Je! Ndoto za mara kwa mara na uwezo wa kukumbuka zinaonyesha unyogovu? - Sauti ya Uhuru wa Guardian (Guardianlv.com)
Content: Watu ambao wana uwezo wa kukumbuka ndoto zao asubuhi tano kwa wiki, kwa wastani, wana shughuli za hiari zinazotokea katika sehemu fulani za akili zao kuliko zingine. Sehemu za ubongo ambazo zinasimamia viwango hivi vya shughuli huitwa makutano ya temporo-parietal, ambayo ni kitovu cha usindikaji wa habari, na kortini ya mapema, ambayo inawajibika kwa usemi wa utu na upangaji wa tabia ngumu za utambuzi. Na, cha kufurahisha, kuongezeka kwa hali ya juu ni juu wakati wa kuamka na kulala, kwa hivyo inasema utafiti wa watu 41 uliochapishwa hivi karibuni mkondoni Februari 19 katika jarida la Neuropsychopharmacology. Shughuli katika akili za watu katika utafiti huu zilipimwa na tomografia ya chafu ya positron wakati walikuwa macho na kulala. Je! Matokeo haya yanatuambia nini?


Pamoja na utafiti wa zamani kutoka kwa mmoja wa waandishi wa utafiti, Perrine Ruby, matokeo yanatuambia kwa nini watu wengine wanakumbuka ndoto zao na wengine hawafanyi. Utafiti unaohusiana na Ruby ambao ulichapishwa mwaka jana katika jarida la Cerebral Cortex, ambayo ilionyesha kuwa watu ambao wana uwezo wa kukumbuka mara kwa mara ndoto zao pia ni tendaji zaidi kwa sauti wakati wote wamelala na macho. Ruby alitoa maoni kadhaa katika taarifa ya hivi karibuni ambayo ilibadilisha matokeo ya masomo haya yote mawili. Ruby alisema kuwa ubongo unahitaji kuamka kutoka kwa usingizi ili kukariri habari mpya. Hii, alisema Ruby, inaweza kuelezea sababu kwamba wale ambao wanaitikia zaidi kwa kuchochea mazingira wanaweza kukumbuka ndoto zao bora; Wao huamshwa mara nyingi zaidi na kwa hivyo wanaweza kujiingiza kwenye kumbukumbu ndoto zao kuliko wengine ambao hawatekelezi sauti. Kwa kuongezea, watafiti walisema kwamba watu ambao hukumbuka ndoto zao mara nyingi wanaweza pia kuwa na ndoto zaidi kuliko waotaji wa "kumbukumbu ya chini".

Title: Oceans. Formation of the Oceans. Facts about the Oceans (encyclopedia.lubopitko-bg.com)
Content: The largest features of the Earth's surface are the continents and ocean basins. The four major ocean basins (Arctic, Atlantic, Indian, and Pacific) are bound by landmasses and major oceanic ridges. Each continent is rimmed by a submerged, gently sloping continental margin. This includes the relatively flat continental shelf, generally found at depths of less than 600 feet (183 meters) with a width of a few miles to more than 200 miles (322 kilometers). At the shelf break portion of the margin, there is a rise in the continental shelf before the continental slope begins its plunge to the deep-sea bottom. Deep submarine canyons frequently cut into the continental margin.

Content: Zaidi ya 96% ya jumla ya maji ulimwenguni iko kwenye bahari, kwa hivyo wacha tuanze hapo. Nishati kutoka jua husababisha maji juu ya uso kuyeyuka ndani ya mvuke wa maji - gesi. Mvuke usioonekana huongezeka angani, ambapo hewa ni baridi zaidi, na inaingia mawingu. Mikondo ya hewa husogeza mawingu haya kote duniani.


Matone ya maji yanaunda mawingu, na matone kisha hurudi bahari au ardhi kama mvua - wacha tuseme wakati huu, ni theluji. Theluji itaanguka chini, na mwishowe huyeyuka ndani ya kioevu na kukimbia ndani ya ziwa au mto, ambao hutiririka ndani ya bahari, ambapo huanza mchakato tena.

Content: Vipengele vikubwa vya uso wa Dunia ni mabara na mabonde ya bahari. Bonde kuu nne za bahari (Arctic, Atlantic, Hindi, na Pacific) zimefungwa na maeneo ya ardhi na matuta makubwa ya bahari. Document ID: 3
Title: The Water Cycle (oceantoday.noaa.gov)
Content: Over 96% of total global water is in the ocean, so let’s start there. Energy from the sun causes water on the surface to evaporate into water vapor – a gas. This invisible vapor rises into the atmosphere, where the air is colder, and condenses into clouds. Air currents move these clouds all around the earth.


Water drops form in clouds, and the drops then return to the ocean or land as precipitation - let’s say this time, it’s snow. The snow will fall to the ground, and eventually melts back into a liquid and runs off into a lake or river, which flows back into the ocean, where it starts the process again.

Title: All About the Ocean (www.nationalgeographic.org)
Content: After the Earth began to form about 4.6 billion years ago, it gradually separated into layers of lighter and heavier rock. The lighter rock rose and formed the Earth’s crust. The heavier rock sank and formed the Earth’s core and mantle.


The ocean’s water came from rocks inside the newly forming Earth. As the molten rocks cooled, they released water vapor and other gases. Eventually, the water vapor condensed and covered the crust with a primitive ocean. Today, hot gases from the Earth’s interior continue to produce new water at the bottom of the ocean.

Content: Zaidi ya 96% ya jumla ya maji ulimwenguni iko kwenye bahari, kwa hivyo wacha tuanze hapo. Nishati kutoka jua husababisha maji juu ya uso kuyeyuka ndani ya mvuke wa maji - gesi. Mvuke usioonekana huongezeka angani, ambapo hewa ni baridi zaidi, na inaingia mawingu. Mikondo ya hewa husogeza mawingu haya kote duniani.


Matone ya maji yanaunda mawingu, na matone kisha hurudi bahari au ardhi kama mvua - wacha tuseme wakati huu, ni theluji. Theluji itaanguka chini, na mwishowe huyeyuka ndani ya kioevu na kukimbia ndani ya ziwa au mto, ambao hutiririka ndani ya bahari, ambapo huanza mchakato tena.

Title: The Real Reason Most Prices End in .99 (www.rd.com)
Content: Prices are more likely to end in .99 more than any other pair of numbers—and certainly more than the even .00. We probably don’t think twice about buying something for $5.99 or $16.99, but it is a little strange when you think about it. Why aren’t prices just even dollar amounts? Is it an elaborate marketing scheme to get you to spend more?

Well, essentially…yes. But there’s really nothing “elaborate” about it; it’s actually pretty simple. “It’s a type of psychological pricing,” says Julie Ramhold, consumer analyst with DealNews.com. “Because we read from left to right, we pay less attention to the end of the number versus the beginning.” This is especially effective if you’re just quickly perusing several prices in a row; the first number will definitely stand out to you more. Psychological pricing is powerful, but luckily, there are also plenty of psychology tricks to help you spend less while shopping.

Of course, we still know that $9.99 is basically ten dollars, not nine dollars. But the $.99 trick takes advantage of the way our brains process prices. When we see a price of $9.99, we associate it as part of the $9–$9.99 “range” rather than the $10–$10.99 “range.” “Consumers don’t want to transcend a certain category, so even a penny less may make a huge psychological difference,” explains Subimal Chatterjee, Distinguished Teaching Professor of Marketing at Binghamton University School of Management.

Document ID: 2
Title: Kwa nini bei nyingi huisha .99? (www.livescience.com)
Content: Kukomesha bei katika .99 ni msingi wa nadharia kwamba, kwa sababu tunasoma kutoka kushoto kwenda kulia, nambari ya kwanza ya bei inaungana na sisi zaidi, Hibbett alielezea. Ndio sababu wanunuzi wana uwezekano mkubwa wa kununua bidhaa kwa $ 4.99 kuliko ile inayofanana kwa $ 5 bidhaa inayoanza na 4 inaonekana kama mpango bora kuliko ile inayoanza na 5.

"Sisi pia huwa tunajaribu kupunguza kiwango cha juhudi zilizowekwa katika kufanya maamuzi ya bidhaa, haswa na vitu vya bei ya chini," Hibbett aliiambia Siri ndogo ya Maisha. "Kwa hivyo hatuwezi kusindika nambari baada ya kiwango cha dola."

Kwa kuongezea, .99 pekee hutumika kufanya bidhaa ionekane kuwa inauzwa, kulingana na kifungu "Akili ya Bei yako ya Bei," iliyochapishwa katika toleo la Septemba 2003 la Mapitio ya Biashara ya Harvard. Wateja wanaofahamu bei wamekuwa na masharti ya kuamini kuwa wanapata mpango mzuri wakati wananunua kitu na bei inayomalizika .99 hata kama alama ya chini ni ndogo.

Ikiwa umeongeza nambari yako ya simu kwenye programu, unaweza kuonyesha kwenye akaunti za watu ambao nambari yako imehifadhiwa kwenye simu zao chini ya 'watu ambao unaweza kuwajua'. Hii ni kwa sababu Snapchat hukuruhusu kusawazisha anwani zako za simu kukusaidia kuongeza marafiki wako kwa urahisi.


Watumiaji wanaweza pia kuchambua Snapcode yako ili kuelekezwa kwa wasifu wako wa Snapchat. Ikiwa ulichapisha snapcode yako kwenye mkutano wa umma, mtu yeyote anaweza kuichambua na kukuongeza kwa kutumia nambari hiyo.

## Je! Ni watu gani wa bahati nasibu kwenye Snapchat yangu?


Hivi majuzi, watumiaji kadhaa wamelalamika juu ya kupata utitiri wa 'anaongeza' kwenye Snapchat. Wakati hii haifai kuongeza bendera nyekundu ikiwa ilikuwa ukuaji wa kikaboni, watumiaji wanaoongeza hawana marafiki wa pande zote. Kwa hivyo swali linatokea, walipata wapi maelezo yako ya wasifu kutoka?


Kweli, inaonekana idadi ya watumiaji wameamua kutumia bots kupata wafuasi kwenye programu. Akaunti hizi za bot zinakuongeza na unangojea uiongeze tena. Mara tu ukifanya, wanakuondoa kama rafiki. Hii inaruhusu watumiaji kufikia hadhira kubwa.


Kwa hivyo ikiwa unashangaa kwanini una rundo la wageni kujaribu kukuongeza kwenye Snapchat, wanaweza kuwa akaunti za bot tu.

Content: The truth is, however, that whenever a user opens the Snapchat app, their location is shared on the Snap Map. Verge reporter Dani Deahl explained that she was able to pinpoint one of her friend’s locations down to the exact street address. Since the address was in a residential area, she determined that was where her friend lived.


Snapchat users may assume that sharing their location is harmless, but it could allow for someone to find you or track your frequent locations. In Snapchat’s settings you can select which friends you share your location with, if any at all.

Ikiwa umeongeza nambari yako ya simu kwenye programu, unaweza kuonyesha kwenye akaunti za watu ambao nambari yako imehifadhiwa kwenye simu zao chini ya 'watu ambao unaweza kuwajua'. Hii ni kwa sababu Snapchat hukuruhusu kusawazisha anwani zako za simu kukusaidia kuongeza marafiki wako kwa urahisi.


Watumiaji wanaweza pia kuchambua Snapcode yako ili kuelekezwa kwa wasifu wako wa Snapchat. Ikiwa ulichapisha snapcode yako kwenye mkutano wa umma, mtu yeyote anaweza kuichambua na kukuongeza kwa kutumia nambari hiyo.


Kuhusiana: Ni nini kinatokea wakati unamzuia mtu kwenye Tiktok?


## Je! Ni watu gani wa bahati nasibu kwenye Snapchat yangu?


Hivi majuzi, watumiaji kadhaa wamelalamika juu ya kupata utitiri wa 'anaongeza' kwenye Snapchat. Wakati hii haifai kuongeza bendera nyekundu ikiwa ilikuwa ukuaji wa kikaboni, watumiaji wanaoongeza hawana marafiki wa pande zote. Kwa hivyo swali linatokea, walipata wapi maelezo yako ya wasifu kutoka?


Kweli, inaonekana idadi ya watumiaji wameamua kutumia bots kupata wafuasi kwenye programu. Akaunti hizi za bot zinakuongeza na unangojea uiongeze tena. Mara tu ukifanya, wanakuondoa kama rafiki. Hii inaruhusu watumiaji kufikia hadhira kubwa.


Kwa hivyo ikiwa unashangaa kwanini una rundo la wageni kujaribu kukuongeza kwenye Snapchat, wanaweza kuwa akaunti za bot tu.

Document ID: 4
Title: How To Fix ‘Random People Adding Me On Snapchat’ Problem (nerdschalk.com)
Content: When you create an account on Snapchat, you give Snapchat the permission to display your profile to users that look you up. In this case, if a user knows your Snapchat ID, they can search for you and then add you from the search results.


If you have added your phone number on the app, you may show up on the accounts of people who have your number saved on their phones under ‘People you may know’. This is because Snapchat lets you sync your phone contacts to help you add your friends easily.


Users can also scan your Snapcode to be redirected to your Snapchat profile. If you posted your Snapcode in a public forum, anyone could scan it and add you using that code.


Related: What Happens When You Block Someone On TikTok?


## Who are the random people on my Snapchat?


Recently, a number of users have complained about getting an influx of ‘Adds’ on Snapchat. While this should not raise any red flags if it was organic growth, the users adding have no mutual friends. So the question arises, where did they get your profile info from?


Well, it seems a number of users have resorted to using bots to gain followers on the app. These bot accounts add you and wait for you to add them back. Once you do, they remove you as a friend. This allows users to reach a larger audience.


So if you are wondering why you have a bunch of strangers trying to add you on Snapchat, they could just be bot accounts.

Title: PayPal inafanyaje kazi kwa wauzaji? (yakoBusiness.azcentral.com)
Content: Kuna aina tatu za msingi za akaunti ya PayPal, na wauzaji wanaweza kukubali malipo na yeyote kati yao. Kuunganisha akaunti ya benki au kadi ya mkopo inaruhusu muuzaji kusasisha kwa akaunti ya Waziri Mkuu, ambayo huondoa kikomo hiki na inatoa uwezo wa kukubali malipo ya kadi ya mkopo na malipo pia. Akaunti ya biashara ni sawa na akaunti ya Waziri Mkuu, lakini inaruhusu ufikiaji wa watumiaji wengi. Ada ya kawaida ya kuuza kupitia PayPal ni asilimia 2.9 pamoja na senti 30 kwa ununuzi.

Document ID: 5
Title: Kulipwa na PayPal (www.ebay.com)
Content: Unahitaji akaunti ya PayPal ili kutumia PayPal kupokea malipo kwa mauzo ya eBay. Ikiwa hauna akaunti, tutakuuliza ujiandikishe wakati utaunda orodha yako ya kwanza.


Unapounda orodha, chagua PayPal kama njia ya malipo na ingiza anwani ya barua pepe inayohusishwa na akaunti yako ya PayPal katika sehemu ya Chaguzi za Malipo ya fomu ya orodha.


Kumbuka, ikiwa unapeana PayPal kama chaguo la malipo kwenye eBay (kwa kutumia nembo au maandishi katika maelezo ya bidhaa), lazima ukubali aina zote za malipo ya PayPal, pamoja na malipo kutoka kwa mizani ya akaunti ya PayPal, uhamishaji wa akaunti ya benki, na malipo ya kadi ya mkopo. Hauwezi kuwaambia wanunuzi kuwa unakubali tu aina maalum za malipo ya PayPal. Tazama sera ya njia za malipo kwa habari zaidi. Wakati mnunuzi anakutumia malipo kupitia PayPal, pesa kawaida inapatikana katika akaunti yako ya PayPal mara moja.

Title: How Does PayPal Work for Sellers? (yourbusiness.azcentral.com)
Content: There are three primary types of PayPal account, and sellers can accept payments with any of them. A Personal account allows a seller to receive payments from other PayPal users, but has a withdrawal limit of $500 per month. Connecting a bank account or credit card allows a seller to upgrade to a Premier account, which removes this limit and offers the ability to accept credit and debit card payments as well. A Business account is the same as a Premier account, but allows access by multiple users. The standard fee for selling via PayPal is 2.9 percent plus 30 cents per transaction.

Hauwezi kuwaambia wanunuzi kuwa unakubali tu aina maalum za malipo ya PayPal. Tazama sera ya njia za malipo kwa habari zaidi. Wakati mnunuzi anakutumia malipo kupitia PayPal, pesa kawaida inapatikana katika akaunti yako ya PayPal mara moja.

Title: How Does PayPal Work for Sellers? (yourbusiness.azcentral.com)
Content: There are three primary types of PayPal account, and sellers can accept payments with any of them. A Personal account allows a seller to receive payments from other PayPal users, but has a withdrawal limit of $500 per month. Connecting a bank account or credit card allows a seller to upgrade to a Premier account, which removes this limit and offers the ability to accept credit and debit card payments as well. A Business account is the same as a Premier account, but allows access by multiple users. The standard fee for selling via PayPal is 2.9 percent plus 30 cents per transaction.

Kumbuka, ikiwa unapeana PayPal kama chaguo la malipo kwenye eBay (kwa kutumia nembo au maandishi katika maelezo ya bidhaa), lazima ukubali aina zote za malipo ya PayPal, pamoja na malipo kutoka kwa mizani ya akaunti ya PayPal, uhamishaji wa akaunti ya benki, na malipo ya kadi ya mkopo. Hauwezi kuwaambia wanunuzi kuwa unakubali tu aina maalum za malipo ya PayPal. Tazama sera ya njia za malipo kwa habari zaidi. Wakati mnunuzi anakutumia malipo kupitia PayPal, pesa kawaida inapatikana katika akaunti yako ya PayPal mara moja.

Document ID: 4
Title: How the US Electoral College System Works (www.thoughtco.com)
Content: Each state gets a number of electors equal to its number of members in the U.S. House of Representatives plus one for each of its two U.S. senators. The District of Columbia gets three electors.﻿﻿ State laws determine how electors are chosen, but they are generally selected by the political party committees within the states.


Each elector gets one vote. Thus, a state with eight electors would cast eight votes. As of the 1964 election, there are 538 electors, and the votes of a majority of them—270—are required to be elected.﻿﻿ Because Electoral College representation is based on congressional representation, states with larger populations get more Electoral College votes.

Title: How the US Electoral College System Works (www.thoughtco.com)
Content: When you vote for a presidential candidate, you are in fact voting to instruct the electors from your state to cast their votes for the same candidate.


For example, if you vote for the Republican candidate in the November election, you are really just picking an elector who will be pledged to vote for the Republican candidate when the Electoral College votes in December. The candidate who wins the popular vote in a state wins all the pledged votes of the state's electors in the 48 winner-take-all states and District of Columbia.﻿﻿ Nebraska and Maine award electors proportionally.

Wakati wa Uchaguzi Mkuu wa Novemba, mpiga kura huwaelekeza wateule wa jimbo lake kumpigia kura mgombea huyo, na katika majimbo 48 na Washington, D.C. mshindi wa kura maarufu hupata kura zote za wateule wa jimbo (“winner-take-all”) [3]. Maine na Nebraska huwasambaza wateule kwa mfumo wa mgao, hivyo mshindi anaweza kupata sehemu tu ya kura [1]. Mgombea anahitaji kura angalau 270 za wateule—zaidi ya nusu—ili kushinda urais [1]. Ingawa matokeo hutangazwa usiku wa uchaguzi, wateule hukutana katikati ya Desemba kupiga kura rasmi, na baadhi ya majimbo huwabana kisheria kupiga kura kulingana na matokeo ya jimbo [1].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Presidential Election Process | USAGov (www.usa.gov)
Content: After you cast your ballot for president, your vote goes to a statewide tally. In 48 states and Washington, D.C., the winner gets all the electoral votes for that state. Maine and Nebraska assign their electors using a proportional system.


A candidate needs the vote of at least 270 electors—more than half of all electors—to win the presidential election.


In most cases, a projected winner is announced on election night in November after you vote. But the actual Electoral College vote takes place in mid-December when the electors meet in their states. See the Electoral College timeline of events for the 2020 election.


While the Constitution doesn’t require electors to vote for the candidate chosen by their state's popular vote, some states do. The rare elector who votes for someone else may be fined, disqualified and replaced by a substitute elector, or potentially even prosecuted.

---
Document ID: 3
Title: Jinsi Mfumo wa Chuo cha Uchaguzi cha Amerika unavyofanya kazi (www.thoughtco.com)
Content: Unapompigia kura mgombea wa urais, kwa kweli unapiga kura kuwafundisha wateule kutoka jimbo lako kupiga kura zao kwa mgombea huyo huyo.


Kwa mfano, ikiwa unampigia kura mgombea wa Republican katika uchaguzi wa Novemba, kwa kweli unachukua mteule ambaye ataahidiwa kupiga kura kwa mgombea wa Republican wakati vyuo vikuu vya uchaguzi vinapopiga kura mnamo Desemba. Mgombea anayeshinda kura maarufu katika jimbo atapata kura zote zilizoahidiwa za wateule wa serikali katika majimbo 48 ya washindi-wote na Wilaya ya Columbia. Nebraska na wateule wa tuzo ya Maine.

Title: Jinsi Mfumo wa Chuo cha Uchaguzi cha Amerika unavyofanya kazi (www.thoughtco.com)

Kila mteule anapata kura moja. Kwa hivyo, hali iliyo na wateule nane ingepiga kura nane. Kama ya uchaguzi wa 1964, kuna wateule 538, na kura za wengi wao - 270 - zinahitajika kuchaguliwa. Kwa sababu uwakilishi wa vyuo vikuu vya uchaguzi ni msingi wa uwakilishi wa mkutano, majimbo yaliyo na idadi kubwa ya watu hupata kura za vyuo vikuu zaidi.

claim: Hii ni suala la “bioavailability,” yaani virutubishi kuwapo hakumaanishi mwili vitavifyonza vyote
question_src: Ikiwa na jinsi kiasi kikubwa cha mlozi kinaweza kuwa na kalori kidogo na mdalasini na sukari iliyoongezwa (picha ya lishe katika maandishi)
report_src: Inaweza kuonekana ajabu kwamba kikombe kizima cha mlozi kilichochanganywa na mdalasini na kiasi kidogo cha sukari kinaonyesha kalori chache kuliko ungetarajia, lakini utafiti unaeleza kwamba takriban 20 % ya kalori za mlozi hazipatikani kwa mwili kwa sababu mafuta mengi hubaki yamefungwa katika kuta zake ngumu za seli, hivyo hayanyonywi ipasavyo [1]. Watafiti wa USDA walithibitisha jambo hili kwa kupima kinyesi na mkojo wa walaji na wakaona tofauti hiyo kubwa ya upatikanaji wa nishati [2]. Hii ni suala la “bioavailability,” yaani virutubishi kuwapo hakumaanishi mwili vitavifyonza vyote [3]. Kama umetumia mdalasini pekee hauongezi kalori kiasi—kijiko cha chai kina karibu 6 kcal—lakini sukari inaweza kuongeza: kijiko kidogo (4 g) kina ~16 kcal. Hata hivyo, ukitumia gramu chache tu za sukari, jumla ya kalori ya mchanganyiko bado inaweza kuwa chini ya lebo za jadi za mlozi, kwa sababu punguzo la 20 % ya mlozi (mfano, 160 kcal → 129 kcal kwa huduma ya karanga 23) mara nyingi “hufidia” ongezeko dogo la sukari. Kumbuka kwamba kusaga au kusaga sana mlozi hupunguza ufanisi huu kwa kuvunja kuta za seli na kuruhusu kalori zaidi kufyonzwa [4].

Content: Utafiti mpya uliochapishwa katika Jarida la Amerika la Lishe ya Kliniki uligundua kuwa mlozi una kalori 20% chache kuliko vile ilivyodhaniwa hapo awali. Matokeo yaligundua kuwa huduma moja ya mlozi (karibu karanga 23) ina kalori 129 isipokuwa 160 ambayo imeorodheshwa kwa sasa kwenye jopo la Ukweli wa Lishe.

Document ID: 2
Title: Utafiti mpya unaonyesha kalori chache katika mlozi | Mtandao wa Chakula Afya Afya: Mapishi, Mawazo, na Habari za Chakula | Mtandao wa Chakula (www.foodnetwork.com)
Content: Tafiti kadhaa zilizochapishwa katika kipindi cha miaka 10 iliyopita zimependekeza kwamba wakati watu wanakula mlozi, sio mafuta yote yaliyochimbwa na kufyonzwa. Baadhi ya mafuta yanabaki ndani ya ukuta wa seli ngumu za mlozi. Kwa kugundua kuwa hii inaweza kuathiri idadi ya kalori zinazopatikana kutoka kwa mlozi, watafiti katika Huduma ya Utafiti wa Kilimo wa USDA waliamua kuamua haswa kalori zilizochukuliwa. Hatukushangaa kujifunza kutoka kwa kazi ya Dk. Baer kwamba kalori chache kutoka kwa mlozi zinapatikana kwa kunyonya. Walakini, tulishangazwa sana na ukubwa wa tofauti hiyo. Mnamo mwaka wa 2011, Dk Baer alifanya utafiti kwa kutumia njia hiyo hiyo kujua kalori zinazopatikana kutoka kwa Pistachios na kugundua kuwa idadi hiyo ilikuwa chini ya 5% tu kuliko vile ilivyodhaniwa hapo awali, wakati idadi ya mlozi ilikuwa chini ya 20%.

Document ID: 3
Title: Almonds Have 20% Fewer Calories Than Thought, Based On Research (www.womenshealthmag.com)
Content: Why the change in almonds and cashews? The difference in the calorie counts is because research found your body doesn’t actually break down and use all of the calories that are in nuts, explains Alissa Rumsey, RD, nutrition therapist and owner of Alissa Rumsey Nutrition and Wellness. “This concept is called bioavailability,” she says. “Basically, just because nutrients are present in a food, that doesn’t automatically mean that the body will readily use them. Therefore fewer calories may actually be absorbed.”
---
Document ID: 4
Title: Ngozi kwenye kalori za mlozi (www.almonds.com)
Content: Takwimu zinazosababishwa kutoka kwa utafiti huu mpya zilionyesha kuwa, isipokuwa siagi ya mlozi, aina zote za mlozi zilizochambuliwa hutoa kalori chache kuliko zilizoorodheshwa kwenye vifurushi:


[Picha: virutubishi vya mlozi]


Kushangaa kwanini utofauti katika kalori? Michakato ya mitambo, kama vile kukaa, kukata na kusaga huchukua jukumu kwa sababu huvuruga ukuta wa seli na huathiri saizi ya chembe. Saizi ya chembe pia huathiriwa wakati mlozi hutafunwa na kuchimbwa katika mwili. Kubwa kwa ukubwa wa chembe, chini ya mlozi huvunjwa na enzymes za kumengenya na zaidi ya mlozi hutolewa, kalori chache huchukuliwa. Kubadilisha pia ni kweli: ndogo ukubwa wa chembe, kalori zaidi huchukuliwa. Utafiti zaidi unahitajika kuelewa vizuri matokeo ya utafiti huu na jinsi njia hii ya kupima kalori inaweza kuathiri hesabu ya kalori ya vyakula vingine.

Hata hivyo, ukitumia gramu chache tu za sukari, jumla ya kalori ya mchanganyiko bado inaweza kuwa chini ya lebo za jadi za mlozi, kwa sababu punguzo la 20 % ya mlozi (mfano, 160 kcal → 129 kcal kwa huduma ya karanga 23) mara nyingi “hufidia” ongezeko dogo la sukari.
Kumbuka kwamba kusaga au kusaga sana mlozi hupunguza ufanisi huu kwa kuvunja kuta za seli na kuruhusu kalori zaidi kufyonzwa [4].

Document ID: 4
Title: The Skinny on Almond Calories (www.almonds.com)
Content: The resulting data from this new study showed that, with the exception of almond butter, all of the almond forms analyzed provide fewer calories than is listed on packages:


[Image: almond nutrients]


Wondering why the discrepancy in calories? Mechanical processes, such as roasting, chopping and grinding play a role because they disrupt the cell wall of almonds and affect particle size. Particle size is also affected when almonds are chewed and digested in the body. The larger the particle size, the less the almond is broken down by digestive enzymes and the more of the almond is excreted, so fewer calories are absorbed. The reverse is also true: the smaller the particle size, the more calories are absorbed. Further research is needed to better understand the results of this study and how this method of measuring calories could potentially affect the calorie count of other foods.

Title: How does my phone know, when I am in the deep sleep? (docs.sleep.urbandroid.org)
Content: The phone has an accelerometer sensor build in which is very sensitive and if placed in your bed we have a record of your movement over the nigh. In deep sleep your muscular movements are suppressed (otherwise you would be running or jumping around according to your dreams :)) and thus in this phase the sleep graph gets nearly flat.

Kwa kawaida programu huagiza uiache ikiendesha na uiweke juu ya godoro karibu na mto ili iafikie harakati hizo vizuri [2]. Unapoingia katika usingizi mzito, misuli hukandamizwa hivyo mwili husogea kidogo mno na grafu ya harakati huonekana karibu gorofa, ikiashiria awamu hiyo [1]. Kwa kuchanganua mlolongo wa vipindi vya kutulia na vya kugeuka, programu hukadiria muda na ubora wa usingizi wako, ikiwa ni pamoja na kulala nyepesi na mzito. Hata hivyo, ukitoka kitandani au ukibadilisha shuka kwa nguvu, programu inaweza kudhani bado uko kitandani na kuripoti usingizi usiotulia kimakosa [3].

claim: Kwanza, unapofanya upenyo kati ya kope kuwa mwembamba unaacha “athari ya pini”; ni idadi ndogo tu ya miale ya mwanga iliyo katikati na iliyonyooka ndiyo inayoingia, na miale ya pembeni—inayochangia ukungu kwa astigmatism—huzuiliwa, hivyo picha inakuwa makini zaidi
question_src: Kama mtu aliye na astigmatism, kwa nini ni wakati mimi hupiga macho yangu kidogo naweza kuona wazi zaidi?
report_src: Unapokuwa na astigmatism, kornea yako ina umbo lisilo la kawaida, hivyo mionzi ya mwanga huelekezwa kwenye sehemu tofauti za retina na kusababisha taswira iliyopinda au isiyo wazi; ukikandamiza kope (kusquint) unasaidia kurekebisha hilo kwa njia kadhaa. Kwanza, unapofanya upenyo kati ya kope kuwa mwembamba unaacha “athari ya pini”; ni idadi ndogo tu ya miale ya mwanga iliyo katikati na iliyonyooka ndiyo inayoingia, na miale ya pembeni—inayochangia ukungu kwa astigmatism—huzuiliwa, hivyo picha inakuwa makini zaidi [2]. Pili, kitendo cha kukaza kope hufanya shinikizo dogo mbele ya macho ambalo hubadilisha kidogo umbo la lenzi na uso wa mbele wa jicho, na marekebisho haya madogo yanaweza kufidia kwa muda sehemu isiyo sawa ya kornea na kuboresha uakisi wa mwanga kwenye retina [1]. Tatu, kwa kuwa kope zimefanya uwazi wa mwanafunzi uwe mdogo, mwanafunzi hupungua na kuongeza “kina cha uwanja,” yaani mwanga mdogo huingia na huelekezwa vizuri zaidi, kama kutumia kipenyo kidogo cha kamera, nalo husababisha maono kuonekana makali zaidi [3]. Ndiyo maana unapopiga macho kidogo, maandishi au vitu vya mbali huonekana wazi kuliko kawaida licha ya astigmatism yako.

Title: Kwa nini naweza kuona bora wakati mimi hupiga macho yangu? - Grosinger, Spigelman & Grey (www.eyemichigan.com)
Content: Je! Squinting hufanya nini kwa jicho lako?


Hata ingawa haisikii tofauti, squinting hufanya vitu vitatu kwa macho yetu ambayo husababisha maono wazi.


* Lensi zetu za jicho hubadilisha sura - lensi za jicho ni rahisi na hubadilika sura wakati tunapogonga.
* Lens za jicho hubadilika - marekebisho madogo kwenye lensi yanaturuhusu kuzingatia bora, kama kamera.
* Mwanga mdogo huingia kwenye jicho - taa ndogo huingia, kupunguza athari kwenye retina na kuruhusu kitu tunachoona kutazama.

Document ID: 2
Title: Why Do I See Better When I Squint? (www.invision2020.com)
Content: A small amount of the increased clarity of vision is due to changing the shape of the eye as you squint. However, the main optical principle at work, and one that is quite fascinating, is called the “pinhole effect”. Clear vision is a result of light rays that properly focused on the retina located in the back of the eye. Typically, this is done with glasses or contact lenses; both of which bend light into focus and therefore correct vision.


When we squint it creates the same effect as looking through a pinhole. Basically only a small amount of focused central light rays are allowed into the eye. This prevents the unfocused light rays in the periphery from reaching the retina. The result is better vision. Photographers understand this as “depth of field”.
---

Title: Maono Hack: Jinsi ya kuona wazi bila glasi zako au anwani (maono-na-kusikia.wonderhowto.com)
Content: Sababu kwamba squinting inakusaidia kuona ni kwa sababu inabadilisha sura ya jicho lako, na kumfanya mwanafunzi kuwa mdogo, na hivyo kuruhusu taa ndani na kuweka wazi picha. Hii ni sawa na jinsi aperture kubwa inavyofanya kazi; Shimo ndogo kwenye kamera yako inaruhusu taa kidogo, kwa kuzingatia bora.

Title: Kituo cha Cornell cha Utafiti wa Vifaa (www.ccmr.cornell.edu)
Content: Kwa kupunguza mionzi ya taa ambayo huja kupitia chini na juu ya mwanafunzi, squinting inaruhusu mionzi kupita karibu na katikati ya lensi, na hivyo kuunda picha iliyozingatia zaidi. Kwa hivyo, hiyo inamaanisha kuwa squinting inafanya kazi kwa njia mbili - kwa kubadilisha sura ya jicho na kwa kuruhusu kwa nuru ambayo inaweza kulenga kwa usahihi na lensi.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Why Can I See Better When I Squint My Eyes? - Grosinger, Spigelman & Grey (www.eyemichigan.com)
Content: What Does Squinting Do to Your Eye?


Even though it doesn’t feel much different, squinting does three things to our eyes that lead to slightly clearer vision.


* Our Eye Lens Changes Shape – The lens of the eye is flexible and changes shape when we squint.
* The Eye Lens Adjusts – Small adjustments in the lens allow us to focus better, much like a camera.
* Less Light Enters the Eye – Less light enters, reducing the impact on the retina and allowing the object we view to look sharper.

Title: Kwa nini naona bora wakati mimi squint? (www.invision2020.com)
Content: Kiasi kidogo cha ufafanuzi ulioongezeka wa maono ni kwa sababu ya kubadilisha sura ya jicho unapojifunga. Walakini, kanuni kuu ya macho kazini, na ile inayovutia kabisa, inaitwa "athari ya pini". Maono ya wazi ni matokeo ya mionzi nyepesi ambayo ililenga vizuri kwenye retina iliyo nyuma ya jicho. Kawaida, hii inafanywa na glasi au lensi za mawasiliano; Zote mbili huweka mwanga kwa kuzingatia na kwa hivyo maono sahihi.


Wakati sisi squint inaunda athari sawa na kuangalia kupitia pinhole. Kimsingi tu idadi ndogo ya mionzi ya taa kuu inayolenga inaruhusiwa ndani ya jicho. Hii inazuia mionzi isiyo na mwanga katika pembezoni kutoka kufikia retina. Matokeo yake ni maono bora. Wapiga picha wanaelewa hii kama "kina cha uwanja".

report_src: Kuhalalisha dawa na hasa kutoa dawa chini ya usimamizi wa serikali kunaweza kuleta manufaa makubwa kwa walevi duni (hard-core users). Kutoka kwa mtazamo mpana, wanasera wanaoegemea uhalalishaji wanasema upatikanaji wa dawa zenye ubora unaodhibitiwa na bei nafuu ungeondoa soko la magendo, kushusha gharama za utekelezaji wa sheria na kupunguza uhalifu unaohusiana na dawa, jambo linalowanufaisha zaidi walevi maskini ambao mara nyingi hukumbwa na kukamatwa na gharama kubwa za uraibu [3]. Kwa hivyo, uhalalishaji na usambazaji uliodhibitiwa unaweza kupunguza utegemezi wa walevi duni kwenye masoko haramu, kuimarisha afya zao na kupunguza mgongano wao na mifumo ya kisheria.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Long Term Effects of an Asteroid Impact on Earth (education.seattlepi.com)
Content: It may seem like meteors crashing to Earth are rare, but more than 48 tons of debris falls into Earth's atmosphere every single day. Most of this comes in the form of dust and micrometeorites that burn up instantly, but on rare occasions, larger rocks may fall into the planet's gravity well. Depending on the size of the object, an impact can cause a number of different effects, and a large enough asteroid could drastically change life on Earth.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Athari za muda mrefu za athari ya asteroid duniani (elimu.seattlepi.com)
Content: Athari kubwa ya asteroid inaweza kuunda mabadiliko ya muda mrefu katika anga na hali ya hewa ya sayari. Baada ya athari, uchafu na mwamba uliovunjika ungejaza anga, kuzuia jua na kuunda hali ya giza la karibu na hali kama ya msimu wa baridi. Baada ya chembe kwenye anga kutulia, kuongezeka kwa gesi chafu kutoka kwa moto wa athari na maduka yaliyotolewa katika eneo la crater kunaweza kuongeza joto sana kwa sababu ya kuongezeka kwa athari ya chafu. Ukali na urefu wa kila moja ya awamu hizi hutegemea saizi ya athari, na asteroid moja au mbili ya kilomita na kusababisha uharibifu wa kutosha kusababisha usumbufu ulimwenguni kwa miaka.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Athari za muda mrefu za athari ya asteroid duniani (elimu.seattlepi.com)
Content: Athari nyingine hatari ya mgomo wa asteroid itakuwa uharibifu wa safu ya ozoni. Nishati iliyoingizwa kwa anga na kitu kinachoingia itakuwa ya kutosha kuvuruga safu ya kinga ya ozoni juu katika stratosphere, kuongeza sana kiwango cha taa ya ultraviolet ambayo ilifanya iwe juu ya uso. Hii itaongeza viwango vya saratani ya ulimwengu, kuathiri ukuaji wa mimea na wanyama na ikiwezekana kusababisha mabadiliko ya maumbile kwa kipindi cha mfiduo ulioongezeka. Kulingana na saizi ya asteroid, hii inaweza kudumu kwa miaka kama miwili.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: Katika mazingira ya Dunia, meteors zinaweza kulipuka kutoka ndani (www.space.com)
Content: Mazingira ya Dunia yanaweza kuingilia mambo ya ndani ya hali ya hewa ya porous wakati wanaelekea sayari, na kuunda mifuko ya hewa yenye shinikizo kubwa ndani ya uchafu wa mwamba. Mifuko hii inaweza kusababisha miamba ya nafasi kulipuka, ikivunja vipande vidogo.
---
Document ID: 5
Title: Katika mazingira ya Dunia, meteors zinaweza kulipuka kutoka ndani (www.space.com)
Content: Wakati meteors inapoingia katika mazingira ya sayari, huwaka moto, na mwishowe hutengana. (Hii ni kwa sababu ya kitu -cha shinikizo la RAM au msuguano.). Walakini, utafiti mpya unaonyesha njia mpya ambayo mazingira yanaweza kuvunja hali ya hewa na kulinda Dunia, watafiti walisema.

Title: How to install a VPN on your router (nordvpn.com)
Content: A VPN creates an encrypted and secure connection between the device it’s installed on and the internet. It gathers all of that device’s requests to access the internet and directs them through its encrypted tunnel and VPN server so they can’t be read or redirected.


That’s easy to understand when you’re on a device with a user interface. Want to visit a website? You go through the tunnel. Want to video call your BFF? Through the tunnel. But what happens on a device with no user interface, like a router?


Once you’ve set up a router VPN, every single device connected to your router will have its traffic sent through the encrypted tunnel.

question_src: Je! "Bit" inamaanisha nini, kwa kuzingatia usimbuaji fiche? i.e 4096-bit iliyosimbwa
report_src: Bit ni kitengo cha msingi cha data kwenye kompyuta na mawasiliano, na kila moja huwakilisha moja ya hali mbili, 0 au 1 [1]. Urefu wa mkusanyiko wa biti huitwa urefu wa nambari ya binary, ambapo kila biti hutoa kipimo cha kutokuwa na uhakika cha chaguo kati ya 0 na 1 [3]. Katika usimbuaji fiche, “4096-bit iliyosimbwa” humaanisha ufunguo wa RSA wenye biti 4096 mfululizo—yaani safu ya tarakimu 4096 za 0/1—hivyo nafasi ya mchanganyiko unaowezekana ni 2^4096 na kufanya mashambulizi ya nguvu-kupitia kuwa magumu sana ikilinganishwa na funguo fupi kama 2048-bit [5]. Kadiri idadi ya biti inavyoongezeka, kiwango cha usalama hupanda lakini gharama ya kihesabu pia huongezeka; kwa hivyo 4096-bit huonekana kuwa chaguo la “usalama mzuri” kwenye vifaa vya kisasa, ingawa huweza kupunguza kasi ya operesheni takribani mara tano kuliko urefu mfupi wa ufunguo [5].

question_src: Je! Ukuaji wa kiteknolojia umeongezeka vipi katika miaka 50 iliyopita?
report_src: Katika nusu karne iliyopita, ukuaji wa kiteknolojia umechochewa na Sheria ya Moore, inayodai kuwa idadi ya transistor kwenye mzunguko mmoja huongezeka mara mbili takriban kila baada ya miaka miwili, jambo lililoongeza uwezo wa usindikaji huku gharama ikipungua sana [1]. Tangu Gordon Moore atabiri hili mwaka 1965, sekta imeunda transistor ndogo, za haraka na za bei nafuu, na hivyo kufanya kompyuta ziwe na nguvu zaidi lakini pia ziwe rahisi kumilikiwa na watu wengi [2]. Hatua hii imeongeza ufanisi wa nishati, kupunguza gharama za utengenezaji na kufungua tasnia mpya kama simu janja, uchambuzi wa data kubwa na mitandao ya kijamii, zote zikitegemea kompyuta zenye gharama nafuu na uwezo mkubwa [2]. Mbali na nguvu ya usindikaji, vipengele vingine kama uwezo wa kumbukumbu, kasi ya kuhamisha data na hata idadi ya saizi kwenye kamera za dijiti vimeongezeka kwa kasi sambamba na ongezeko la transistor, vikithibitisha athari ya Sheria ya Moore kwenye nyanja nyingine nyingi za kielektroniki [1]. Kwa jumla, kwa miaka 50 iliyopita tumeona mapinduzi ya dijiti yanayobadilisha jinsi tunavyofanya kazi, kujifunza na kuwasiliana, yote yakisukumwa na kasi hii ya kipekee ya maendeleo ya nusu kondakta [2].

Title: Zaidi ya miaka 50 ya Sheria ya Moore (www.intel.com)
Content: Mnamo 1965, Gordon Moore alifanya utabiri ambao ungeweka kasi ya mapinduzi yetu ya kisasa ya dijiti. Kutoka kwa uangalifu wa hali inayoibuka, Moore alizidisha kuwa kompyuta ingeongezeka kwa nguvu, na kupungua kwa gharama ya jamaa, kwa kasi kubwa. Ufahamu, unaojulikana kama sheria ya Moore, ukawa sheria ya dhahabu kwa tasnia ya umeme, na ubao wa uvumbuzi. Kama mwanzilishi mwenza, Gordon aliweka njia ya Intel kufanya transistors za haraka, ndogo, na za bei nafuu zaidi ambazo zinaendesha zana zetu za kisasa na vifaa vya kuchezea. Hata zaidi ya miaka 50 baadaye, athari za kudumu na faida huhisi kwa njia nyingi.


###Athari za kiuchumi


###Athari za kiuchumi


Utendaji -AKA Nguvu -na Gharama ni madereva mawili muhimu ya maendeleo ya kiteknolojia. Kama transistors zaidi zinafaa katika nafasi ndogo, nguvu ya usindikaji iliongezeka na ufanisi wa nishati umeboreshwa, yote kwa gharama ya chini kwa mtumiaji wa mwisho. Maendeleo haya hayakuongeza tu tasnia zilizopo na uzalishaji ulioongezeka, lakini umesababisha tasnia mpya mpya iliyowezeshwa na kompyuta ya bei rahisi na yenye nguvu.


### Athari za kiteknolojia


### Athari za kiteknolojia


Uchunguzi wa Moore ulibadilisha kompyuta kutoka kwa uboreshaji wa nadra na ghali kuwa hitaji la bei nafuu na la bei nafuu. Teknolojia yote ya kisasa ya kompyuta tunayoijua na tunafurahiya kutoka kwa msingi uliowekwa na sheria ya Moore. Kutoka kwa mtandao yenyewe, kwa media ya kijamii na uchambuzi wa data za kisasa, uvumbuzi huu wote unatokana moja kwa moja kutoka kwa Moore na matokeo yake.


###Athari za kijamii


###Athari za kijamii


Kompyuta isiyo na bei ghali, ya kawaida kupanuka haraka karibu na sisi inabadilisha kimsingi jinsi tunavyofanya kazi, kucheza na kuwasiliana. Nguvu ya msingi ya sheria ya Moore imesababisha mafanikio katika miji ya kisasa, usafirishaji, huduma ya afya, elimu, na uzalishaji wa nishati.

Document ID: 2
Title: Over 50 Years of Moore's Law (www.intel.com)
Content: In 1965, Gordon Moore made a prediction that would set the pace for our modern digital revolution. From careful observation of an emerging trend, Moore extrapolated that computing would dramatically increase in power, and decrease in relative cost, at an exponential pace. The insight, known as Moore’s Law, became the golden rule for the electronics industry, and a springboard for innovation. As a co-founder, Gordon paved the path for Intel to make the ever faster, smaller, more affordable transistors that drive our modern tools and toys. Even over 50 years later, the lasting impact and benefits are felt in many ways.


### Economic Impact


### Economic Impact


Performance—aka power—and cost are two key drivers of technological development. As more transistors fit into smaller spaces, processing power increased and energy efficiency improved, all at a lower cost for the end user. This development not only enhanced existing industries and increased productivity, but it has spawned whole new industries empowered by cheap and powerful computing.


### Technological Impact


### Technological Impact


Moore’s observation transformed computing from a rare and expensive venture into a pervasive and affordable necessity. All of the modern computing technology we know and enjoy sprang from the foundation laid by Moore’s Law. From the Internet itself, to social media and modern data analytics, all these innovations stem directly from Moore and his findings.


### Societal Impact


### Societal Impact


The inexpensive, ubiquitous computing rapidly expanding all around us is fundamentally changing the way we work, play and communicate. The foundational force of Moore’s Law has driven breakthroughs in modern cities, transportation, healthcare, education, and energy production.

Document ID: 2
Title: Zaidi ya miaka 50 ya Sheria ya Moore (www.intel.com)
Content: Mnamo 1965, Gordon Moore alifanya utabiri ambao ungeweka kasi ya mapinduzi yetu ya kisasa ya dijiti. Kutoka kwa uangalifu wa hali inayoibuka, Moore alizidisha kuwa kompyuta ingeongezeka kwa nguvu, na kupungua kwa gharama ya jamaa, kwa kasi kubwa. Ufahamu, unaojulikana kama sheria ya Moore, ukawa sheria ya dhahabu kwa tasnia ya umeme, na ubao wa uvumbuzi. Kama mwanzilishi mwenza, Gordon aliweka njia ya Intel kufanya transistors za haraka, ndogo, na za bei nafuu zaidi ambazo zinaendesha zana zetu za kisasa na vifaa vya kuchezea. Hata zaidi ya miaka 50 baadaye, athari za kudumu na faida huhisi kwa njia nyingi.


###Athari za kiuchumi


###Athari za kiuchumi


Utendaji -AKA Nguvu -na Gharama ni madereva mawili muhimu ya maendeleo ya kiteknolojia. Kama transistors zaidi zinafaa katika nafasi ndogo, nguvu ya usindikaji iliongezeka na ufanisi wa nishati umeboreshwa, yote kwa gharama ya chini kwa mtumiaji wa mwisho. Maendeleo haya hayakuongeza tu tasnia zilizopo na uzalishaji ulioongezeka, lakini umesababisha tasnia mpya mpya iliyowezeshwa na kompyuta ya bei rahisi na yenye nguvu.


### Athari za kiteknolojia


### Athari za kiteknolojia


Uchunguzi wa Moore ulibadilisha kompyuta kutoka kwa uboreshaji wa nadra na ghali kuwa hitaji la bei nafuu na la bei nafuu. Teknolojia yote ya kisasa ya kompyuta tunayoijua na tunafurahiya kutoka kwa msingi uliowekwa na sheria ya Moore. Kutoka kwa mtandao yenyewe, kwa media ya kijamii na uchambuzi wa data za kisasa, uvumbuzi huu wote unatokana moja kwa moja kutoka kwa Moore na matokeo yake.


###Athari za kijamii


###Athari za kijamii


Kompyuta isiyo na bei ghali, ya kawaida kupanuka haraka karibu na sisi inabadilisha kimsingi jinsi tunavyofanya kazi, kucheza na kuwasiliana. Nguvu ya msingi ya sheria ya Moore imesababisha mafanikio katika miji ya kisasa, usafirishaji, huduma ya afya, elimu, na uzalishaji wa nishati.

Hatua hii imeongeza ufanisi wa nishati, kupunguza gharama za utengenezaji na kufungua tasnia mpya kama simu janja, uchambuzi wa data kubwa na mitandao ya kijamii, zote zikitegemea kompyuta zenye gharama nafuu na uwezo mkubwa [2]. Mbali na nguvu ya usindikaji, vipengele vingine kama uwezo wa kumbukumbu, kasi ya kuhamisha data na hata idadi ya saizi kwenye kamera za dijiti vimeongezeka kwa kasi sambamba na ongezeko la transistor, vikithibitisha athari ya Sheria ya Moore kwenye nyanja nyingine nyingi za kielektroniki [1]. Kwa jumla, kwa miaka 50 iliyopita tumeona mapinduzi ya dijiti yanayobadilisha jinsi tunavyofanya kazi, kujifunza na kuwasiliana, yote yakisukumwa na kasi hii ya kipekee ya maendeleo ya nusu kondakta [2].

Hapo chini nitaonyesha jinsi mambo tofauti kama kasi ya usindikaji, bei ya bidhaa, uwezo wa kumbukumbu, na hata idadi na saizi ya saizi katika kamera za dijiti pia zimekuwa zikiendelea.

Document ID: 2
Title: Over 50 Years of Moore's Law (www.intel.com)
Content: In 1965, Gordon Moore made a prediction that would set the pace for our modern digital revolution. From careful observation of an emerging trend, Moore extrapolated that computing would dramatically increase in power, and decrease in relative cost, at an exponential pace. The insight, known as Moore’s Law, became the golden rule for the electronics industry, and a springboard for innovation. As a co-founder, Gordon paved the path for Intel to make the ever faster, smaller, more affordable transistors that drive our modern tools and toys. Even over 50 years later, the lasting impact and benefits are felt in many ways.


### Economic Impact


### Economic Impact


Performance—aka power—and cost are two key drivers of technological development. As more transistors fit into smaller spaces, processing power increased and energy efficiency improved, all at a lower cost for the end user. This development not only enhanced existing industries and increased productivity, but it has spawned whole new industries empowered by cheap and powerful computing.


### Technological Impact


### Technological Impact


Moore’s observation transformed computing from a rare and expensive venture into a pervasive and affordable necessity. All of the modern computing technology we know and enjoy sprang from the foundation laid by Moore’s Law. From the Internet itself, to social media and modern data analytics, all these innovations stem directly from Moore and his findings.


### Societal Impact


### Societal Impact


The inexpensive, ubiquitous computing rapidly expanding all around us is fundamentally changing the way we work, play and communicate. The foundational force of Moore’s Law has driven breakthroughs in modern cities, transportation, healthcare, education, and energy production.
---

question_src: Kwa nini sayari zingine huunda pete wakati zingine huunda mwezi?

Wakati wa kutokea kwa mfumo wa jua, vumbi na barafu vilivyokuwa karibu sana na sayari vilishindwa kung’ana kuwa mwili mmoja kwa sababu mvuto wa sayari ulikuwa mkubwa, hivyo chembe hizo zilibaki zikizunguka kama pete nyembamba badala ya kuzalisha mwezi thabiti [1]. Sayari kubwa za nje kama Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus na Neptune zilikuwa na diski baridi ya vumbi na barafu na hivyo zikapata vifaa vingi vya kuunda pete huku sehemu ya mbali ya diski ikiunda miezi nyingi nje ya Roche limit [3]. Kwa upande mwingine, sayari za ndani ziko karibu sana na Jua kiasi kwamba barafu huyeyuka na pete za aina hiyo haziwezi kudumu [1].

Title: Mstari wa Sayansi ya UCSB (scienceline.ucsb.edu)
Content: Bado kuna mzozo wa kisayansi juu ya jibu halisi la swali hili. Mfumo wa jua ulioundwa kutoka wingu kubwa la gesi na chembe (halisi Stardust-mabaki ya nyota ambayo ililipuka) mabilioni ya miaka iliyopita. "Vumbi" liligonga pamoja kuunda sayari. Baadhi ya vumbi lililobaki liliunda mwezi wa sayari (ingawa asili ya mwezi wa Dunia bado iko juu ya mjadala). Baadhi ya vumbi hili lilikuwa karibu sana na sayari kuunda miezi thabiti, na badala yake iliunda pete. Inawezekana kwamba pete kubwa haziwezi kuunda kwenye sayari za ndani (Mercury, Venus, Dunia, Mars) kwa sababu pete zinafanywa kwa vumbi la barafu waliohifadhiwa, na jua ni moto sana karibu na hiyo kwa pete kuunda.

Document ID: 2
Title: Curiosities: Why do some planets have rings? (news.wisc.edu)
Content: “There are various theories about planetary rings, like the fantastic rings around Saturn, but we cannot say for sure how they are formed,” explains Lattis.


One theory is that the rings formed at the same time as the planet and its major moons. In this case, if material is close to the planet, the planet’s gravitational pull is too strong to coalesce into a moon and the particles that would otherwise form a moon spread out in orbit around the planet as a ring.


Another idea is that a close call by a moon or comet results in the planet’s gravitational tidal force breaking up those bodies, the debris of which then becomes a ring system.

Document ID: 3
Title: Deanna Rostic, St. Catharines, Ontario, Canada (Astronomy.com)
Content: Kiasi kikubwa cha nafasi na mvuto wa chini wa jua katika mkoa mkubwa wa sayari uliruhusu Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, na Neptune kuunda kama mifumo ya jua katika miniature. Tunafikiria kila mmoja wao alivuta kwa nyenzo nyingi na alikuwa na diski ya gesi, vumbi, na barafu iliyozunguka wakati wa malezi. Vumbi na barafu yoyote ambayo haijaingizwa kwenye sayari yenyewe ingekuwa imejaa mwezi wa kawaida tunaona leo karibu na sayari kubwa. Satelaiti hizi ziko karibu na mviringo karibu na ikweta za sayari zao za mwenyeji, kama vile satelaiti nne za Galilaya karibu na Jupiter na Titan karibu na Saturn, ambazo zote zinajumuisha sehemu kubwa za barafu.


Kwa sababu sayari kubwa za nguvu zinatawala eneo kubwa sana, pia zinaweza kukamata vitu vinavyopita kama mwezi, ambavyo tunaita satelaiti zisizo za kawaida. Miezi hizi zisizo za kawaida ni ndogo na zina njia zilizo na mwelekeo mkubwa, eccentricities, na shoka za semimajor.


Kwa kulinganisha, sayari za ulimwengu ziliunda karibu na jua na nyenzo kidogo karibu nao. Walikua polepole kwa kupata sayari nyingi ndogo za mwamba na kamwe hawakukua wa kutosha kukamata diski ya gesi na vumbi. Mwezi wa Dunia labda umeundwa kupitia mgongano wa moja kwa moja. Kitu chochote kikubwa kinachogonga sayari kingekuwa kimetupa nyenzo kutoka kwa ulimwengu, ikiruhusu kushikamana kuwa mwezi.

Nadharia moja ni kwamba pete zilizoundwa wakati huo huo kama sayari na mwezi wake mkubwa. Katika kesi hii, ikiwa nyenzo ziko karibu na sayari, kuvuta kwa mvuto wa sayari hii ni nguvu sana kushikamana ndani ya mwezi na chembe ambazo zingeunda mwezi ulioenea katika mzunguko wa sayari kama pete.

Document ID: 3
Title: Deanna Rostic, St. Catharines, Ontario, Canada (astronomy.com)
Content: The larger volume of space and lower gravity of the Sun in the giant-planet region allowed Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune to form like solar systems in miniature. We think each of them pulled in lots of material and had a disk of gas, dust, and ice surrounding it during formation. Any dust and ice not incorporated into the planet itself would have coalesced into the regular moons we see today around the giant planets. These satellites are in nearly circular orbits near the equators of their host planets, such as the four Galilean satellites around Jupiter and Titan around Saturn, which are all composed of large fractions of ice.


Because the giant planets gravitationally dominate a very large area, they also can efficiently capture passing objects as moons, which we call irregular satellites. These irregular moons are relatively small and have orbits with large inclinations, eccentricities, and semimajor axes.


In contrast, the terrestrial planets formed much closer to the Sun with much less material around them. They grew slowly by accreting many small rocky planetesimals and never grew massive enough to capture a disk of gas and dust. Earth’s Moon probably formed through a direct collision. Any large object striking a planet would have thrown material off the world into orbit, allowing it to coalesce into a moon.

Title: UCSB Science Line (scienceline.ucsb.edu)
Content: There's actually still scientific dispute about the exact answer to this question. The solar system formed from a giant cloud of gas and particles (literally stardust--the remains of a star that had exploded) billions of years ago. The "dust" clumped together to form the planets. Some of the leftover dust formed the moons of the planets (although the origin of Earth's moon is still up for debate). Some of this dust was too close to the planet to form stable moons, and instead formed rings. It is likely that large rings couldn't form on inner planets (Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars) because the rings are made of frozen icy dust, and the sun is too hot this close to it for the rings to form.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Curiosities: Kwa nini sayari zingine zina pete? (News.wisc.edu)
Content: "Kuna nadharia mbali mbali juu ya pete za sayari, kama pete nzuri karibu na Saturn, lakini hatuwezi kusema kwa hakika jinsi zinavyoundwa," anafafanua Lattis.


Nadharia moja ni kwamba pete zilizoundwa wakati huo huo kama sayari na mwezi wake mkubwa. Katika kesi hii, ikiwa nyenzo ziko karibu na sayari, kuvuta kwa mvuto wa sayari hii ni nguvu sana kushikamana ndani ya mwezi na chembe ambazo zingeunda mwezi ulioenea katika mzunguko wa sayari kama pete.


Wazo lingine ni kwamba wito wa karibu wa mwezi au comet husababisha nguvu ya nguvu ya nguvu ya sayari kuvunja miili hiyo, uchafu ambao basi huwa mfumo wa pete.

Document ID: 3
Title: Deanna Rostic, St. Catharines, Ontario, Canada (Astronomy.com)
Content: Kiasi kikubwa cha nafasi na mvuto wa chini wa jua katika mkoa mkubwa wa sayari uliruhusu Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, na Neptune kuunda kama mifumo ya jua katika miniature. Tunafikiria kila mmoja wao alivuta kwa nyenzo nyingi na alikuwa na diski ya gesi, vumbi, na barafu iliyozunguka wakati wa malezi. Vumbi na barafu yoyote ambayo haijaingizwa kwenye sayari yenyewe ingekuwa imejaa mwezi wa kawaida tunaona leo karibu na sayari kubwa. Satelaiti hizi ziko karibu na mviringo karibu na ikweta za sayari zao za mwenyeji, kama vile satelaiti nne za Galilaya karibu na Jupiter na Titan karibu na Saturn, ambazo zote zinajumuisha sehemu kubwa za barafu.


Kwa sababu sayari kubwa za nguvu zinatawala eneo kubwa sana, pia zinaweza kukamata vitu vinavyopita kama mwezi, ambavyo tunaita satelaiti zisizo za kawaida. Miezi hizi zisizo za kawaida ni ndogo na zina njia zilizo na mwelekeo mkubwa, eccentricities, na shoka za semimajor.


Kwa kulinganisha, sayari za ulimwengu ziliunda karibu na jua na nyenzo kidogo karibu nao. Walikua polepole kwa kupata sayari nyingi ndogo za mwamba na kamwe hawakukua wa kutosha kukamata diski ya gesi na vumbi. Mwezi wa Dunia labda umeundwa kupitia mgongano wa moja kwa moja. Kitu chochote kikubwa kinachogonga sayari kingekuwa kimetupa nyenzo kutoka kwa ulimwengu, ikiruhusu kushikamana kuwa mwezi.
---

question_src: Je! Kwa nini Clown nyekundu alichaguliwa kuwa mascot ya McDonalds?
report_src: Clown mwekundu, anayeitwa Ronald McDonald, alichaguliwa kuwa mascot wa McDonald’s baada ya mtendaji wa matangazo Barry Klein kutambua kwamba kufutwa kwa kipindi maarufu cha televisheni Bozo The Clown mwaka 1963 kumeacha pengo la burudani kwa watoto, hivyo akapendekeza kampuni itengeneze clown wake mwenyewe ili kuendeleza mvuto huo na kuvutia wateja wachanga kupitia matangazo ya runinga [1]. Klein alimletea mradi huo Willard Scott—ambaye tayari alikuwa ameigiza Bozo—ili achukue nafasi ya “Ronald McDonald, The Hamburger-appy Clown,” akivaa pua iliyotengenezwa na kikombe cha McDonald na kofia ya treyi ya chakula, hivyo kuunganisha moja kwa moja vichekesho vya clown na bidhaa za mgahawa na kuimarisha utambulisho wa chapa [1]. Uamuzi huo uliweka uso wa kirafiki, mchangamfu na wenye rangi nyekundu ang’avu ili kuwavutia watoto, kuongeza utambuzi wa chapa na kuhamasisha mauzo kupitia uhusiano wa kihisia.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: The Real Reason Ronald McDonald Is the McDonald’s Mascot (www.rd.com)
Content: Bozo the Clown was the star of several television shows during the 1950s, ‘60s, and ‘70s (the character was a franchise, so local TV stations across the country could produce their own Bozo-themed shows—fitting, since McDonald’s would also find success through franchises). At the time, advertising executive Barry Klein worked with the Bozo show in Washington, D.C. and a local McDonald’s franchise, so he convinced the McDonald’s to run commercials during the show, the Baltimore Sun reports.

Unfortunately, the show was canceled in 1963, but Klein saw an opportunity to capitalize on Bozo’s popularity: McDonald’s could create their own clown. Klein brought the actor who had played Bozo, Willard Scott, onto the project, and soon the clown came to life. His nose was a McDonald’s cup, his hat a food tray holding a fake burger, bag of fries, and milkshake. He could even pull hamburgers from his belt. His name? Ronald McDonald, the Hamburger-Happy Clown.
---

Title: Sababu halisi nembo ya McDonald ni ya manjano na nyekundu (www.rd.com)
Content: Rangi nyekundu na manjano zilichaguliwa kwa sababu fulani-na hapana, sio kwa sababu walionekana wazuri na uso wa uso wa Ronald McDonald. Kwa kweli inahusiana na sayansi. Rangi nyekundu inachochea na inahusishwa na kuwa hai. Pia huongeza kiwango cha moyo, ambayo husaidia kuruka hamu yako. Njano ya rangi inahusishwa na furaha na ni rangi inayoonekana zaidi wakati wa mchana, ndio sababu nembo ya McDonald ni rahisi kuona kwenye barabara iliyojaa.
---

Title: Ronald McDonald (McDonalds.fandom.com)
Content: Asili ya Ronald McDonald inajumuisha Willard Scott (wakati huo, mtu wa redio wa ndani ambaye pia alicheza Bozo The Clown kutoka 1959 hadi 1962), ambaye alifanya kazi kwa kutumia jina "Ronald McDonald, Clown ya Hamburger-appy" mnamo 1963 kwenye matangazo matatu tofauti ya runinga. Hizi zilikuwa matangazo matatu ya kwanza ya runinga yaliyo na mhusika.

Kumekuwa na mizozo mkondoni juu ya asili ya asili ya Ronald McDonald na watu kadhaa wakipiga hadithi zingine isipokuwa Willard Scott ambazo zina chanzo cha kuaminika. Walianza mwishoni mwa miaka ya 2000 kwenye wavuti kadhaa.
---

question_src: Kwa nini mifumo ya jua huonekana zaidi 'gorofa'?
report_src: Mifumo ya jua mara nyingi huanzia kama wingu kubwa la gesi na vumbi lenye umbo la karibu duara linaloanguka kwa mvuto [3]. Wingu hili linapokandamizwa, sheria ya uhifadhi wa kasi ya angular inalazimisha jumla ya mzunguko kuendelea kuwa thabiti [1]. Chembe zake hupigaana mara kwa mara, na mgongano huu hupunguza au kufuta mwendo wote ulio juu na chini ya ndege ya jumla huku ukiacha mwendo wa kuzunguka usipungue [1]. Kwa kufutwa kwa mwendo wima, wingu hupoteza unene wake na hubadilika polepole kuwa diski nyembamba ya pande mbili tunayoiona leo [2]. Kiasi cha mzunguko kilichohifadhiwa huendelea kuendesha nyenzo kwenye hiyo ndege moja, hivyo sayari, vimondo na nyota ndogo nyingi huunda safu iliyo karibu tambarare inayojulikana kama iklipitiki ya mfumo wa jua [3].

Title: Why Is The Solar System Flat? (www.scienceabc.com)
Content: The flatness of our solar system can be ascribed to the law of conservation of total angular momentum. Due to this, whenever particles collide, they may move in any direction, but all the up and down motion cancels out, always following the rule that the total spin in that plane must be constant.

Title: Gundua jinsi mfumo wa jua, ambao ulianza kama blob ya spherical isiyo na umbo uliishia kuwa gorofa (www.britannica.com)
Content: Wakati chembe zinapoingia kila mmoja, mwendo wote wa juu na chini huelekea kufuta, ni nishati iliyopotea katika kupasuka na kugongana. Walakini, misa yote lazima iendelee inazunguka, bila usawa, kwa sababu katika ulimwengu wetu, jumla ya inazunguka katika mfumo wowote wa pekee daima hukaa sawa. Kwa hivyo baada ya muda, kupitia mgongano na shambulio, wingu hupoteza dari yake na gorofa ndani ya inazunguka, takriban sura mbili, sura ya diski, kama mfumo wa jua au galaa ya ond.

Title: Redlining a Car: 3 Common Automotive Myths Debunked (knowhow.napaonline.com)
Content: The redline on your car’s tachometer is there to indicate the maximum safe rotational speed of the motor, measured in revolutions per minute. The key word here is safe. question_src: Je! Kwa nini lazors au mwanga mkali hulemaza kamera za dijiti?
report_src: Lasers au mwanga mkali hushinda uwezo wa kamera kwa sababu lenzi hukusanya na kuzingatia mwanga huo kwenye eneo dogo la sensor, hivyo msongamano wa nishati huongezeka na husababisha sensor kushiba au kuchomwa kabisa [2]. Sensorer za CMOS/CCD ni dhaifu kuliko macho ya binadamu, kwa hiyo hata boriti iliyo chini ya viwango salama kwa macho inaweza bado kuharibu kamera, na hakuna kizingiti rasmi cha “MPE” kilichowekwa kwa sensorer hizo [2]. Usiku, wahalifu wanaweza kutumia lasers nyekundu za infrared kutoboa mwanga wa IR wa kamera; wakilenga moja kwa moja kwenye lenzi, kamera hupuuzwa na kushindwa kurekodi picha yoyote, hasa katika giza kamili inapotegemea IR yake mwenyewe [1]. Madhara yanaanzia “doa” ndogo za pikseli chache ambazo hazifanyi kazi hadi maeneo makubwa yaliyoteketea yanayoonyesha “alama” ya boriti, jambo linaloweza kuiacha kamera ikiwa imeharibika kabisa na isiyofaa tena kwa matumizi ya kawaida [3].

Title: Je! Unaweza kulemaza kamera ya uchunguzi na laser ya infrared? (www.a1securitycameras.com)
Content: Kwa bahati mbaya, jibu ni ndio na inatumika kwa kamera zote za uchunguzi. Ikiwa wahalifu wanaotumia taa ya infrared, taa ya taa ya taa ya taa ya taa au hata bodi ya kuonyesha, kamera haiwezi kupata picha wakati wa usiku.


Lasers nyekundu za infra zinaweza kupofusha kamera yako kwa hakika, lakini wahalifu lazima wawe na lengo kamili la lensi ya kamera kufanya hivyo. Kwa hivyo kutumia kamera za dome zilizo na glasi zilizo na kivuli/kuvuta sigara itafanya kuwa ngumu sana kulenga lensi.


Pia kumbuka, lasers hii inafanya kazi vizuri kwenye giza kamili wakati kamera zako zinatumia lensi za IR. Unaweza kufunga IR na kuwa na kamera ya kukaa rangi na utumie taa zingine ili kuepusha hii.

Document ID: 2
Title: ILDA - Laser damage to cameras and sensors (ilda.com)
Content: However, there are no MPEs for sensors such as CMOS or CCD chips. This means a show may be perfectly safe for eyes, but could possibly damage a camera sensor. One reason is that camera lenses may gather more laser light, and concentrate it to a finer point. Another reason is that a CMOS or CCD sensor may be more easily damaged than the eye.


Due to the many varying factors involved with lenses and sensors, laser show producers cannot be responsible for audience-member damage to cameras or camcorders.

Title: Usalama wa Pointer ya Laser - Athari za Laser kwenye kamera, Camcorder na DLPs (www.laserpointersafety.com)
Content: Lasers hutoa mihimili iliyojaa ya mwanga, ambayo inaweza kuwasha nyuso nyeti (kama macho ya jicho) na kusababisha uharibifu. Sensorer za kamera, kwa ujumla, zinahusika zaidi na uharibifu kuliko jicho la mwanadamu.


Kwa vipindi vikubwa kama matamasha ya televisheni, wazalishaji wa laser wanafanya kazi na wateja ili kuepusha maeneo ya kamera za TV na makadirio ya video (washiriki wa ILDA, tazama ukurasa huu kwa maelezo; kuingia inahitajika). Walakini, haiwezekani kwa wazalishaji wa onyesho la laser kuwajibika kwa kamera zote, simu mahiri na camcorder ambazo zinaweza kutumika kwenye onyesho.


Vidokezo kwa Washiriki wa Watazamaji na Kamera Wakati Lasers zinatumika




Ikiwa unahudhuria onyesho la laser kama mwanachama wa watazamaji, unapaswa kuchukua tahadhari nzuri ili usiruhusu boriti ya laser iingie moja kwa moja lensi yako ya kamera.


* Unaweza kupiga mihimili katika midair, au kufanya picha kwenye skrini. Ikiwa huwezi kuona chanzo cha laser (projekta ya pato la projekta au kioo cha kupiga) kwenye kiboreshaji chako, hii inamaanisha haupati nguvu kamili ya boriti kwenye lensi yako. Kuangalia moja kwa moja kama hii haipaswi kusababisha uharibifu.




* Epuka mihimili ambayo inakuja moja kwa moja ndani ya lensi yako (au kubomolewa kwenye kioo au uso mwingine wa kutafakari na kisha kwenye lensi yako). Uwezo wa uharibifu ni mkubwa zaidi wakati nguvu nzima ya boriti inapoingia kwenye lensi za kamera.


Kiwango cha uharibifu wa kamera




Kiwango cha uharibifu kinaweza kutofautiana sana.


* Tumeona kesi za uharibifu mdogo, kama maeneo madogo ya saizi chache ambazo hazifanyi kazi tena. Saizi hazionekani isipokuwa katika eneo la rangi sawa kama anga la bluu.




* Katika hali mbaya zaidi, kunaweza kuwa na maeneo makubwa au zaidi ya pixel. Au kunaweza kuwa na "kuchoma" ya picha ya laser. Uharibifu unaonekana wazi katika picha au video nyingi. Katika kesi hii, kamera imeharibiwa kwa matumizi bora. Picha hapa chini inaonyesha laser nyingi-

Title: Laser Pointer Safety - Laser effects on cameras, camcorders and DLPs (www.laserpointersafety.com)
Content: Lasers emit concentrated beams of light, which can heat up sensitive surfaces (like the eye's retina) and cause damage. Camera sensors are, in general, more susceptible to damage than the human eye.


For large scale shows such as televised concerts, laser show producers work with clients to avoid TV camera locations and video projectors (ILDA Members, see this page for details; login required). However, it is not possible for laser show producers to be responsible for all cameras, smartphones and camcorders which might be used at a show.


Tips for audience members with cameras when lasers are in use




If you attend a laser show as an audience member, you should take reasonable precautions not to let a laser beam DIRECTLY enter your camera lens.


* You can photograph the beams in midair, or doing graphics on a screen. If you can't see the laser source (projector output aperture or bounce mirror) in your viewfinder, this means you're not getting the full beam power into your lens. Indirect viewing like this should not cause damage.




* Avoid beams which are coming straight into your lens (or bounced off a mirror or other reflective surface and then into your lens). The damage potential is much greater when the entire beam power enters the camera lens.


Degree of camera damage




The degree of damage can vary widely.


* We have seen cases of minor damage, such as small areas of a few pixels which no longer work. The pixels are not noticeable unless in an area of uniform color such as a blue sky.

Wanasayansi wakisukuma chembe nyingi kwenda katika hali za juu kuliko za chini (population inversion), idadi ya atomi katika viwango vya juu huzidi ile ya viwango vya chini; ukichomeka usambazaji huu usio wa kawaida kwenye mlinganyo wa joto, thamani inayotoka ni namba hasi, ndiyo kusema T < 0 K [2]. Kitendo kama “kugeuza bonde kuwa kilima” kwenye kimiani ya macho huruhusu atomi “kurukwa” hadi ukingo wa juu wa bendi yao ya chini ya nishati, na hivyo kuanzisha hali hii ya inversion kwa vitendo [3]. Hali ya T < 0 K ni “moto” kupita hali yoyote ya T > 0 K, kwa kuwa mfumo wenye joto hasi utatoa nishati kwa mfumo wowote wa joto chanya mpaka urudi katika usawaziko wa kawaida [1].

question_src: Kwa nini virusi vya mafua hubadilika?
report_src: Virusi vya mafua hubadilika kwa sababu wakati wa kujirudia hufanya makosa yanayosababisha mabadiliko katika nyenzo zao za maumbile [6]. Mabadiliko madogo haya, yanayojulikana kama antigenic drift, hutokea kila mara virusi vinapojirudia na kujikusanya kwa muda, huku yakibadilisha muundo wa protini zao za uso HA na NA [2]. Kadri mabadiliko haya yanavyozidi, huzaa virusi tofauti antijeni ambazo zinaweza kukwepa kinga iliyopo kwa binadamu [3]. Kando na drift, virusi vinaweza kupitia antigenic shift, mabadiliko makubwa na ya ghafla yanayozalisha protini mpya kabisa za HA na/au NA na hivyo kutengeneza aina mpya ya virusi [4]. Shift mara nyingi hutokea wakati virusi vya mafua vinavyosambaa kwa wanyama vinapopata uwezo wa kuambukiza binadamu, na kuleta tishio la mlipuko mkubwa kwa sababu watu hawajawahi kuvikabili [5]. Kwa sababu ya mabadiliko haya, risasi nyingi za mafua hulenga upya protini za uso za virusi [2].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Here's The Frustrating Reason Only One Side of Your Nose Gets Blocked at a Time (www.sciencealert.com)
Content: During the day, the sides switch and the other nostril goes into 'work mode', but why?


This process is automated by the aptly named autonomic nervous system, which is the same system that controls many things your body does all by itself such as digestion and heart rate.


For your nose, this system controls your 'nasal cycle', so that each nostril operates effectively.


The nasal cycle happens, according to the US National Library of Medicine, several times during the day, and is only brought to your attention if your nose is clogged up more than usual.


In order to open one side of your nose and close the other, your body inflates tissue with blood in the same way that a man gets an erection, except, you know, in your nose.


"Increased blood flow causes congestion in one nostril for about 3 to 6 hours before switching to the other side. There is also increased congestion when one is lying down, which can be especially noticeable when the head is turned to one side," Jennifer Shu reports for CNN.

Content: Wakati wa mchana, pande hubadilika na pua nyingine huenda kwenye 'modi ya kazi', lakini kwa nini?


Utaratibu huu unajiendesha na mfumo unaofaa wa neva wa uhuru, ambayo ni mfumo huo huo ambao unadhibiti vitu vingi ambavyo mwili wako hufanya peke yake kama digestion na kiwango cha moyo.


Kwa pua yako, mfumo huu unadhibiti 'mzunguko wako wa pua', ili kila pua inafanya kazi vizuri.

Ili kufungua upande mmoja wa pua yako na kufunga nyingine, mwili wako hupunguza tishu na damu kwa njia ile ile ambayo mwanadamu anapata muundo, isipokuwa, unajua, kwenye pua yako.

Title: The Science Behind Why Only One Nostril Clogs When You’re Sick (www.menshealth.com)
Content: Structures in both sides of your nose called inferior turbinates are responsible for warming and humidifying air before it reaches your lungs, says Dr. Roditi. This protects your lungs by reducing dryness and irritation.

Aidha yana mashirika makubwa ya ushuru yanayosaidia wateja kupanga na kutekeleza mikakati ya kodi [1]. Sehemu zao za ushauri wa biashara na hatari hushughulikia utafiti wa soko, usimamizi wa hatari, na ushauri wa kisheria au uhakikisho wa kiutawala, kisheria na udhibiti [2]. Vilevile, wahasibu wa uchunguzi (forensic) ndani ya Nne Kubwa huchunguza rekodi za kifedha na kutoa ushahidi wa kitaalamu kwenye kesi za mahakamani [1]. Kwa ukubwa na uwekezaji mkubwa katika uajiri na mafunzo, mashirika haya hutumika kama mamlaka inayoongoza katika masoko mengi ya kimataifa na sekta mbalimbali [3].

Title: Why do We go into Fetal Position During Stomach Ache? (www.hngn.com)
Content: Health experts say that foetal position is a "natural defensive" position that alleviates the stomach ache. And it is all due to a person's mind and body.


Dr Bob Adams, family practice and sports medicine specialist, said that people get a sense of protection while being in the fetal position. "When we have bad news, pain, or something's really stressful, we hunch up. It probably goes back to when we were in the uterus." This makes people feel warm and safe.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Je! Kwa nini tunaenda katika nafasi ya fetasi wakati wa maumivu ya tumbo? (www.hngn.com)
Content: Walakini, maelezo ya kisaikolojia ya kujiingiza kwenye mkao wa fetusi inaweza kuwa ngumu kuelezea isipokuwa sababu ya maumivu inayojulikana. Lakini, Dk Adams alielezea nje mkondoni kuwa kuna hali zinazowezekana. Kwa mfano, matumbo huharakisha wakati mtu yuko chini na homa ya tumbo au sumu ya chakula. Hii ni kwa sababu mwili unataka kutoa sumu kutoka kwa mfumo, alielezea Dk Adams.


Mwili wa mwanadamu umeundwa na aina tatu za misuli: laini, moyo, na mifupa. Na njia ya utumbo ni laini ya misuli, ambayo inasimamia harakati zake mwenyewe. "Hauwezi kudhibiti misuli yako laini," Dk Adams alisema. "Hauwezi kupunguza polepole au kuharakisha (laini laini za misuli) kwa kufanya kitu."

Content: Wataalam wa afya wanasema kuwa msimamo wa fetasi ni msimamo wa "kujihami" ambao hupunguza maumivu ya tumbo. Na yote ni kwa sababu ya akili na mwili wa mtu.


Dk Bob Adams, mazoezi ya familia na mtaalam wa dawa za michezo, alisema kuwa watu wanapata hali ya ulinzi wakati wakiwa katika nafasi ya fetasi. "Wakati tunapokuwa na habari mbaya, maumivu, au kitu kinachosumbua sana, tunakusanya. Labda inarudi wakati tulipokuwa kwenye uterasi." Hii inafanya watu kuhisi joto na salama.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Why do We go into Fetal Position During Stomach Ache? (www.hngn.com)
Content: However, physiological explanation to curling up into the fetus posture might be difficult to explain unless the root cause of the pain in known. But, Dr Adams explained on Outside Online  that there are possible circumstances. For example, bowels speed up while a person is down with stomach flu or food poisoning. This is simply because body wants to flush out the toxin from the system, explained Dr Adams.


Human body is made up of three types of muscle: smooth, cardiac, and skeletal. And gastrointestinal tract is smooth muscle, which regulates its own movement. "You can't directly control your smooth muscles," Dr Adams said. "You can't actively slow down or speed up (smooth muscle contractions) by doing something."

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: How Does Light Travel? (sciencing.com)
Content: In the mid 1800s, Scottish physicist James Clerk Maxwell established that light is a form of electromagnetic energy that travels in waves. The question of how it manages to do so in the absence of a medium is explained by the nature of electromagnetic vibrations. When a charged particle vibrates, it produces an electrical vibration that automatically induces a magnetic one -- physicists often visualize these vibrations occurring in perpendicular planes. The paired oscillations propagate outward from the source; no medium, except for the electromagnetic field that permeates the universe, is required to conduct them.
---
