Title: Mstari wa Sayansi ya UCSB (scienceline.ucsb.edu)
Content: Wakati ninasema "mawimbi ya shamba la umeme na sumaku," Ninazungumza juu ya kitu sawa na mawimbi kwenye kamba. Sawa na kuzungusha mwisho wa kamba, tunaweza kubadilisha uwanja wa umeme au sumaku wakati mmoja, na usumbufu huo unasafiri mbali na sisi. (Njia moja ya kubadilisha uwanja wa sumaku kwa hatua ni kushikilia sumaku hapo, kisha kuibadilisha na kurudi.) Tofauti na wimbi kwenye kamba, mawimbi haya kwa kweli husafiri kutoka kwetu pande zote. Inabadilika kuwa katika utupu, kwa mfano katika nafasi ya nje, mawimbi haya husafiri kwa kasi ya mwanga! Haijalishi uwanja unarudi haraka na kurudi, watasafiri kwa kasi sawa kila wakati. (Hewani, mawimbi huenda polepole kidogo kuliko utupu, na kwa glasi, wanaweza kwenda karibu theluthi mbili haraka kama wangefanya utupu, lakini hii sio muhimu sasa. Kuanzia sasa, wakati ninazungumza juu ya kasi ya taa, ninamaanisha kasi ya taa kwa sababu ya kuwa na taa ya kuwasha, na mimi huonyesha kuwa na nguvu ya kuwa na taa, na kuwa na taa ya kuwa na taa, na kuwa na taa ya kutafakari. Mashamba ya sumaku. Hii ni matokeo ya kuvutia: kwamba tunajifunza kitu juu ya nuru kwa kusoma sumaku na mikondo ya umeme.

Title: Maswali na Majibu: Je! Mwanga husafiri milele? | Idara ya Fizikia (van.physics.illinois.edu)
Content: Kwa kulinganisha, mawimbi nyepesi yanaweza kusafiri kupitia utupu, na hauitaji kati. Katika nafasi tupu, wimbi halijasafisha (inakua ndogo) haijalishi inasafiri kwa mbali, kwa sababu wimbi haliingii na kitu kingine chochote. Hii ndio sababu mwanga kutoka kwa nyota za mbali zinaweza kusafiri kupitia nafasi kwa mabilioni ya miaka nyepesi na bado kutufikia duniani. Walakini, nuru pia inaweza kusafiri ndani ya vifaa kadhaa, kama glasi na maji. Katika kesi hii, taa zingine huchukuliwa na kupotea kama joto, kama sauti. Kwa hivyo, chini ya maji, au katika anga yetu, mwanga utasafiri tu anuwai ya laini (ambayo ni tofauti kulingana na mali ya nyenzo ambayo hupitia).

question_src: Je! Wanyama hushughulikaje kupata prickles/miiba/splinters nk kwa miguu yao?
report_src: Wanyama hukabili miiba au vipande vidogo vinavyochoma kwa njia mbili kuu: uzuiaji na uondoaji. Baadhi ya viumbe, kama vile spiny lobster, huwekeza kwenye kinga ya mwili—miiba inayochomoza kwenye gamba lao inazuia vitu na wanyama wengine kuwachoma, hivyo kupunguza uwezekano wa “splinter” kupenya kabisa kwenye tishu laini [2]. Hata hivyo, ikiwa kilekile kinapenya, wanyama wengi hufuata mkakati wa uondoaji wa moja kwa moja; kwa mfano, katika mbwa huanza kwa kusafisha sehemu iliyoathiriwa kwa maji ya joto yenye sabuni, kisha hutumia koleo au viboreshaji kunyakua na kuvuta splinter, na hatimaye kuosha tena kwa sabuni au dawa ya kuua vijidudu ili kuzuia maambukizi [3]. Endapo chipukizi haitatolewa, mwili kawaida hauivunji wala kuimeza; badala yake, huchochea kinga ya asili na tishu zinazokua taratibu zitalazimisha kisiki hicho kusogezwa na kusukumwa nje ya ngozi kadiri muda unavyopita [4]. Hivyo, kinga ya kimofolojia hupunguza hatari ya majeraha, naye mfumo wa kinga na msaada wa kitabibu (kwa wanyama wanaohudumiwa na binadamu) hutumika kuiondoa miiba inapokwisha kudunga.

Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Heat death of the universe (en.wikipedia.org)
Content: The heat death of the universe (also known as the Big Chill or Big Freeze)[1] is a theory on the ultimate fate of the universe, which suggests the universe would evolve to a state of no thermodynamic free energy and would therefore be unable to sustain processes that increase entropy. Heat death does not imply any particular absolute temperature; it only requires that temperature differences or other processes may no longer be exploited to perform work. In the language of physics, this is when the universe reaches thermodynamic equilibrium

Title: Je! Kifo cha joto ni nini na ninaweza kujua wapi zaidi? (www.physlink.com)
Content: 'Heat-kifo' ya ulimwengu ni wakati ulimwengu umefikia hali ya kiwango cha juu. Hii hufanyika wakati nishati zote zinazopatikana (kama vile kutoka kwa chanzo moto) zimehamia maeneo ya nishati kidogo (kama chanzo baridi). Mara hii ikifanyika, hakuna kazi zaidi inayoweza kutolewa kutoka kwa ulimwengu.

Title: Je! Kifo cha joto ni nini na ninaweza kujua wapi zaidi? (www.physlink.com)
Content: Kwa kuwa joto huacha kutiririka, hakuna kazi zaidi inayoweza kupatikana kutoka kwa uhamishaji wa joto. Aina hiyo hiyo ya hali ya usawa pia itatokea na aina zingine zote za nishati (mitambo, umeme, nk). Kwa kuwa hakuna kazi zaidi inaweza kutolewa kwa ulimwengu wakati huo, imekufa vizuri, haswa kwa madhumuni ya wanadamu.

Content: Entropy, ambayo ni idadi ya njia ambazo mfumo unaweza kupangwa haupaswi kupungua, ukitoka kwa hali ya shida ya juu (au usawa wa thermodynamic). Document ID: 2
Title: What exactly is the heat death of the universe and where can I find out more? (www.physlink.com)
Content: The 'heat-death' of the universe is when the universe has reached a state of maximum entropy. This happens when all available energy (such as from a hot source) has moved to places of less energy (such as a colder source). Once this has happened, no more work can be extracted from the universe.
---

Content: Entropy, ambayo ni idadi ya njia ambazo mfumo unaweza kupangwa haupaswi kupungua, ukitoka kwa hali ya shida ya juu (au usawa wa thermodynamic). Nishati yote itabakia imesambazwa sawasawa katika anga lote, na hakuna uwezekano wa kuipanga upya ili kuanzisha mpangilio mpya au kupunguza entropia [4].

Hivyo, hali hii ya entropia ya juu na ukosefu wa nishati inayotumika itaendelea bila mabadiliko makubwa, kwa kuwa hakuna mchakato unaojulikana unaoweza kuirejesha ulimwengu katika hali ya chini ya entropia [1].

Title: Heat death of the universe (en.wikipedia.org)
Content: The heat death of the universe (also known as the Big Chill or Big Freeze)[1] is a theory on the ultimate fate of the universe, which suggests the universe would evolve to a state of no thermodynamic free energy and would therefore be unable to sustain processes that increase entropy. Heat death does not imply any particular absolute temperature; it only requires that temperature differences or other processes may no longer be exploited to perform work. In the language of physics, this is when the universe reaches thermodynamic equilibrium

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: How do cellphones work? (www.explainthatstuff.com)
Content: When you speak into a cellphone, a tiny microphone in the handset converts the up-and-down sounds of your voice into a corresponding up-and-down pattern of electrical signals. A microchip inside the phone turns these signals into strings of numbers. The numbers are packed up into a radio wave and beamed out from the phone's antenna (in some countries, the antenna is called an aerial). The radio wave races through the air at the speed of light until it reaches the nearest cellphone mast.
---

Document ID: 2
Title: How Do Gas Pumps “Know” When Your Car’s Tank Is Full? (www.rd.com)
Content: And pressure has built up in the tank; that pressure is released as the air escapes. McKenzie compares it to holding your thumb over a garden hose: “Blocking part of the hose [increases] the pressure of the water inside, [causing] the water leaving to spray out at an even greater velocity.” When you start to pump gas, the pipe, which has been “blocked” like the hose, releases the air quickly. “This expelled air brings with it a pressure that’s strong enough to hold the valve in the open position,” McKenzie says.


So that’s what happens while you’re filling up your tank. And once it’s full of gas, gasoline, not air, now reaches the pipe inside the nozzle, which evens out the pressure. As McKenzie explains, this creates “a small suctioning force (known as the Venturi effect) that switches the valve to the off position.”

Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Ask a Scholar: What is the True Definition of Latino? by Dario Fernandez-Morera | NAS (www.nas.org)
Content: he Spanish word latino has narrowed its meaning when used in English untranslated as “Latin.” This narrowing was clinched when the United States government adopted the term latino officially in 1997 to complement the English word “Hispanic,” which until then had been used to classify, or rather, attempt to classify, people living in the United States who were Spanish speakers, or belonged to a household where Spanish was spoken, or who were somehow of Spanish heritage, or who self-identified with Spanish ancestry or descent. Now, with the use of the word “Latino,” with a capital, this bureaucratic category has been enlarged to include people of non-Spanish descent if they so wish to be categorized. Basically, anyone who can somehow justify the claim, can now claim to be a “latino” for bureaucratic purposes, and many do so in order to reap various forms of government benefits reserved for particular collectives, or “identity groups.”


In addition, the word Latino now serves to categorize those people who come from Latin America, or descend from people from Latin America, where the spoken language is Spanish, but who are not happy with a noun such as “Hispanic,” which is too redolent of Spain, a country to which many of those formerly categorized as “Hispanics” do not want to be connected. This is the case, for example, of some residents of Mexican descent in the United States, who do not want to be called “Hispanics,” but “Latinos.” One reason given is to have their own collective identity separate from that of other collective identities somehow associated with Spain and its heritage. Another possible reason is a desire to be associated with the Mexica (“Aztec”) culture, which was defeated by the Spaniards, and which is frequently and justifiably extolled for its numerous accomplishments and virtues. Ikiwa kioevu hicho kingeingia mdomoni, seli za ladha zilizo kwenye buds tano maalum (tamu, chumvi, chachu, uchungu, umami) huchambua kemikali na mara nyingi kugundua uchungu au kuwasha badala ya utamu [4]. Hili hutokea kwa sababu manukato yanategemea alkoholi kali na vimumunyisho vingine vya kemikali vinavyohifadhi bidhaa, ambavyo ni sumu na husababisha hisia kali za uchungu au kuchoma, hata kwa kiasi kidogo kuliko mililita 30 [1]. Document ID: 2
Title: Ladha na harufu (www.brainfacts.org)
Content: Ladha na harufu ni akili tofauti na viungo vyao vya receptor, lakini vimefungwa kwa karibu. Vipuli, kemikali katika vyakula, hugunduliwa na buds za ladha, ambazo zina seli maalum za hisia. Inapochochewa, seli hizi hutuma ishara kwa maeneo maalum ya ubongo, ambayo hutufanya tujue mtazamo wa ladha. Vivyo hivyo, seli maalum katika pua huchukua harufu, molekuli za harufu ya hewa. Odorants huchochea protini za receptor zinazopatikana kwenye cilia ya Haillike kwenye vidokezo vya seli za hisia, mchakato ambao huanzisha majibu ya neural. Mwishowe, ujumbe juu ya ladha na harufu hubadilika, kuturuhusu kugundua ladha za chakula.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Ladha na harufu (www.brainfacts.org)
Content: Molekuli za harufu ya hewa, inayoitwa harufu, hugunduliwa na neuroni maalum za hisia ziko kwenye kiraka kidogo cha membrane ya kamasi iliyowekwa kwenye paa la pua. Axons za seli hizi za hisia hupitia manukato kwenye mfupa unaozidi na kuingia balbu mbili za uwizi ziko kwenye kando ya lobe ya mbele ya ubongo.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: Ladha na harufu | Baolojia isiyo na mipaka (kozi.lumenlearning.com)
Content: Akili za harufu na ladha huchanganyika nyuma ya koo. Unapoonja kitu kabla ya kuivuta, harufu hukaa ndani hadi pua inayokusababisha harufu. Wote harufu na ladha hutumia chemoreceptors, ambayo kimsingi inamaanisha wote wanahisi mazingira ya kemikali. Chemoreception hii kwa upande wa ladha, hufanyika kupitia uwepo wa receptors maalum za ladha ndani ya mdomo ambazo hurejelewa kama seli za ladha na zimeunganishwa pamoja kuunda buds za ladha. Buds hizi za ladha, ziko katika papillae ambazo hupatikana katika ulimi, ni maalum kwa njia tano: chumvi, tamu, tamu, uchungu na umami. Vipokezi hivi vimeamilishwa wakati kichocheo chao maalum (i.e. molekuli tamu au chumvi) zipo na ishara kwa ubongo.

Kwa koili ya umeme, mwelekeo wake hupatana na mhimili wa kitanzi kulingana na sheria ya mkono wa kulia [3]. Katika ngazi ya atomu, elektroni nyingi zenye misokoto ya juu na chini hufuta michango yao, lakini elektroni chache zisizofutwa huacha chembe ikiwa na wakati wa sumaku unaoweza kupimika [4]. Dhana hii inatumika pia kwa miili mikubwa: wakati wa sumaku wa Saturni umeunganishwa karibu kikamilifu na mhimili wake wa mzunguko, ilhali wa Dunia unapishana takriban 10° na mhimili wa mzunguko wa sayari [5]. Kiasi na mwelekeo wa wakati wa sumaku ndio msingi wa kuelewa utendakazi wa sumaku, uelekezaji wa nyenzo ferromagneti, na malezi ya manyoya ya anga.

Title: What's Magnetic Moment? | Stanford Magnets (www.stanfordmagnets.com)
Content: In most matter, there are as many electrons with upward and downward spins, and the magnetic moments they produce will cancel each other out, and the entire atom is not magnetic to the outside. Only the atoms of a few matters have different numbers of electrons in different spin directions. In this way, after the magnetic moments of electrons with opposite spins cancel each other out, the spin magnetic moments of some of the electrons are not canceled, so the atom has a magnetic moment.

claim: Deni la kitaifa la Marekani linaendelea kupanda kwa sababu msingi kwamba serikali ya shirikisho hutumia zaidi kuliko inavyokusanya katika mapato ya kodi mwaka baada ya mwaka, hivyo kuunda nakisi ambazo huongezwa moja kwa moja kwenye deni lililopo ; hali hii imeendelea hata wakati uchumi unaboreka na hakuna vita kubwa, kwa kuwa matumizi yasiyoweza kuepukika kama malipo ya Social Security, Medicare na riba kwenye deni yamekuwa yakikua haraka zaidi kuliko mapato ya kodi.
question_src: Inakuaje ingawa uchumi wa Amerika unafanya vizuri kama ilivyokuwa tangu 2007 na hatuko vitani deni yetu ya kitaifa inaendelea kuongezeka?
report_src: Deni la kitaifa la Marekani linaendelea kupanda kwa sababu msingi kwamba serikali ya shirikisho hutumia zaidi kuliko inavyokusanya katika mapato ya kodi mwaka baada ya mwaka, hivyo kuunda nakisi ambazo huongezwa moja kwa moja kwenye deni lililopo [1]; hali hii imeendelea hata wakati uchumi unaboreka na hakuna vita kubwa, kwa kuwa matumizi yasiyoweza kuepukika kama malipo ya Social Security, Medicare na riba kwenye deni yamekuwa yakikua haraka zaidi kuliko mapato ya kodi. Aidha, kipindi cha viwango vya chini vya riba kimeifanya serikali kuona gharama ya kukopa kuwa ndogo, hivyo kuahirisha maamuzi magumu ya kupunguza matumizi au kuongeza mapato. Ingawa ukuaji wa Pato la Taifa (GDP) huongeza uwezo wa serikali kulipia madeni yake, athari ya deni inategemea uwiano wa deni kwa GDP; endapo deni linakua kasi kuliko uchumi, mzigo hubaki mkubwa [2]. Vilevile, misukumo ya kisiasa ya kupunguza kodi bila kupunguza matumizi, pamoja na programu za kichocheo cha uchumi (stimulus) katika nyakati za misukosuko, huchangia kuendeleza nakisi hata katika miaka ya ukuaji. Kwa mkusanyiko wa sababu hizi—nakisi sugu, upanuzi wa matumizi ya kijamii na mazingira rafiki ya ukopaji—deni la taifa linaongezeka licha ya uchumi kufanya vizuri na kutokuwepo kwa vita vikubwa.
all_claims: Deni la kitaifa la Marekani linaendelea kupanda kwa sababu msingi kwamba serikali ya shirikisho hutumia zaidi kuliko inavyokusanya katika mapato ya kodi mwaka baada ya mwaka, hivyo kuunda nakisi ambazo huongezwa moja kwa moja kwenye deni lililopo [1]; hali hii imeendelea hata wakati uchumi unaboreka na hakuna vita kubwa, kwa kuwa matumizi yasiyoweza kuepukika kama malipo ya Social Security, Medicare na riba kwenye deni yamekuwa yakikua haraka zaidi kuliko mapato ya kodi.
Aidha, kipindi cha viwango vya chini vya riba kimeifanya serikali kuona gharama ya kukopa kuwa ndogo, hivyo kuahirisha maamuzi magumu ya kupunguza matumizi au kuongeza mapato.

Document ID: 2
Title: National Debt (www.investopedia.com)
Content: While the debt can be measured in trillions of dollars, it is usually measured as a percentage of gross domestic product (GDP), the debt-to-GDP ratio. That's because as a country's economy grows, the amount of revenue a government can use to pay its debts grows as well.

In addition, a larger economy generally means the country's capital markets will grow and the government can tap them to issue more debt. This means that a country's ability to pay off debt, and the effect that debt might have on the country's economy, is dependent on how large the debt is as a proportion of the overall economy, not the dollar amount

Title: How to Make Soap from Scratch (www.healthline.com)
Content: Soap, by definition, is fat or oil mixed with an alkali. The oil is from an animal or plant, while the alkali is a chemical called lye. In bar soapmaking, the lye is sodium hydroxide. Liquid soap requires potassium hydroxide.


When oil and lye are combined and heated, the result is soap. This chemical reaction is called saponification. Without lye, saponification isn’t possible, so lye is necessary to create soap.
---

Title: Jinsi ya kutengeneza sabuni kutoka mwanzo (www.healthline.com)
Content: Kitaalam, sabuni haiitaji harufu ya kusafisha ngozi. Lakini ikiwa unapenda kuongeza harufu ya kupendeza, unaweza kutumia mafuta muhimu au mafuta ya harufu.


Mafuta muhimu yana msingi wa mmea na yanaweza kuunganishwa ili kuunda harufu za kawaida. Mafuta ya harufu nzuri ni ya syntetisk. Wakati wa kuchagua mafuta ya harufu, tafuta chaguzi salama za ngozi.

Content: Sabuni, kwa ufafanuzi, ni mafuta au mafuta yamechanganywa na alkali. Mafuta hayo ni kutoka kwa mnyama au mmea, wakati alkali ni kemikali inayoitwa lye. Katika sabuni ya bar, LYE ni hydroxide ya sodiamu. Sabuni ya kioevu inahitaji hydroxide ya potasiamu.


Wakati mafuta na lye vimejumuishwa na joto, matokeo yake ni sabuni. Mmenyuko huu wa kemikali huitwa saponization. Bila LYE, saponization haiwezekani, kwa hivyo Lye ni muhimu kuunda sabuni.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Jinsi ya kutengeneza sabuni kutoka mwanzo (www.healthline.com)
Content: Kitaalam, sabuni haiitaji harufu ya kusafisha ngozi. Lakini ikiwa unapenda kuongeza harufu ya kupendeza, unaweza kutumia mafuta muhimu au mafuta ya harufu.


Mafuta muhimu yana msingi wa mmea na yanaweza kuunganishwa ili kuunda harufu za kawaida. Mafuta ya harufu nzuri ni ya syntetisk. Wakati wa kuchagua mafuta ya harufu, tafuta chaguzi salama za ngozi.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Je! Ngozi yangu itaongeza kalori kwenye cream ya ngozi? (www.thenakedscientists.com)
Content: Ikizingatiwa kuwa mtu wa kawaida wa ukubwa, mtu aliyekua, ana eneo la ngozi la labda mita za mraba 2 na kwa kuwa tuko karibu 70% iliyoundwa na maji ndani, tutapoteza maji mengi kwenye ngozi ikiwa haikufanya vizuri kama kizuizi kilicholindwa. Inachukua kazi hii ya kushangaza kimsingi kupitia safu nyembamba sana, Corneum ya Stratum.
---
Document ID: 4
Title: Will my skin soak up the calories in skin cream? (www.thenakedscientists.com)
Content: But where do the oils of the fats go in the end? Well, they mix in with the natural lipids of the stratum corneum and some may well move gradually into the deeper layers of this thin barrier. But once on the other side, they encounter an environment which is very watery. In oily substance, this is not an attractive place and therefore, fat transfer out of the stratum corneum will be very slow and unfavourable.
---

prompt:

Title: Police Stops: What to Do If You Are Pulled Over (www.nolo.com)
Content: After you've pulled over to a safe spot, you should normally turn off your engine. At this point, you might want to show the officer a few other token courtesies. You have little to lose and perhaps something to gain.


Roll down your window all the way. Put out a cigarette if you have one and discard any chewing gum (within the car). You might also want to place your hands on the steering wheel, and, if it's dark, turn on your interior light.

question_src: Kwa kuwa karibu trilioni 10 za deni la dola trilioni 14 huko Amerika linamilikiwa ndani. ELI5 jinsi tunavyodaiwa wenyewe dola trilioni 10.
report_src: Deni la Marekani hugawanyika kati ya “deni la umma” na “deni la ndani” ambalo idara za serikali zinadaiwa zenyewe kwa zenyewe [5]. Deni hili la ndani hutokana na fedha za Usalama wa Jamii na mifuko ya pensheni: kodi za wafanyakazi huingia Hazina, na mifuko yao hupokea hati za Hazina zinazoahidi kulipwa baadaye, hivyo serikali inajiandikia ahadi kwa niaba ya wastaafu hao [1]. Kwa mfano, raia analipa FICA leo, pesa inaingia matumizi ya serikali, naye hupata karatasi inayoahidi malipo yake ya uzeeni—ndiyo kusema, tunadai sisi wenyewe [1]. Zaidi ya hapo, benki, kampuni za bima, Hifadhi ya Shirikisho, serikali za majimbo na wananchi wenyewe hushikilia takriban 40 % ya deni lote kupitia dhamana walizonunua kama uwekezaji au akiba salama [2]. Kwa sababu serikali za nje zinashikilia karibu theluthi moja tu ya deni la umma, sehemu kubwa iliyobaki—takriban dola trilioni 10 katika mfano wa trilioni 14—inamilikiwa na taasisi na watu wa Marekani wenyewe, ni kama kuhamisha pesa mfukoni mwa kulia kwenda wa kushoto [3]. Siku deni hilo likilipwa, serikali hutumia mapato mapya ya kodi au hukopa tena, hivyo “deni kwa sisi wenyewe” hubaki kuwa mpango wa ndani wa kugawanya na kusogeza akiba ya wananchi, si bili inayoenda ng’ambo [5].

Deni hili la ndani hutokana na fedha za Usalama wa Jamii na mifuko ya pensheni: kodi za wafanyakazi huingia Hazina, na mifuko yao hupokea hati za Hazina zinazoahidi kulipwa baadaye, hivyo serikali inajiandikia ahadi kwa niaba ya wastaafu hao [1]. Kwa mfano, raia analipa FICA leo, pesa inaingia matumizi ya serikali, naye hupata karatasi inayoahidi malipo yake ya uzeeni—ndiyo kusema, tunadai sisi wenyewe [1]. Zaidi ya hapo, benki, kampuni za bima, Hifadhi ya Shirikisho, serikali za majimbo na wananchi wenyewe hushikilia takriban 40 % ya deni lote kupitia dhamana walizonunua kama uwekezaji au akiba salama [2]. Kwa sababu serikali za nje zinashikilia karibu theluthi moja tu ya deni la umma, sehemu kubwa iliyobaki—takriban dola trilioni 10 katika mfano wa trilioni 14—inamilikiwa na taasisi na watu wa Marekani wenyewe, ni kama kuhamisha pesa mfukoni mwa kulia kwenda wa kushoto [3]. Siku deni hilo likilipwa, serikali hutumia mapato mapya ya kodi au hukopa tena, hivyo “deni kwa sisi wenyewe” hubaki kuwa mpango wa ndani wa kugawanya na kusogeza akiba ya wananchi, si bili inayoenda ng’ambo [5].

Title: The Real Owner of the US Debt Will Surprise You (www.thebalance.com)
Content: Many people believe that much of U.S. debt is owed to foreign countries like China and Japan. The truth is, most of it is owed to Social Security and pension funds. This means U.S. citizens, through their retirement money, own most of the national debt.

 * Public debt, held by other countries, the Federal Reserve, mutual funds, and other entities and individuals * Intragovernmental holdings, held by Social Security, Military Retirement Fund, Medicare, and other retirement funds

claim: Kulingana na uelewa wa sasa wa fizikia hakuna mtu amewahi kuonyesha njia salama ya kusafiri kurudi nyuma katika wakati, jambo ambalo hufanya tukio la “kurudi siku chache nyuma na kupokea simu” liwe la nadharia tu ; hivyo, kinachotokea kivitendo ni kwamba hutaweza kuwepo mahali hapo waendeapo, kwa sababu kurudi nyuma katika wakati bado haijathibitika na huenda haiwezekani kabisa.
question_src: Ni nini kinatokea ikiwa nilirudi siku chache kwa wakati, na mtu anaita simu yangu ya rununu?
report_src: Kulingana na uelewa wa sasa wa fizikia hakuna mtu amewahi kuonyesha njia salama ya kusafiri kurudi nyuma katika wakati, jambo ambalo hufanya tukio la “kurudi siku chache nyuma na kupokea simu” liwe la nadharia tu [1]; hivyo, kinachotokea kivitendo ni kwamba hutaweza kuwepo mahali hapo waendeapo, kwa sababu kurudi nyuma katika wakati bado haijathibitika na huenda haiwezekani kabisa. Ikiwa tunapuuzia kikwazo hicho na kukubali dhana ya kimawazo, yapo matokeo mawili: (1) Simu yako imesafiri pamoja nawe, kwa hiyo mtandao uliopo “siku hizo” unaweza kuitambua na kupokea wito kama kawaida kadiri mitambo inavyoruhusu—lakini hii ingeunda nakala mbili za namba yako katika nyakati tofauti, jambo linaloweza kusababisha mkanganyiko wa kumbukumbu na bili; (2) Kama simu imebaki kwenye wakati wa asili, mpigaji atapata huduma ya sauti (voicemail) au “haipatikani,” kwa sababu kifaa chenyewe hakipo kwenye mtandao. Vyovyote vile, wazushi wa fizikia huonya uwepo wa misukosuko ya mantiki kama “paradox ya babu,” inayodokeza kuwa vitendo kama hivyo vinaweza kukinzana na sababu-matokeo na kwa hivyo huenda haviwezekani kimsingi.
all_claims: Kulingana na uelewa wa sasa wa fizikia hakuna mtu amewahi kuonyesha njia salama ya kusafiri kurudi nyuma katika wakati, jambo ambalo hufanya tukio la “kurudi siku chache nyuma na kupokea simu” liwe la nadharia tu [1]; hivyo, kinachotokea kivitendo ni kwamba hutaweza kuwepo mahali hapo waendeapo, kwa sababu kurudi nyuma katika wakati bado haijathibitika na huenda haiwezekani kabisa.

Ikiwa tunapuuzia kikwazo hicho na kukubali dhana ya kimawazo, yapo matokeo mawili: (1) Simu yako imesafiri pamoja nawe, kwa hiyo mtandao uliopo “siku hizo” unaweza kuitambua na kupokea wito kama kawaida kadiri mitambo inavyoruhusu—lakini hii ingeunda nakala mbili za namba yako katika nyakati tofauti, jambo linaloweza kusababisha mkanganyiko wa kumbukumbu na bili; (2) Kama simu imebaki kwenye wakati wa asili, mpigaji atapata huduma ya sauti (voicemail) au “haipatikani,” kwa sababu kifaa chenyewe hakipo kwenye mtandao.

Vyovyote vile, wazushi wa fizikia huonya uwepo wa misukosuko ya mantiki kama “paradox ya babu,” inayodokeza kuwa vitendo kama hivyo vinaweza kukinzana na sababu-matokeo na kwa hivyo huenda haviwezekani kimsingi.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Is time travel possible? (www.space.com)
Content: Although many people are fascinated by the idea of changing the past or seeing the future before it's due, no person has ever demonstrated the kind of back-and-forth time travel seen in science fiction, or proposed a method of sending a person through significant periods of time that wouldn't destroy them on the way. And, as physicist Stephen Hawking pointed out in his book "Black Holes and Baby Universes" (Bantam, 1994), "The best evidence we have that time travel is not possible, and never will be, is that we have not been invaded by hordes of tourists from the future."
---

Document ID: 2
Title: Why do we have to dig so deep to uncover ancient ruins? (www.sciencefocus.com)
Content: There is a survivorship bias at work here: buildings and monuments left exposed on the surface don’t last very long. Humans steal the best bits to reuse in other buildings, and erosion wears everything else to dust. So the only ancient ruins we find are the ones that were buried.


But they got buried in the first place because the ground level of ancient cities tended to steadily rise. Settlements constantly imported food and building materials for the population, but getting rid of waste and rubbish was a much lower priority

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: How Did Ancient Civilizations Get Buried? (parade.com)
Content: With certain notable exceptions, such as Pompeii, only abandoned fragments of past civilizations were buried by natural forces. People migrated and disseminated, leaving unwanted structures behind. Deserted buildings degraded from a lack of maintenance; plants overtook the space, died and decayed, building layers of soil over the centuries. Dust and debris from neighboring areas blew over the land, rains caused mudslides, storms toppled walls, earthquakes reshaped the local topography over time, and more.
---

Document ID: 2
Title: Why do we have to dig so deep to uncover ancient ruins? (www.sciencefocus.com)
Content: There is a survivorship bias at work here: buildings and monuments left exposed on the surface don’t last very long. Humans steal the best bits to reuse in other buildings, and erosion wears everything else to dust. So the only ancient ruins we find are the ones that were buried.


But they got buried in the first place because the ground level of ancient cities tended to steadily rise. Settlements constantly imported food and building materials for the population, but getting rid of waste and rubbish was a much lower priority

Title: Formication: Anxiety, Menopause, Treatment, Causes, at Night (www.healthline.com)
Content: Formication is the feeling of insects crawling across or underneath your skin. The name comes from the Latin word “formica,”which means ant.


Formication is known as a type of paresthesia. Paresthesia happen when you feel sensations on your skin that don’t have a physical cause. Paresthesia can take many forms. These can include burning, tingling, or numbness. With formication, you might also describe the “crawling” sensation as feeling like “pins and needles.” Formication is also called a tactile hallucination. This means that you’re feeling a sensation that has no physical cause.


Formication can be a symptom of several conditions. These conditions include fibromyalgia and Parkinson’s disease. Withdrawal from alcohol or drug use can also trigger formication.

question_src: Kuna tofauti gani kati ya vifungo vya Sigma na vifungo vya PI?
report_src: Kifungo cha Sigma huundwa kwa kuingiliana kwa moja kwa moja (head-to-head) au axial kati ya orbitals za atomi mbili, hivyo msongamano wa elektroni uko kando ya mhimili unaounganisha viini vya atomi [1]; kwa kulinganisha, kifungo cha Pi hutokana na kuingiliana kwa sambamba (side-by-side) ambapo elektroni zinasambaa juu na chini ya mhimili huo [1]. Title: Difference Between Sigma and Pi bond - Chemical Bonds (byjus.com)
Content: Sigma bond is a chemical bond formed by the linear or co-axial overlapping of the atomic orbitals of two atoms. A pi bond is a type of covalent bond that exists between atoms where the electrons are on top and bottom of the axis connecting the nuclei of the joined atoms. It is formed by the parallel or lateral overlapping of the atomic orbitals.

• Vifungo vya PI husababisha molekuli zisizo na muundo.


• Vifungo vya Sigma huruhusu mzunguko wa bure wa atomi wakati vifungo vya PI vinazuia mzunguko wa bure.

Title: Difference Between Sigma and Pi bond - Chemical Bonds (byjus.com)
Content: Sigma bond is a chemical bond formed by the linear or co-axial overlapping of the atomic orbitals of two atoms. A pi bond is a type of covalent bond that exists between atoms where the electrons are on top and bottom of the axis connecting the nuclei of the joined atoms. It is formed by the parallel or lateral overlapping of the atomic orbitals.
---

Document ID: 2
Title: Difference Between Sigma and pi Bonds | Compare the Difference Between Similar Terms (www.differencebetween.com)
Content: • Sigma bonds are formed by head to head overlapping of orbitals, whereas pi bonds are formed by the lateral overlapping.


• Sigma bonds are stronger than pi bonds.


• Sigma bonds can be formed between both s and p orbitals whereas pi bonds are mostly formed between p and d orbitals. 


• The single covalent bonds between atoms are sigma bonds. When there are multiple bonds between atoms, pi bonds can be seen.


• pi bonds result in unsaturated molecules.


• Sigma bonds allow free rotation of atoms whereas pi bonds restrict the free rotation.
---

claim: Mitaji ya ubia hufanya kazi kwa kukusanya fedha kutoka kwa wawekezaji wenye uwezo, benki za uwekezaji na taasisi zingine, kisha kuziwekeza kama usawa katika kampuni changa zenye uwezo mkubwa wa kukua, badala ya kupokea riba ya mkopo
question_src: Je! Mitaji ya ubia inafanyaje kazi?
report_src: Mitaji ya ubia hufanya kazi kwa kukusanya fedha kutoka kwa wawekezaji wenye uwezo, benki za uwekezaji na taasisi zingine, kisha kuziwekeza kama usawa katika kampuni changa zenye uwezo mkubwa wa kukua, badala ya kupokea riba ya mkopo [1]. Kampuni zinazolengwa mara nyingi ni ndogo au zipo tu kama mpango, hivyo zinahitaji mtaji ili kutengeneza bidhaa, kupanua soko au kuongeza wafanyakazi [2]. Wawekezaji wa VC hupata hisa na hutegemea ongezeko la thamani ya kampuni ili kupata faida kubwa baadaye kupitia mauzo ya hisa, IPO au upatikanaji mwingine, jambo linalowafanya wakubali hatari kubwa, ukosefu wa ukwasi na upeo wa muda mrefu wa uwekezaji [3]. Kando na pesa, VC wanaweza kutoa utaalam wa kiufundi au usimamizi, na mara nyingi wanachukua viti vya bodi ili kushiriki katika maamuzi muhimu ya kimkakati na kuhakikisha ukuaji unaotarajiwa [1]. Mchakato kawaida unahusisha uchunguzi wa kina wa mpango wa biashara, majadiliano ya thamani na makubaliano ya usawa, utoaji wa fedha kwa awamu kulingana na hatua za utendaji, ufuatiliaji wa karibu wa maendeleo na hatimaye hatua ya kutoka (exit) ili kuvuna faida za mtaji [3].
all_claims: Mitaji ya ubia hufanya kazi kwa kukusanya fedha kutoka kwa wawekezaji wenye uwezo, benki za uwekezaji na taasisi zingine, kisha kuziwekeza kama usawa katika kampuni changa zenye uwezo mkubwa wa kukua, badala ya kupokea riba ya mkopo [1].
Kampuni zinazolengwa mara nyingi ni ndogo au zipo tu kama mpango, hivyo zinahitaji mtaji ili kutengeneza bidhaa, kupanua soko au kuongeza wafanyakazi [2].

Kando na pesa, VC wanaweza kutoa utaalam wa kiufundi au usimamizi, na mara nyingi wanachukua viti vya bodi ili kushiriki katika maamuzi muhimu ya kimkakati na kuhakikisha ukuaji unaotarajiwa [1].

Title: What Is the Stock Market and How Does It Work? - NerdWallet (www.nerdwallet.com)
Content: The stock market works through a network of exchanges — you may have heard of the New York Stock Exchange or the Nasdaq. Companies list shares of their stock on an exchange through a process called an initial public offering, or IPO. Investors purchase those shares, which allows the company to raise money to grow its business. Investors can then buy and sell these stocks among themselves, and the exchange tracks the supply and demand of each listed stock.

Title: What Is the Stock Market and How Does It Work? - NerdWallet (www.nerdwallet.com)
Content: The stock market works through a network of exchanges — you may have heard of the New York Stock Exchange or the Nasdaq. Companies list shares of their stock on an exchange through a process called an initial public offering, or IPO. Investors can then buy and sell these stocks among themselves, and the exchange tracks the supply and demand of each listed stock.

Title: A Breakdown on How the Stock Market Works (www.investopedia.com)
Content: * Stocks, or shares of a company, represent ownership equity in the firm, which give shareholders voting rights as well as a residual claim on corporate earnings in the form of capital gains and dividends.
* Stock markets are where individual and institutional investors come together to buy and sell shares in a public venue. Nowadays these exchanges exist as electronic marketplaces.
* Share prices are set by supply and demand in the market as buyers and sellers place orders. Order flow and bid-ask spreads are often maintained by specialists or market makers to ensure an orderly and fair market.

claim: Majina ya nafasi za mpira wa kikapu yalitokana moja kwa moja na majukumu ya kimkakati ambayo wachezaji walitekeleza uwanjani: mwanzoni kulikuwepo tu makundi matatu—walinzi (guards) waliolinda na kusukuma mpira mbele, mbele (forwards) waliotangulia mashambulizi, na kituo (center) aliyesimama katikati kwa ulinzi na kurudisha mipira—na timu ya kawaida ilikuwa na walinzi wawili, mbele mbili na kituo kimoja
question_src: Je! Nafasi katika mpira wa kikapu zilipataje majina yao?
report_src: Majina ya nafasi za mpira wa kikapu yalitokana moja kwa moja na majukumu ya kimkakati ambayo wachezaji walitekeleza uwanjani: mwanzoni kulikuwepo tu makundi matatu—walinzi (guards) waliolinda na kusukuma mpira mbele, mbele (forwards) waliotangulia mashambulizi, na kituo (center) aliyesimama katikati kwa ulinzi na kurudisha mipira—na timu ya kawaida ilikuwa na walinzi wawili, mbele mbili na kituo kimoja [1]. Kadiri mchezo ulivyoendelea na majukumu maalumu yakajitokeza, kila aina ya mlinzi na mbele iligawanywa zaidi; hivyo walinzi wakapokea majina ya “walinzi wa uhakika” (point guards) na “walinzi wa risasi” (shooting guards), ilhali mbele zikawa “ndogo mbele” (small forwards) na “nguvu mbele” (power forwards), huku kituo kikiendelea kuitwa “center” [1]. Ili kurahisisha mawasiliano ya kiufundi, nafasi hizi tano pia zilipewa nambari 1 hadi 5 kwa mpangilio huu: PG-1, SG-2, SF-3, PF-4 na C-5, nambari ambazo zimebaki kuwa rejea ya haraka kwa makocha na wachezaji ulimwenguni [1].

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Basketball positions (en.wikipedia.org)
Content: Historically, these players have been assigned to positions defined by the role they play on the court, from a strategic point of view. Broadly speaking, the three main positions are guard, forward, and center, with the standard team featuring two guards, two forwards, and a center. Over time, as more specialized roles developed, each of the guards and forwards came to be differentiated, and today each of the five positions are known by unique names, each of which has also been assigned a number: point guard (PG) or 1, the shooting guard (SG) or 2, the small forward (SF) or 3, the power forward (PF) or 4, and the center (C) or 5.

Title: Basketball positions (en.wikipedia.org)
Content: Historically, these players have been assigned to positions defined by the role they play on the court, from a strategic point of view. Broadly speaking, the three main positions are guard, forward, and center, with the standard team featuring two guards, two forwards, and a center. question_src: Kwa nini mafuta na gesi inaweza kusababisha tetemeko la ardhi na kuanguka?
report_src: Shughuli za uchimbaji mafuta na gesi huchangia matetemeko na kuanguka kwa ardhi kwa sababu huchanganya mbinu mbili zenye athari kubwa: kwanza, upasuwaji wa miamba (hydraulic fracturing) hutoboa na kupasua shale kwa maji, mchanga na kemikali ili kufyekwa mafuta, na pili, maji machafu yaliyochanganyika na chumvi nyingi hurudishwa haraka katika visima vya sindano kwa shinikizo la juu; sindano hii, inayoweza kufikisha mamia ya mamilioni ya galoni kwa mwaka, hupandisha shinikizo la maji kwenye mapasuko na kufungua mikunjo iliyolala, hivyo kusababisha miamba kuteleza na kutoa mitetemeko ya ardhi midogo hadi mikubwa [1]. Utafiti wa Oklahoma umeonyesha kuwa visima vinne tu vya utupaji maji vilivyokuwa na viwango vikubwa vya sindano vilihusishwa na 20 % ya matetemeko yote ya eneo hilo, na athari zake zilisikika zaidi ya km 30 kutoka visimani, ikionyesha nguvu ya uhamiaji wa maji kwa umbali mrefu [2]. Title: Why Is Oil And Gas Activity Causing Earthquakes? And Can We Reduce The Risk? (www.iflscience.com)
Content: Studies including two reports issued in April, indicate that human activities, including activities related to oil and gas extraction, are beginning to play a significant role in triggering earthquakes in the central US.


Extracting oil and gas from shale rock involves cracking, or fracturing, a layer of underground rock with a high-pressure mix of water, sand, and chemicals. As the oil and gas are released, those injection fluids and briny water also come up. That wastewater is later disposed of in what are called injection wells, or sometimes disposal wells.


It is important to note that it is not the fracking process itself that usually causes these earthquakes; it is the rapid injection of fluid during wastewater disposal that sometimes pumps hundreds of millions of gallons of brine deep into the earth each year.

Content: Idadi ya matetemeko ya ardhi yanaongezeka katika mikoa yenye visima vya mafuta na gesi isiyo ya kawaida, ambapo maji yalisukuma kwa shinikizo kubwa huvunja mwamba ulio na gesi asilia, na kuacha maji machafu katika kuhitaji kutuliza. Keranen et al. Onyesha kwamba kuongezeka kwa mwinuko wa matetemeko ya ardhi huko Oklahoma, USA, kunaweza kusababishwa na uhamiaji wa maji kutoka kwa visima vya utupaji maji machafu. Asilimia ishirini ya matetemeko ya ardhi katika Amerika ya Kati yanaweza kuhusishwa na visima vinne tu. Title: Kwa nini shughuli za mafuta na gesi husababisha matetemeko ya ardhi? Na tunaweza kupunguza hatari? (www.iflscience.com)
Content: Utafiti pamoja na ripoti mbili zilizotolewa mnamo Aprili, zinaonyesha kuwa shughuli za wanadamu, pamoja na shughuli zinazohusiana na uchimbaji wa mafuta na gesi, zinaanza kuchukua jukumu kubwa katika kusababisha matetemeko ya ardhi huko Amerika ya Kati.


Kuondoa mafuta na gesi kutoka kwa mwamba wa shale ni pamoja na kupasuka, au kupasuka, safu ya mwamba wa chini ya ardhi na mchanganyiko wa maji, mchanga, na kemikali. Kama mafuta na gesi inavyotolewa, maji ya sindano na maji ya briny pia huja. Hiyo maji machafu hutolewa baadaye katika kile kinachoitwa visima vya sindano, au wakati mwingine visima vya utupaji.


Ni muhimu kutambua kuwa sio mchakato wa kuteleza yenyewe ambayo kawaida husababisha matetemeko haya; Ni sindano ya haraka ya maji wakati wa utupaji wa maji machafu ambayo wakati mwingine husukuma mamia ya mamilioni ya galoni za brine ndani ya dunia kila mwaka.

Document ID: 2
Title: Sharp increase in central Oklahoma seismicity since 2008 induced by massive wastewater injection (www.sciencemag.org)
Content: The number of earthquakes is increasing in regions with active unconventional oil and gas wells, where water pumped at high pressure breaks open rock containing natural gas, leaving behind wastewater in need of disposing. Keranen et al. show that the steep rise in earthquakes in Oklahoma, USA, is likely caused by fluid migration from wastewater disposal wells. Twenty percent of the earthquakes in the central United States could be attributed to just four of the wells. Injected fluids in high-volume wells triggered earthquakes over 30 km away.


Science, this issue p. 448

Document ID: 3
Title: Innocent Until Proven Guilty, But Only If You Can Pay – Reason.com (reason.com)
Content: When defendants are stuck in jail while awaiting trial, data indicate they're more likely to plead guilty or be found guilty of crimes. They're also likely to be given longer prison sentences. This is partly a result of their not being in a position to bargain with prosecutors, because they're stuck behind bars and desperate to move things along.

For low-level crimes, all that time spent in pretrial detention can be equivalent to the length of the sentence they'll get if they're found guilty anyway. A poor defendant who can't afford bail may spend days, even weeks, in jail waiting to see a judge for a crime where prison time might not even be required. At that point, it's hard to justify spending time or money fighting the charge, even if backing down leaves an innocent person with a criminal record.

"Everybody who works in the system knows that the assembly-line cash bail system coerces guilty pleas," says Civil Rights Corps founder and executive director Alec Karakatsanis. Because American courts don't have the manpower to prosecute and try every person who gets arrested, he argues, "the system needs a way to coerce them into pleading guilty. The most effective way is to keep them in jail."

Title: Why do video cables (DVI, VGA) still screw in? (superuser.com)
Content: A power cable has to carry a significantly higher amount of current than a video connector, so the conductors in your power cable are indeed proportionally thicker. Because of this, and due to the fact that we use metal for conductors, the physical strength of a standard power cable will be significantly higher than that of a video cable connector. Furthermore, it's much easier to damage the tiny pins on a VGA/DVI connector, whereas I'm sure most people would agree it's much harder to bend/twist a power connector (save for stepping on the thing).


Indeed, this is also the reason why many of these connectors still 'screw' into things. Of course it's not a huge deal if the cable falls out of the computer, which is also why you don't have to use the screws if you don't want to. However, it's usually safer to use them to prevent accidental disconnection (saves you the headache of checking behind your computer every time your monitor blanks out), and indeed, a typical VGA/DVI connector lacks the physical holding pressure a standard USB connector does.
---

prompt:

Title: Why Aren't Tires Made Of Solid Rubber Instead of Inflated Air? (www.autoexpose.org)
Content: However, tires made of solid rubber do not absorb vibrations as well as pneumatic tires. This is because the solid construction of the tires makes the tires have no medium to absorb shocks.

So that the solid rubber tire is not suitable for use in passenger cars that prioritize comfort.

Apart from that, there are other disadvantages. Tires made of solid rubber have a higher weight than pneumatic tires. The higher weight will increase the engine load to run the vehicle.

So that if a solid rubber tire is used in a passenger car, the car accelerates slowly and wastes fuel.

From this, it can be concluded that solid rubber is not suitable for use in vehicles operating on the road.
---

question_src: Je! Wanyama wanaonaje tetemeko la ardhi linalokuja?
report_src: Wanasayansi wanaona kuwa wanyama wengi hugundua wimbi dogo la P linalosafiri haraka na kufika sekunde chache kabla ya wimbi kubwa la S, hivyo kuwapa onyo la mapema kabla ya wanadamu kulihisi tetemeko la ardhi [4]. Mawimbi haya ya P ndiyo ya kwanza kurekodiwa kwenye seismograph na husafiri kupitia imara, kioevu au gesi kwa kasi kubwa, jambo linaloimarisha nafasi ya wanyama kuyatambua mapema [6]. Pia kuna nadharia kwamba baadhi ya viumbe huelewa mabadiliko madogo ya umeme angani au gesi zinazotoka ardhini, ishara ambazo huenda zinaashiria tetemeko linalokaribia [1]. Hata hivyo, tabia zisizo za kawaida za wanyama zinaweza pia kuchochewa na njaa, ulinzi wa makazi, msimu wa kupandana au hatari za wawindaji, hivyo kufanya uchunguzi uliodhibitiwa wa “utabiri” wa matetemeko kuwa mgumu sana kuthibitisha kisayansi [2].

Document ID: 2
Title: Je! Wanyama wanaweza kuhisi matetemeko ya ardhi? (www.nationalgeographic.com)
Content: "Wanyama huguswa na vitu vingi - kuwa na njaa, kutetea wilaya zao, kupandisha, wanyama wanaowinda -kwa hivyo ni ngumu kuwa na utafiti uliodhibitiwa kupata ishara hiyo ya tahadhari ya hali ya juu."

Title: Jinsi wanyama wanahisi matetemeko ya ardhi - Dunia katika Mpito (www.earthintransition.org)
Content: Uwezo mmoja ni kwamba wanyama fulani wanahisi tetemeko la ardhi lenyewe, hata ikiwa ni maelfu ya maili. Tunajua kuwa tembo hupitisha maarifa ambayo wamejifunza kutoka kizazi hadi kizazi. Document ID: 4
Title: Animals & Earthquake Prediction (www.usgs.gov)
Content: We can easily explain the cause of unusual animal behavior seconds before humans feel an earthquake. Very few humans notice the smaller P wave that travels the fastest from the earthquake source and arrives before the larger S wave. But many animals with more keen senses are able to feel the P wave seconds before the S wave arrives.

question_src: Je! Wanyama wanaonaje tetemeko la ardhi linalokuja?
report_src: Wanasayansi wanaona kuwa wanyama wengi hugundua wimbi dogo la P linalosafiri haraka na kufika sekunde chache kabla ya wimbi kubwa la S, hivyo kuwapa onyo la mapema kabla ya wanadamu kulihisi tetemeko la ardhi [4]. Mawimbi haya ya P ndiyo ya kwanza kurekodiwa kwenye seismograph na husafiri kupitia imara, kioevu au gesi kwa kasi kubwa, jambo linaloimarisha nafasi ya wanyama kuyatambua mapema [6]. Pia kuna nadharia kwamba baadhi ya viumbe huelewa mabadiliko madogo ya umeme angani au gesi zinazotoka ardhini, ishara ambazo huenda zinaashiria tetemeko linalokaribia [1]. Kwa tembo, ujuzi wa kihisia na kijamii unaweza kuongezwa kwenye hisia hizi, ambapo matriarki waliowahi kukumbana na majanga kama tsunami huwafundisha viungo wao kukimbilia maeneo ya juu wanapohisi mtikisiko wowote [3]. Hata hivyo, tabia zisizo za kawaida za wanyama zinaweza pia kuchochewa na njaa, ulinzi wa makazi, msimu wa kupandana au hatari za wawindaji, hivyo kufanya uchunguzi uliodhibitiwa wa “utabiri” wa matetemeko kuwa mgumu sana kuthibitisha kisayansi [2].

Kwa hiyo, vyombo vikuu havikuunda upendeleo baadaye bali vilizaliwa navyo, kisha vikabadili mbinu zao kadiri matarajio ya umma yalivyokua.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: A Brief History of Media Bias (www.hoover.org)
Content: The roots of media bias go back to the nineteenth century, and complaints about bias in part reflect a questionable idea about the media’s role and purpose: that newspapers and other dispensers of public information exist to transmit objective, factual information gleaned and communicated by credentialed professionals.


In fact, the notion that reporters should possess Olympian objectivity is relatively recent. In the nineteenth century, most newspapers were explicitly linked to a particular political party and the economic interests of the publisher.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Historia fupi ya upendeleo wa media (www.hoover.org)
Content: Tamaduni ya hisia za kupendeza, utapeli wa kashfa, na kuzidisha kuweka katika faida na ajenda ya kisiasa iliendelea katika "uandishi wa habari wa manjano" kwa kupendeza kwenye vita vya mzunguko kati ya magazeti ya Hearst na Pulitzer mwishoni mwa karne ya kumi na tisa. Kwa maana zaidi, hiyo pia ilikuwa wakati harakati zinazoendelea zilikuza wazo kwamba kazi sahihi ya vyombo vya habari ilikuwa kufundisha na kuunda maoni ya wapiga kura ambao hawajafahamu na wasio na imani kuaminiwa na kufanya chaguo sahihi kulingana na ukweli pekee.
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Je! Upendeleo wa media ni nini na inatoka wapi? (na picha) (www.infobloom.com)
Content: Karibu haiwezekani kwa mtandao wowote au uchapishaji wa uandishi wa habari kutoshtakiwa kwa upendeleo. Vitu vya hila kama chaguo la maneno, mipaka ya wakati kwenye programu, na wadhamini wanaweza kupendekeza kwamba shirika sio upande wowote. Kila mtu ambaye anaripoti au anaandika habari pia lazima afanye bidii kujilinda dhidi ya kufunua maoni yake mwenyewe. Maoni haya yanaweza kufunua upendeleo kupitia uchaguzi wa maneno au inflections na sauti ya sauti wakati wa kutoa habari.


[Picha: Media mara nyingi huelezewa kama upendeleo.] Media mara nyingi huelezewa kuwa ya upendeleo.


Njia moja ya upendeleo wa media ni kutofaulu kujumuisha maoni anuwai kwenye hadithi. Mara nyingi, hii inaweza kutazamwa kama inashindwa kujumuisha maoni tofauti, lakini haiwezekani kujumuisha maoni yote juu ya suala fulani, kwani watu wanakaribia maswala kutoka kwa mwelekeo zaidi ya mbili. Kwa mfano, wale ambao ni wa vyama vya siasa vya Fringe kama Wahusika au Chama cha Kijani, mara nyingi wanahisi maoni yao hayawakilishwa vya kutosha katika uandishi wa habari.


[Picha: Njia moja ya upendeleo wa media ni kutofaulu kujumuisha maoni anuwai kwenye hadithi.] Aina moja ya upendeleo wa media ni kutofaulu kujumuisha maoni tofauti kwenye hadithi.


Kukosa hii kuwakilisha pande zote za hadithi kunaweza kuwa sio upendeleo wa kukusudia. Hadithi za habari zinaweza kuwa hazina wakati wa kufunika maoni yote, na zinaweza kushikamana na "pande" za kawaida, kama vile kushoto na kulia, katika jaribio la kukomesha upendeleo wa media. Vyombo vya habari bado vinaweza kupendelea kwa kuwa haiwezi kuwakilisha maoni yote.

Kwa mfano, wale ambao ni wa vyama vya siasa vya Fringe kama Wahusika au Chama cha Kijani, mara nyingi wanahisi maoni yao hayawakilishwa vya kutosha katika uandishi wa habari.

Title: What is Media Bias and Where does It Come from? (with pictures) (www.infobloom.com)
Content: It is almost impossible for any network or journalistic publication not to be accused of some bias. Subtle things like word choice, time limits on programming, and sponsors may all suggest that the organization isn't neutral. Each individual who reports or writes the news also has to work hard to guard against revealing his or her own opinions. These opinions can reveal bias simply through word choice or inflections and tone of voice when delivering news.


[Image: The media is often described as biased.] The media is often described as biased.


One form of media bias is the failure to include varied points of view on a story. Often, this may be viewed as failing to include the opposite viewpoint, but it would be virtually impossible to include all viewpoints on a particular issue, since people approach issues from more than two directions. For example, those belonging to fringe political parties like the Libertarians or Green Party, often feel their viewpoint is not adequately represented in journalism.


[Image: One form of media bias is the failure to include varied points of view on a story.] One form of media bias is the failure to include varied points of view on a story.


This failure to represent all sides of the story may not be intentional bias, however. News stories may simply not have the time to cover all points of view, and may stick to classic “sides,” such as left and right, in an attempt to curb media bias. The media can still technically be biased since it cannot represent all points of view.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Understanding the Monty Hall Problem – BetterExplained (betterexplained.com)
Content: The Monty Hall problem is a counter-intuitive statistics puzzle:


* There are 3 doors, behind which are two goats and a car.
* You pick a door (call it door A). You’re hoping for the car of course.
* Monty Hall, the game show host, examines the other doors (B & C) and opens one with a goat. (If both doors have goats, he picks randomly.)


Here’s the game: Do you stick with door A (original guess) or switch to the unopened door? Does it matter?


Surprisingly, the odds aren’t 50-50. If you switch doors you’ll win 2/3 of the time!


Today let’s get an intuition for why a simple game could be so baffling. The game is really about re-evaluating your decisions as new information emerges.


## Play the game


You’re probably muttering that two doors mean it’s a 50-50 chance. Ok bub, let’s play the game:


Try playing the game 50 times, using a “pick and hold” strategy. Just pick door 1 (or 2, or 3) and keep clicking. Click click click. Look at your percent win rate. You’ll see it settle around 1/3.


Now reset and play it 20 times, using a “pick and switch” approach. Pick a door, Monty reveals a goat (grey door), and you switch to the other. Look at your win rate. Is it above 50% Is it closer to 60%? To 66%?


There’s a chance the stay-and-hold strategy does decent on a small number of trials (under 20 or so). If you had a coin, how many flips would you need to convince yourself it was fair? You might get 2 heads in a row and think it was rigged. Just play the game a few dozen times to even it out and reduce the noise.


## Understanding Why Switching Works


That’s the hard (but convincing) way of realizing switching works. Here’s an easier way:


If I pick a door and hold, I have a 1/3 chance of winning.
---

Bora ninayoweza kufanya na chaguo langu la asili ni 1 kati ya 3. Mlango mwingine lazima uwe na nafasi zingine, au 2/3.


Maelezo yanaweza kuwa ya maana, lakini haelezei kwa nini tabia mbaya "inakuwa bora" kwa upande mwingine. (Wasomaji kadhaa wameacha maelezo yao wenyewe kwenye maoni - jaribu ikiwa 1/3 inabaki vs 2/3 haina kubonyeza).

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Kuelewa Tatizo la Ukumbi wa Monty - BetterExplained (BetterExplained.com)
Content: Shida ya Ukumbi wa Monty ni puzzle ya takwimu-za kawaida:


* Kuna milango 3, nyuma ambayo ni mbuzi wawili na gari.
* Unachagua mlango (iite mlango a). Unatarajia gari bila shaka.
* Monty Hall, mwenyeji wa mchezo wa kuonyesha, anachunguza milango mingine (B&C) na kufungua moja na mbuzi. (Ikiwa milango yote miwili ina mbuzi, yeye huchukua nasibu.)


Hapa kuna mchezo: Je! Unashikamana na mlango A (nadhani ya asili) au ubadilishe kwa mlango ambao haujapangwa? Inajali?


Kwa kushangaza, tabia mbaya sio 50-50. Ukibadilisha milango utashinda 2/3 ya wakati!


Leo wacha tupate maoni kwa nini mchezo rahisi unaweza kuwa ngumu sana. Mchezo ni kweli juu ya kutathmini tena maamuzi yako wakati habari mpya inaibuka.


## Cheza mchezo


Labda unatetemeka kwamba milango miwili inamaanisha ni nafasi 50-50. Sawa, wacha tucheze mchezo:


Jaribu kucheza mchezo mara 50, ukitumia mkakati wa "chagua na kushikilia". Chagua mlango 1 (au 2, au 3) na endelea kubonyeza. Bonyeza bonyeza. Angalia kiwango chako cha kushinda asilimia. Utaona inakaa karibu 1/3.


Sasa weka upya na uicheze mara 20, ukitumia njia ya "chagua na ubadili". Chagua mlango, Monty anafunua mbuzi (mlango wa kijivu), na unabadilisha kwa mwingine. Angalia kiwango chako cha kushinda. Je! Ni zaidi ya 50% ni karibu na 60%? Hadi 66%?


Kuna nafasi mkakati wa kukaa na kushikilia hufanya kwa heshima juu ya idadi ndogo ya majaribio (chini ya miaka 20 au zaidi). Ikiwa ulikuwa na sarafu, ungehitaji kujishawishi ni sawa? Unaweza kupata vichwa 2 mfululizo na ufikirie ilikuwa ngumu. Cheza tu mchezo mara kadhaa ili hata nje na kupunguza kelele.


## Kuelewa kwa nini kubadili hufanya kazi


Hiyo ndiyo njia ngumu (lakini yenye kushawishi) ya kutambua kazi za kubadili. Hapa kuna njia rahisi:


Ikiwa nitachagua mlango na kushikilia, nina nafasi 1/3 ya kushinda.
---

Title: Understanding the Monty Hall Problem – BetterExplained (betterexplained.com)
Content: If I pick a door and hold, I have a 1/3 chance of winning.


My first guess is 1 in 3 — there are 3 random options, right?


If I rigidly stick with my first choice no matter what, I can’t improve my chances. Monty could add 50 doors, blow the other ones up, do a voodoo rain dance — it doesn’t matter. The best I can do with my original choice is 1 in 3. The other door must have the rest of the chances, or 2/3.


The explanation may make sense, but doesn’t explain why the odds “get better” on the other side. (Several readers have left their own explanations in the comments — try them out if the 1/3 stay vs 2/3 switch doesn’t click).

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Understanding the Monty Hall Problem – BetterExplained (betterexplained.com)
Content: The Monty Hall problem is a counter-intuitive statistics puzzle:


* There are 3 doors, behind which are two goats and a car.
* You pick a door (call it door A). You’re hoping for the car of course.
* Monty Hall, the game show host, examines the other doors (B & C) and opens one with a goat. (If both doors have goats, he picks randomly.)


Here’s the game: Do you stick with door A (original guess) or switch to the unopened door? Does it matter?


Surprisingly, the odds aren’t 50-50. If you switch doors you’ll win 2/3 of the time!


Today let’s get an intuition for why a simple game could be so baffling. The game is really about re-evaluating your decisions as new information emerges.


## Play the game


You’re probably muttering that two doors mean it’s a 50-50 chance. Ok bub, let’s play the game:


Try playing the game 50 times, using a “pick and hold” strategy. Just pick door 1 (or 2, or 3) and keep clicking. Click click click. Look at your percent win rate. You’ll see it settle around 1/3.


Now reset and play it 20 times, using a “pick and switch” approach. Pick a door, Monty reveals a goat (grey door), and you switch to the other. Look at your win rate. Is it above 50% Is it closer to 60%? To 66%?


There’s a chance the stay-and-hold strategy does decent on a small number of trials (under 20 or so). If you had a coin, how many flips would you need to convince yourself it was fair? You might get 2 heads in a row and think it was rigged. Just play the game a few dozen times to even it out and reduce the noise.


## Understanding Why Switching Works


That’s the hard (but convincing) way of realizing switching works. Here’s an easier way:


If I pick a door and hold, I have a 1/3 chance of winning.
---

Bora ninayoweza kufanya na chaguo langu la asili ni 1 kati ya 3. Mlango mwingine lazima uwe na nafasi zingine, au 2/3.

Miongoni mwa watangazaji, kufuata kwa GA kunatekelezwa kwa ukali kwenye ngazi ya mkoa; Anchors za mitaa huwa rundo la rununu sana, kwa hivyo kuna motisha kwa mwandishi wa kuzaliwa wa Texas anayetafuta kazi katika soko la kaskazini, kwa mfano, kuzima droo.
---
Document ID: 2
Title: Why Do News Anchors All Talk the Same? (www.nbcnews.com)
Content: Most broadcaster training programs offer courses devoted to teaching future announcers how to speak in that instantly recognizable style.


The main quality of "the voice" is that it must contain no traces of regionalism, said Amy Caples, a former news anchor who teaches voice classes in the broadcasting program at Temple University in Philadelphia.


"The thing about working on TV in news, sports or entertainment is it's a very vagabond lifestyle, and if you're going to be successful at it, you'll be moving all over the place. To get a job somewhere you have to sound literally like you're from nowhere," Caples told Life's Little Mysteries. "They're not going to hire you in Yuma, Arizona, if you talk like you're from the Bronx."


Another reason why news anchors share speech patterns is that they are all taught to use standard broadcasting English, a form of pronunciation in which no letters are dropped. For example, they must always say "fishing," not "fishin'." They also speak more slowly than people do in daily life in order to be easily understandable, Caples said.


There's the added fact that most broadcasters are emulating the voices of their role models, and so speech patterns get passed down. "I think there's a lot of patterning," she said. "If you've grown up listening to a certain anchor, or admire someone on TV, then there's a subconscious effort to mirror that. A lot of women want to sound like Oprah, for example; she has a great voice."
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Kwa nini habari nyingi za nanga zinasikika sawa? (www.mentalfloss.com)
Content: Baadhi ya nanga pia wameripoti kuwa waangalifu zaidi na hotuba yao kwa sababu maikrofoni ya matangazo mara nyingi huwa haisamehe. Maneno yanayoanza na P huwa na pop, kwa mfano. Matangazo ya shule huonyesha aina ya sauti ya kawaida na ya kuongea ambayo haitafsiri vizuri kwa utangazaji.


Kwa kweli, wataalam wengine wa lugha wanaamini hakuna kitu kama kuwa huru kabisa kwa lafudhi. Southerner inayojaribu kuondoa athari yoyote ya droo itaonekana tofauti na mtu kutoka New England kujaribu kufanya vivyo hivyo. Labda hatuwezi kugundua kwa sababu wanadamu sio mzuri sana kwa kutambua lafudhi za hila zaidi, haswa yetu. Matangazo yanaweza kusikika sawa kwa sehemu kubwa kwa sababu wote hutamka na kujaribu kufikia usahihi wa kuelezea. Nanga chache zitasema "Dubya." Watasema "mara mbili-wewe." Lakini hiyo mara kwa mara "Dubya" ndio hufanya mifumo ya hotuba ionekane kuwa tofauti.
---

Title: Why Do Newscasters All Talk the Same? - Washington City Paper (washingtoncitypaper.com)
Content: We can expect to hear General American for a while. Mass communication may be slowing what would otherwise be natural evolutions in the way people speak; nobody in the U.S. lives in geographical isolation anymore if they’ve got a TV or computer, which helps GA in its hegemony. Among newscasters, GA conformity is rigidly enforced on the regional level; local anchors tend to be a highly mobile bunch, so there’s incentive for a Texas-born reporter looking for work in a northern market, for example, to ditch the drawl.

Document ID: 2
Title: Kwa nini habari za nanga zote zinazungumza sawa? (www.nbcnews.com)
Content: Programu nyingi za mafunzo ya utangazaji hutoa kozi zilizojitolea kufundisha watangazaji wa siku zijazo jinsi ya kuongea katika mtindo huo unaotambulika mara moja.


Ubora kuu wa "Sauti" ni kwamba haifai kuwa na athari za ukabila, alisema Amy Caples, nanga wa zamani wa habari ambaye hufundisha madarasa ya sauti katika mpango wa utangazaji katika Chuo Kikuu cha Temple huko Philadelphia.


"Jambo juu ya kufanya kazi kwenye Runinga katika habari, michezo au burudani ni mtindo wa maisha wa Vagabond, na ikiwa utafanikiwa kwake, utakuwa unasonga mahali pote. Ili kupata kazi mahali pengine lazima usikie kama wewe ni kutoka mahali popote," Caples aliwaambia Siri ya Maisha. "Hawatakuajiri huko Yuma, Arizona, ikiwa unazungumza kama unatoka Bronx."


Sababu nyingine ambayo habari za nanga zinashiriki mifumo ya hotuba ni kwamba wote wanafundishwa kutumia kiwango cha utangazaji cha Kiingereza, aina ya matamshi ambayo hakuna herufi yoyote iliyoshuka. Kwa mfano, lazima kila wakati waseme "uvuvi," sio "samaki '." Pia wanazungumza polepole zaidi kuliko watu hufanya katika maisha ya kila siku ili kueleweka kwa urahisi, Caples alisema.


Kuna ukweli ulioongezwa kuwa watangazaji wengi wanatoa sauti za mifano yao, na kwa hivyo mifumo ya hotuba hupitishwa. "Nadhani kuna mengi ya patterning," alisema. "Ikiwa umekua ukisikiliza nanga fulani, au kumpongeza mtu kwenye Runinga, basi kuna juhudi ndogo ya kuonyesha hiyo. Wanawake wengi wanataka kusikika kama Oprah, kwa mfano; ana sauti kubwa."

Document ID: 2
Title: Why Do News Anchors All Talk the Same? (www.nbcnews.com)
Content: Most broadcaster training programs offer courses devoted to teaching future announcers how to speak in that instantly recognizable style.


The main quality of "the voice" is that it must contain no traces of regionalism, said Amy Caples, a former news anchor who teaches voice classes in the broadcasting program at Temple University in Philadelphia.


"The thing about working on TV in news, sports or entertainment is it's a very vagabond lifestyle, and if you're going to be successful at it, you'll be moving all over the place. To get a job somewhere you have to sound literally like you're from nowhere," Caples told Life's Little Mysteries. "They're not going to hire you in Yuma, Arizona, if you talk like you're from the Bronx."


Another reason why news anchors share speech patterns is that they are all taught to use standard broadcasting English, a form of pronunciation in which no letters are dropped. For example, they must always say "fishing," not "fishin'." They also speak more slowly than people do in daily life in order to be easily understandable, Caples said.


There's the added fact that most broadcasters are emulating the voices of their role models, and so speech patterns get passed down. "I think there's a lot of patterning," she said. "If you've grown up listening to a certain anchor, or admire someone on TV, then there's a subconscious effort to mirror that. A lot of women want to sound like Oprah, for example; she has a great voice."
---

claim: TV za Plasma hutumia mifuko ya gesi ambayo inapogeuzwa plasma na voltage, huchochea fosforasi nyekundu, kijani na bluu ndani ya kila pikseli kutoa mwanga wake moja kwa moja, hivyo hazihitaji taa ya nyuma na zinapata weusi bora kwa kuwa kila pikseli inaweza kuzimika kabisa
question_src: Je! Ni tofauti gani kati ya LED, LCD, plasma na TV za LCD za LCD?
report_src: TV za Plasma hutumia mifuko ya gesi ambayo inapogeuzwa plasma na voltage, huchochea fosforasi nyekundu, kijani na bluu ndani ya kila pikseli kutoa mwanga wake moja kwa moja, hivyo hazihitaji taa ya nyuma na zinapata weusi bora kwa kuwa kila pikseli inaweza kuzimika kabisa [1]. TV za LCD za jadi hutumia paneli ya kioo kiwanja kinachozungusha fuwele kuruhusu au kuzuia mwanga kutoka kwa taa za nyuma za baridi-cathode fluorescent (CCFL); pikseli haziwezi kujitoa mwanga, hivyo weusi hutegemea kuziba mwanga badala ya kuuzima [2]. LED TV kimsingi ni LCD ile ile lakini badala ya CCFL hutumia taa ndogo nyingi za LED kando ya kingo au nyuma ya jopo, jambo linaloongeza ufanisi wa nishati, mwangaza na udhibiti wa maeneo meusi kwa sababu safu ya LED inaweza kudhibitiwa kwa sehemu (local dimming) [3]. Tofauti kuu kati ya LED na LCD za CCFL basi ni aina ya chanzo cha mwanga: LED ni ndogo, yenye ufanisi na inayowezesha miundo nyembamba zaidi ikilinganishwa na zilizopo ndefu za CCFL katika LCD za jadi [4]. Kwa muhtasari, Plasma ni “self-emissive”, LCD na LED ni “backlit”, huku LED ikiwa toleo lililoboreshwa la LCD kutokana na matumizi ya LED badala ya CCFL.

Content: Plasma TVs contain tiny pockets of gas, and when a voltage is applied to them, they turn into a plasma state. The voltage then strikes the mercury within the plasma to emit ultraviolet (UV) rays, which pass through phosphor cells to produce an image. Each pixel in the TV contains three phosphor cells: red, green, and blue, and these three colors combine to produce a color. Essentially, plasma TVs don't require a backlight, and each pixel is self-emissive as it produces its own light.

Wakati taa imewashwa, inatumika kwa voltage kwa saizi, ambayo inawafanya wazungushe njia fulani ya kuruhusu mwanga kupitia na kutoa picha. Wakati inataka kuonyesha nyeusi, saizi zinazungushwa ili kuunda skrini ya opaque ili mwanga usipitie. Hii ndio inawafanya kuwa tofauti na Televisheni za plasma kwa sababu kila pixel haitoi mwenyewe.

Document ID: 3
Title: Plasma vs LED vs LCD TVS (www.rtings.com)
Content: Televisheni za kutoa mwanga (LED) ni sawa na Televisheni za jadi za LCD, lakini badala ya kutumia taa za nyuma za CCFL, hutumia taa nyingi ndogo za LED. Inazalisha picha kwa njia ile ile kama TV ya kawaida ya LCD kwa sababu bado hutumia jopo la LCD, lakini ina udhibiti zaidi juu ya mwangaza. LED zinaweza kuwekwa kando ya kingo, ambazo huitwa Edge-LIT LED, au juu ya jopo la nyuma, ambalo linaitwa moja kwa moja LED au taa kamili ya safu. Unaweza kuona tofauti kati ya LCD na TV za LED hapa chini.

claim: Mnamo 1952, Stanley Miller alionyesha kuwa mazingira ya Dunia ya awali yenye maji ya kuchemsha, hidrojeni, amonia, methani na umeme yangeweza kutengeneza molekuli hai kutoka kemikali rahisi [1]; baada ya wiki alipata asidi amino glycine na alanine, vizuizi vya protini msingi wa uhai
question_src: Je! Mageuzi hufanyikaje na viumbe vya kwanza vya kuishi vilitokeaje
report_src: Mnamo 1952, Stanley Miller alionyesha kuwa mazingira ya Dunia ya awali yenye maji ya kuchemsha, hidrojeni, amonia, methani na umeme yangeweza kutengeneza molekuli hai kutoka kemikali rahisi [1]; baada ya wiki alipata asidi amino glycine na alanine, vizuizi vya protini msingi wa uhai [2]. Molekuli kama hizi ziliungana na kuunda protocell zilizoweza kujirudia, na mageuzi yakaanza kupitia mabadiliko ya kinasaba na uteuzi asilia—viumbe waliokuwa na sifa zinazoongeza uhai na uzazi walibakia. Takribani miaka bilioni 2.4 iliyopita, cyanobacteria zilibuni fotosintesi na kuachilia oksijeni nyingi, kubadilisha anga na kuruhusu viumbe vinavyohitaji oksijeni kustawi [3]. Baadaye, baadhi ya vijidudu waliingia na kuishi ndani ya wengine, wakawa mitochondria, huku DNA ikifungashwa kwenye kiini na kuanzisha seli za eukaryoti zenye viungo maalum vya ndani [4]. Seli hizi tata zilianza kuishi pamoja, kugawana kazi, na hatimaye, takriban miaka milioni 800 iliyopita, vikundi hivi vya seli maalumu viligeuka kuwa wanyama wa kwanza, wakionyesha hatua muhimu ya mageuzi kuelekea viumbe changamano [4]. Hivyo, mageuzi hutokea kama mlolongo wa mabadiliko madogo yanayokusanywa kwa muda mrefu, kutoka molekuli hadi viumbe wenye miili tata.

prompt:
Information: Document ID: 1
Title: Siri ya Jinsi Maisha Duniani Alianza (www.bbc.com)
Content: Mnamo 1952, Miller alianza majaribio maarufu juu ya asili ya maisha yaliyowahi kujaribu.

Usanidi ulikuwa rahisi. Miller aliunganisha safu ya glasi za glasi na kusambaza kemikali nne ambazo alishuku zilikuwepo kwenye Dunia ya mapema: maji ya kuchemsha, gesi ya hidrojeni, amonia na methane. Aliweka gesi kwa mshtuko wa umeme unaorudiwa, kuiga mgomo wa umeme ambao ungekuwa tukio la kawaida duniani zamani sana
---
Document ID: 2
Title: The secret of how life on Earth began (www.bbc.com)
Content: Miller found that "the water in the flask became noticeably pink after the first day, and by the end of the week the solution was deep red and turbid". Clearly, a mix of chemicals had formed.

When Miller analysed the mixture he found that it contained two amino acids: glycine and alanine. Amino acids are often described as the building blocks of life. They are used to form the proteins that control most biochemical processes in our bodies. Miller had made two of life's most important components, from scratch
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Historia ya Maisha Duniani (Naturalhistory.si.edu)
Content: Wakati cyanobacteria ilibadilika angalau miaka bilioni 2.4 iliyopita, waliweka hatua ya mabadiliko ya kushangaza. Wakawa picha za kwanza za picha za Dunia, na kutengeneza chakula kwa kutumia maji na nishati ya jua, na kutoa oksijeni kama matokeo. Hii ilichochea kuongezeka kwa oksijeni ghafla, na kuifanya mazingira kuwa ya ukarimu kwa vijidudu vingine ambavyo havikuweza kuvumilia oksijeni
---
Document ID: 4
Title: Historia ya Maisha Duniani (Naturalhistory.si.edu)
Content: Wakati wanaweza kusindika kemikali nyingi, vijidudu havikuwa na seli maalum ambazo zinahitajika kwa miili ngumu. Miili ya wanyama ina seli tofauti -Skin, damu, mfupa - ambayo ina organelles, kila mmoja akifanya kazi tofauti. Microbes ni seli moja tu bila organelles na hakuna kiini cha kusambaza DNA yao.

Kitu cha mapinduzi kilitokea wakati vijidudu vilianza kuishi ndani ya vijidudu vingine, wakifanya kazi kama organelles kwao. Mitochondria, viumbe ambavyo vinasindika chakula ndani ya nishati, vilitokea kutoka kwa uhusiano huu wenye faida. Pia, kwa mara ya kwanza, DNA iliwekwa vifurushi katika kiini. Seli mpya tata ("seli za eukaryotic") zilijivunia sehemu maalum zinazocheza majukumu maalum ambayo yalisaidia seli nzima.

Seli pia zilianza kuishi pamoja, labda kwa sababu faida fulani zinaweza kupatikana. Vikundi vya seli vinaweza kulisha kwa ufanisi zaidi au kupata kinga kutoka kwa kuwa kubwa tu. Kuishi kwa pamoja, seli zilianza kusaidia mahitaji ya kikundi na kila seli kufanya kazi fulani. Seli zingine zilipewa jukumu la kutengeneza viunga vya kushikilia kikundi pamoja, wakati seli zingine zilifanya enzymes za kumengenya ambazo zinaweza kuvunja chakula.

## Wanyama wa kwanza

Vikundi hivi vya seli maalum, za kushirikiana mwishowe zikawa wanyama wa kwanza, ambao ushahidi wa DNA unaonyesha ilibadilika karibu miaka milioni 800 iliyopita

claim: Sekunde ya SI ni muda sahihi wa vipindi 9 192 631 770 vya mionzi inayotokana na mpito wa viwango viwili vya hyperfine katika hali ya msingi ya atomi ya sesiamu-133
question_src: Sekunde ni ya muda gani? Gramu ni nzito kiasi gani? Je! Mita iko umbali gani? Ni nani aliyekuja na ufafanuzi huu, na ni nini kinaongoza kwao kuwa sanifu?
report_src: Sekunde ya SI ni muda sahihi wa vipindi 9 192 631 770 vya mionzi inayotokana na mpito wa viwango viwili vya hyperfine katika hali ya msingi ya atomi ya sesiamu-133 [1]. Gramu, kizio cha mfumo metriki, ni elfu moja (1 × 10⁻³) ya kilogramu; kilogramu hufafanuliwa kwa kuweka thamani ya mara kwa mara ya Planck kuwa 6.626 070 071 × 10⁻³⁴ J s, hivyo gramu huzidi takriban 0.001 kg [3]. Mita sasa ni umbali ambao mwanga husafiri katika ombwe kwa sekunde 1/299 792 458, kipimo kinachohusishwa na saa ya atomiki ya sesiamu-133 [2]. Ufafanuzi huu unafuata mabadiliko kadhaa: Wafaransa waliipendekeza mita mnamo miaka ya 1790 kama sehemu ya kumi-milioni ya robo ya meridiani ya Dunia kupitia Paris na baadaye iliwekewa upau wa platinamu-iridiamu uliohifadhiwa na Ofisi ya Kimataifa ya Uzito na Vipimo (BIPM) iliyoanzishwa 1875 [2]. BIPM pamoja na Mkutano Mkuu wa Vipimo (CGPM) huweka na kusasisha vipimo hivi ili vitegemee viambatisho vya kimsingi vya asili—mionzi ya sesiamu, kasi ya mwanga na mara kwa mara ya Planck—ambavyo havibadiliki na vinaweza kurudiwa mahali popote, hivyo kuimarisha usanifu wa vipimo duniani.
all_claims: Sekunde ya SI ni muda sahihi wa vipindi 9 192 631 770 vya mionzi inayotokana na mpito wa viwango viwili vya hyperfine katika hali ya msingi ya atomi ya sesiamu-133 [1].

Document ID: 3
Title: Gram (en.wikipedia.org)
Content: The gram (alternative spelling: gramme;[1] SI unit symbol: g) is a metric system unit of mass.

Originally defined as "the absolute weight of a volume of pure water equal to the cube of the hundredth part of a metre [1 cm^3], and at the temperature of melting ice"[2] (later at 4 °C, the temperature of maximum density of water). However, in a reversal of reference and defined units, a gram is now defined as one thousandth of the SI base unit, the kilogram, or 1×10−3 kg, which itself is defined by the International Bureau of Weights and Measures, not in terms of grams, but by taking the fixed numerical value of the Planck constant h to be 6.626 070 15×10−34 kg⋅m^2⋅s−1

Document ID: 2
Title: The Standard Meter (surveyhistory.org)
Content: The French originated the meter in the 1790s as one/ten-millionth of the distance from the equator to the north pole along a meridian through Paris. It is realistically represented by the distance between two marks on an iron bar kept in Paris. The International Bureau of Weights and Measures, created in 1875, upgraded the bar to one made of 90 percent platinum/10 percent iridium alloy.

In 1960 the meter was redefined as 1,650,763.73 wavelengths of orange-red light, in a vacuum, produced by burning the element krypton (Kr-86). More recently (1984), the Geneva Conference on Weights and Measures has defined the meter as the distance light travels, in a vacuum, in 1/299,792,458 seconds with time measured by a cesium-133 atomic clock which emits pulses of radiation at very rapid, regular intervals
---
Document ID: 3
Title: Gramu (en.wikipedia.org)
Content: Gram (spelling mbadala: Gramme; [1] SI Kitengo Alama: G) ni kitengo cha mfumo wa metric.

Document ID: 2
Title: The Standard Meter (surveyhistory.org)
Content: The French originated the meter in the 1790s as one/ten-millionth of the distance from the equator to the north pole along a meridian through Paris. It is realistically represented by the distance between two marks on an iron bar kept in Paris. The International Bureau of Weights and Measures, created in 1875, upgraded the bar to one made of 90 percent platinum/10 percent iridium alloy.

In 1960 the meter was redefined as 1,650,763.73 wavelengths of orange-red light, in a vacuum, produced by burning the element krypton (Kr-86). More recently (1984), the Geneva Conference on Weights and Measures has defined the meter as the distance light travels, in a vacuum, in 1/299,792,458 seconds with time measured by a cesium-133 atomic clock which emits pulses of radiation at very rapid, regular intervals
---

Title: Gramu (en.wikipedia.org)
Content: Gram (spelling mbadala: Gramme; [1] SI Kitengo Alama: G) ni kitengo cha mfumo wa metric.

Hapo awali hufafanuliwa kama "uzani kabisa wa kiasi cha maji safi sawa na mchemraba wa sehemu ya mia ya mita [1 cm^3], na kwa joto la barafu kuyeyuka" [2] (baadaye saa 4 ° C, joto la kiwango cha juu cha maji). Walakini, katika mabadiliko ya kumbukumbu na vitengo vilivyofafanuliwa, gramu sasa inaelezewa kama elfu moja ya kitengo cha msingi cha SI, kilo, au kilo 1 × 10−3, ambayo yenyewe hufafanuliwa na Ofisi ya Kimataifa ya Uzito na Vipimo, sio kwa Grams, lakini kwa kuchukua thamani ya nambari ya PLANCK mara kwa mara kuwa 6.626 070 0710 0710 0.

Title: Why do dogs shake their legs? (www.animalplanet.com)
Content: Dogs shake or kick their legs when you scratch them because of something known as the scratch reflex. It's a completely involuntary reaction, which explains why your dog may look as puzzled as you do when it starts to happen. When you scratch or tickle your dog's belly, it irritates him, much the same way that the wind or a bug might. It activates nerves under his skin that are connected to his spinal cord and relays a message to his leg muscles to kick in an attempt to get rid of the irritant.

question_src: Kwa nini kinywa changu wakati mwingine hunyunyiza mshono wakati mimi huamka?
